loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros A. is from the village of Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 45 years old and a single mother of six school-aged children. To make a living, Milagros owns and operates a business venture in the food sector in which she produces and sells food especially vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from ambulant vegetable vending. When afternoon comes, all her commodities are sold out. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Milagros joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan from ASKI which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 11,000 PHP will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan that Milagros has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en:
Baktygul S., 57, is the leader of this group. Her kids are already adults and are capable to provide for their own expenses. Baktygul’s daughter works in a computer club, and her son is a constructor. Baktygul is divorced and the burden of running the business completely lies on her shoulders. Her son makes his best effort to help Baktygul in business. Their business of growing potatoes brought good results and her son decided to devote his entire time to farming also. They are currently growing only potatoes, but with the money received from this loan, she plans to start growing wheat. Baktygul believes that she will succeed in her business and help her children find their own paths in life. 

Jidegul A., 41. She has four children, the youngest is six years old. She is involved in growing clover. She applied for this loan in hopes of buying barley seeds and broaden her business. Soon she plans to arrange a wedding ceremony for her son and provide her children with high quality education.

Myskal T., 24, is a member of this group. She is divorced and has a five year old daughter. The purpose of Myskal’s applying for this loan is to purchase a refrigerator and soon perhaps an automobile. 

Nurgul M., 41, is married and has three sons. Her husband is a mechanic and she herself is planning to start engaging in cattle breeding. Nurgul hopes that this loan will help her to purchase cattle and broaden her business and get an automobile for her husband in the near future. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase seeds of wheat

loans.name: Abizeranye Group

texts.fr: Joël Ndagimana est un membre du groupe Abizeranye, et il vend les montures de lunettes et les téléphones portables.  Il a 36 ans, marie, et il a 5 enfants entre 3 ans et 13 ans.  Quatre de ses enfants vont à l'école.  Avec son prêt, il veut acheter une machine à couper les vitres des lunettes, une machine à nettoyer les vitres des lunettes, et les montures a verres des lunettes.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l'affaire est d'accroitre son business en achetant les matériels plus compétent, acheter de grands machines a nettoyer a grande capacités, acheter beaucoup de montures des lunettes classiques, et louer un endroit ou il y a un espace suffisant pour accueille beaucoup de clients. Il a quelques visions pour son business, comme élever le stock de ses produits, avoir des machines suffisants et d’une bonne compétence, et avoir un comptoir pour son commerce.  Ses ambitions pour sa famille sont d'améliorer leur bien-être, une bonne alimentation, et d'avoir un bon logement pour eux.
texts.en: Joël Ndagimana is a member of the Abizeranye group and he sells spectacle frames and mobile telephones. He is 36 years old, married and has five children between the ages of three and thirteen years old. Four of his children go to school. With his loan he wants to buy a machine for cutting spectacle lenses, a machine for cleaning spectacle lenses, and glass spectacle frames. His strategy for expanding his business is to buy better quality equipment, as well as large machines for large-scale cleaning, to buy a large amount of classic spectacle frames and to rent a place with sufficient space to cater for a large number of customers. He has several ambitions for his business, such as increasing his stock, having sufficient good quality machines, as well as having a counter for his sales. His personal ambition is to improve his family's well-being and to provide them with good food and housing.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for cutting spectacle lenses

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en:
Kuch S., 25, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. S. is a hairdresser and also prepares fabrics at home, earning an income of about USD 5 per day. Her husband is a driver, earning an income of about USD 4 per day. 

S. has to spend USD 75 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more fabrics to prepare for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more fabrics to prepare for sale

loans.name: Mang's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of five people who live in Preaek Samraong village in Kandal province. The members plan to use the loans they obtain for different purposes.

All the members of the group have selected Mrs. Mang S. as group leader. Born in 1955, she is a vice village chief and a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows beans and sapota (a fruit) to sell to support her family. She faces an obstacle because her field has lots of insects. To improve production, Mrs. Mang S. is asking for a loan to buy pesticide to protect her bean field. She is a widow with a child who is a teacher.

loans.use: to buy pesticide

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a 28 year old married man with a child, living in Fort Portal Uganda. His dream is to buy land for the family. He deals in a number of businesses such as poultry keeping, a retail shop, and motorcycle transport. Joshua needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for the transport business.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Orlando De Jesus

texts.es:
MICROEMPRESARIO: ORLANDO DE JESUS V. P.


Orlando de Jesús después de muchos años de desempeñarse como vigilante en la ciudad de Cali, queda sin empleo y regresa a Medellín a donde su familia para empezar de cero.

Luego de varios meses Orlando no consigue donde emplearse y decide comprar una bolsa de azúcar, hielo y unos limones para hacer limonada y venderla en la ciclovía.

Pasaron los meses y actualmente Orlando diariamente no solo vende limonada sino también otros productos, es por esto que requiere de un crédito para mantener su negocio surtido y con variedad de productos para sus clientes, además sus ventas se incrementarían y le podría proporcionar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Small businessman: Orlando de Jesús Velásquez P.

After many years working as a security guard in the city of Cali, Orlando de Jesús was left without a job and returned to Medellín, where his family were, to start again from scratch.

After several months, Orlando hadn't managed to find a job and so decided to buy a bag of sugar, some ice and some lemons to make lemonade which he would sell on a cycle path.

The months have passed and now Orlando sells not only lemonade every day but also other products.  He needs a loan to keep his business stocked with a variety of products for his customers.  This will increase his sales and he will be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a natural juice selling business for the past three years, sellling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Zainabu faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy winter season the demand for natural juice is low compared to the hot summer season. Zainabu hopes to establish rental houses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a compressor for making natural juices for sale. She decided to work with Yehu because of its good reputation in her society.

loans.use: To purchase a compressor for making natural juices for sale

loans.name: Bora

texts.en: Mr. Bora K. and his wife sell fish in a Phnom Penh market. They have twice previously asked for Kiva loans. Bora is asking for another loan of $1,200 because he and his wife hope to expand their business by buying chicken for resale. This couple has been married since 1986 and has five children. The family lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying chicken for resale

loans.name: Estanilia

texts.es:
Estanilia es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Residen en el caserío Pueblo Libre en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Recientemente, su familia ha obtenido el servicio de luz.

Desde hace cinco años, Estanilia tiene una bodega en su propio domicilio donde vende a sus vecinos alimentos, bebidas y tabaco entre otros productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio tiene una variedad de productos y Estanilia cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fidelizada en la zona. 

Estanilia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería con la finalidad de lograr más ventas y una mayor margen de utilidad. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Estanilia is a 44-year-old mother who lives with her husband and her son in their own house.  She lives in the Pueblo Libre hamlet in the Tambogrande district, an agricultural area located in Piura province, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.  Her family recently obtained electricity at home.

For five years, Estanilia has had a store in her house where she sells her neighbors food, drinks, and tobacco, among other basic necessities and groceries.  The business has a variety of products, and Estanilia has an established and loyal customer base in the area.

Estanilia wants to expand her business with the purchase of more merchandise in order to achieve more sales and a greater profit margin.  Therefore, she has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To acquire merchandise to expand her business

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
Francia is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family by fish vending/fishing and direct selling (Avon/Natasha).  She lives in Quezon, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Francia is borrowing PHP 10,000 to fund her business operations.  This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Francia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more fire wood for her bakery

loans.name: Zulekha

texts.en:
Zulekha is a widow with six children, five of whom are employed, while one still attends school. They all live in the house she owns which has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and electricity fees.

For over ten years, she has operated real estate houses, with neighbours and passersby as her potential customers. Zulekha faces the major challenge of competition from other real estate houses in her area of operation. She dreams of building two more houses in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to pay her daughter's school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Santa Isabel Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Isabel es de la zona de San Ramon, ciudad de San Lorenzo, las señoras se dedican a diversas actividades. Son todas señoras con antigüedad en la Fundacion Paraguaya, desde hace más de 5 años que están obteniendo créditos y nunca tuvieron atrasos gracias a todas las señoras que son muy pagadoras y responsables.
La sra. Lorenza se dedica a la venta de ropas interiores, en especial de la línea Kalúa, una marca muy popular y de buena calidad en Latinoamerica.
Ella es muy humilde y este negocio le permite obtener ingresos económicos considerables, Lorenza espera poder contar con el apoyo de los inversionistas de Kiva para poder comprar más ropas interiores, teniendo en cuenta que a mayor cantidad de productos menor es el costo al pagarlos (comercio al por mayor), y cuando los revende obtiene mayor cantidad de ganancias (comercio al por menor).
texts.en:
The Santa Isabel committee is in San Ramón neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo.  The women are in a variety of activities.  They’re all long-standing clients of Fundación Paraguaya; they’ve been getting loans for over five years and have never been late with their repayments because all the women are responsible and punctual payers.

Lorenza sells underwear, especially of the Kalúa brand, a very popular, high quality brand in Latin America. She is very humble and this business allows her to earn considerable income.  

Lorenza hopes to have support from Kiva lenders to buy more underwear keeping in mind that the larger the amount bought, the lower the cost (wholesale commerce) and when she resells them her profits are higher (retail sales).

loans.use: to buy underwear.

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say P. is a 52-year-old local rice farmer who lives in Kompong Cham province. She and her husband work together in the farming business. The couple has five children, all of whom are single. To help with the family's daily expenses, one of their children is employed as a building construction worker and earns an average daily income of $3. Because their farm is not near a watering system, Say P. would like a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine for irrigation.

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en: Suzanne is 54 years old and is a widow.   She has 6 children, the youngest of whom is 3 years old.  All her children are in school.  Suzanne is hardworking. She sells a variety of food stuffs, including beans, cooking oil, rice, salt, etc. This business has enabled Suzanne to improve her standards of living.  She is requesting a loan to reinvest in her business by buying more food stuffs to sell.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs to resell

loans.name: Nob Sa Jeker Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NOB SA JEKER est créé le 12 mai 2010; il est composé de 10 femmes qui sont voisines et mènent la même activité de petit commerce. 


Sokhna la responsable du groupe est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de dix enfants dont les derniers sont des jumeaux. 

Elle mène une activité de restauration de petit déjeuner café et beignets dans une petite boutique. Elle a une expérience de deux ans dans ce domaine. Elle se ravitaille au marché de la communauté rurale. Sur la photo elle est assise à gauche habillée en boubou bleu blanc et portant un des jumeaux.


Avec son prêt, elle souhaite acheter du café moulu, du sucre et de la farine en grande quantité pour renforcer son activité.


Ses bénéfices lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins mais aussi d'aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille pour un mieux bien être des enfants.
texts.en:
The Nob Sa Jeker solidarity group was created on May 12, 2010; it is composed of 10 women who are neighbors and all have the same line of work as vendors. SOkhna’s, the group’s leader, is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of 10 children, the two youngest being twins. She prepares food for sale in a small shop: breakfast dishes, coffee and beignets. She has two years of experience in this filed. She stocks up at the local rural market. On the photo, she is seated to the left wearing a white and blue outfit and holding one of her twins.

With her loan, she plans to buy large quantities of ground coffee, sugar and flour in order to strengthen her business. Her income allows her to provide for her own needs and also to help her husband support the household and ensure a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy coffee and flour for sale.

loans.name: Maria Violeta

texts.es:
María  D. 45 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y 3 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en   el distrito D. Eten – Chiclayo, esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad pesquera y comercialización D. aves D. corral. La casa D. María cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.

DesD. hace 4 años María se dedica la venta D. abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, etc) y D. bebidas. Su negocio lo ha colocado en su casa para mayor comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias por la venta D. sus productos  trata D. cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar el nivel D. vida D. su familia.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  D. 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el fin D. que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.  

María es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por darle mayores comodidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, 45, lives with her husband and three children in her own house in the district of Eten - Chiclayo.  This area is known for its fishing activity and chicken sales.  María's house has all the basic utilities.

For four years María has been selling groceries (daily consumption products such as: milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet tissue, tuna, eggs, etc.) and beverages. Her store is set up in her home for comfort and security purposes.  With the income she earns from product sales she tries to cover household expenses and improve her family's lifestyle.

In order to grow her business she has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy more merchandise so she can increase business and offer more products to customers.

María is a responsible, dedicated and hard-working person who is concerned about giving her children a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio, es agricultor, está casado, vive con su esposa y tienen 5 hijos de 14, 12, 7, 4 años y una bebe de 6 meses de nacida, él trabaja sembrando maíz, frijol y maicillo, desde joven se ha dedicado a los cultivos, pues fue un oficio inculcado por su padre, el horario de trabajo es de 6:00am a 11:00am, este trabajo le permite dar la alimentación a sus hijos.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes para la siembra de maíz y maicillo, su propósito es tener los materiales para iniciar la tarea de postrera, tiene la esperanza de que el invierno no sea exceso de agua o que tenga tiempos secos, pues cualquier de estos fenómenos dañaría la cosecha.
Su objetivo es tener fuerzas para trabajar y sacar adelante a sus hijos, dándoles la oportunidad de estudiar, de alimentarse y crecer sanos, ya que su familia es muy numerosa requiere de mucho esfuerzo para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Rogelio is a farmer.  He is married and lives with his wife; they have 5 children aged 14, 12, 7, and 4 years old and a baby of 6 months.  He works planting corn, beans and sorghum.  He has worked with crops since he was young, as it was a profession instilled in him by his father.  His working hours are from 6:00 am to 11:00 am, and this work allows him to feed his children.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for the planting of corn and sorghum.   The purpose is to have the materials to begin the task of the second season of planting of the year.  He holds hope that the winter won't bring too much rain or dry times, as either of these phenomena would damage the crop.

His goal is to have the strength to work and raise his children, giving them the opportunity to study, eat and grow healthily.  As his family is very large, it requires a lot of effort to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the planting of corn and sorghum.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Mrs. Thou, 46, is a fish seller living in Siem Reap Province. She and her husband have a fishing business. He catches fish on the lake, and she takes these fish, along with fish purchased from a wholesaler, and brings them to sell at the local market.

They have been blessed with four children who are still dependent on their incomes. Mrs. Thou has requested a loan to purchase a new motor for their fishing boat so that her husband can haul his nets more quickly and they can earn more money from their fish-catching business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor her fishing boat

loans.name: Gulkan's Group

texts.en:
Gulkan, 54, is the leader of this group. She resides in the warm southern town of Kadamjai. Gulkan’s husband is a worker in a local chemical plant, while she is a medical worker. She devotes all of her life to medicine and saving human lives. On summer vacations, Gulkan runs a small business selling fruits and vegetables that she grows in the orchard. The assortment is wide from apples to carrots. All three of Gulkan’s grown children help her to manage the garden and distribute the products. The initial capital was 5 000 soms and brings a monthly profit of 2 000 soms now. Gulkan plans to stay involved in this trade for the whole summer and start livestock breeding later. In order to do this, she asks Kiva lenders for financial assistance. The funds from loan will be spent on the purchase of two heads of livestock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha trabaja en la policía nacional. El crédito lo requiere para  comprar una computadora portátil que le facilitará parte de su trabajo de escribir reportes a sus superiores.  Vive en la casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani  en la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene dos  hijos en edad escolar. Esta es la segunda vez que  solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha works for the national police. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a laptop computer to help facilitate her work of writing reports for her superiors. She lives at the home of her parents in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. Martha is married and has two school-age children.

This is the second time she has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a computer to use in her job of writing police reports.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 62 years old and married with 4 children. Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, groceries, etc..

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid 17 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running her sari-sari store for 14 years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock.

Evelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Mayomae

texts.en:
Mayomae is a resident of Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and 35 years old with three school-aged dependents. She started running her retail store three years ago. It's a small-scale business, but it is providing just income for the family. Monthly earnings of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) are generated from business operations.

This year, she joined GDMPC to access financial services. She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 from the cooperative to buy additional grocery items to sell. She is planning to work hard and expand her business range, which she hopes to attain in the future in God's favor.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Janeth tiene 45 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha trabajado muy duro, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Narciso de 45 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Janeth, aún cuando era adolescente trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres y a la vez trabajaba como jornalera en distintas chacras. Con sus ahorros acumulados compró su propia parcela donde viene trabajando 23 años y cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de cacao y café.  La clave de su éxito radica en la creatividad y las ganas de trabajar, sus plantas están trabajadas de manera tecnificada porque recibe capacitación de los ingenieros agrónomos periódicamente. Su producto con mayor demanda es el grano de café por la calidad y la aroma del producto que los ofrece y a cambio percibe buen pago. Trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, pero en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros, para que de esa manera avance con mayor celeridad en la extracción y selección de su producto. Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción agrícola para que de esa manera pueda seguir satisfaciendo a sus clientes, en efecto mejorar su condición de vida. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que el dinero del crédito le será de mucha utilidad en el progreso de su trabajo, por ello agradece una vez mas a los financistas por permitirle trabajar con ellos. Con el crédito solicitado contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en la cosecha y desmonte de malezas
texts.en: Janeth is 45. She is a woman who has always worked very hard, her entire life. She lives in her own home with her husband Narciso, age 45, and their three beloved children. They want to offer their children a better quality of life. Even as a teenager, Janeth worked on her parents' land and as a day labourer on various other farms. With the savings that she accumulated she purchased her own parcel of land where she has now been working for 23 years. She has 3 hectares of fertile land where she cultivates cocoa and coffee plants. The key to her success lies in her creativity and her desire to work. She uses modern technology on her farm, because she receives periodic training from agricultural engineers. Because of its quality and aroma, her coffee grain is in highest demand. She and her husband are always working, but during the harvest they hire day labourers; this allows them to extract and select their products more quickly. Her plan for the future is to continue expanding her agricultural production so that she can continue to satisfy her customers, thus improving her living conditions. This will be her third loan with MFP. She knows that this loan will be very helpful in the progress of her work, so she thanks all of the lenders once again for allowing her to work with you. With the requested loan she will hire day labourers to help with the harvest and weeding.

loans.use: to hire day labourers.

loans.name: Dushirukumwete Group

texts.fr:
Jacqueline est une commerçante âgée de 38ans qui habite  la localité de Gihamagara de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle  fait le commerce de vin de bananes depuis 24ans. Elle  faisait le commerce de farine et de Primus avant de commencer cette activité. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée a Elias  et ont ensemble 5 enfants dont 2 étudient a l’école primaire.  
Le crédit Kiva  de 100,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantité de vin de bananes à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« DUSHIRUKUMWETE».
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 38-year-old merchant living in Gihamagara, a village in the province of Gitega in central Burundi. She has been selling banana wine for 24 years, after having sold flour and Primus beer for some time. She attended elementary school until sixth grade. She is married to Elias. Together they have five children, with two of them attending elementary school.

Jacqueline will use her loan share of 100,000 Burundi francs provided through Kiva to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of banana wine for resale. She expects to make a good profit.

Jacqueline is a member of Dushirukumwete Community Group.

loans.use: to expand her working capital and buy a large quantity of banana wine in order to earn a good profit.

loans.name: Bahlul

texts.en:
Bahlul is a caring and self-sacrificing father of three. Ever since he was very young he has been around people who make a living raising animals. Thanks to this knowledge he has dedicated himself to raising and selling cattle, a skill that he learned from his parents and relatives. With his experience gained over time he has been able to bring stability to his family. Bahlul buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells on the same market at a more profitable price. His monthly income is about 180 USD.
Now he would like to increase his supply of capital to acquire more cattle. To make this possible, he has applied for a loan for 1000 ZN to buy more cattle and, thereby, increase the well-being and security of his family.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder

loans.name: Gerardina

texts.es:
La Señora. Gerardina es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, cuenta con una gran belleza natural y cultural, su amplia gastronomía cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amble, cordial y carismática, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Gerardina tiene 50 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 26 y 12 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado e independiente, su segundo hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Con ella también vive una sobrina a la cual la crio desde que tenía 12 años y hoy tiene 20 años de edad. Su esposo labora como portero de un colegio, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Gerardina se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa usada y calzado, lleva 9 años en este negocio y labora solo días de ferias.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa usada para surtir más su mercadería.

Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Gerardina is a member of “El Ahorro” (The Savings) communal bank, and she lives in the region surrounding the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate and it can count on great natural and cultural beauty. Its ample gastronomy captures the palate of visitors, and its people are kind, cordial and charismatic. It still maintains the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Gerardina is 50 years old, married, and the fruit of her conjugal union is 2 sons, aged 26 and 12. Her 1st son is married and independent; her 2nd son is studying in a school in the city. Also living with her is a niece she has raised since the age of 12; she is now 20. Gerardina's husband works as a porter at a school. They do not have their own house and are forced to rent.

Gerardina is a merchant who sells used clothing and shoes. She has done this for 9 years and works on the days of local fairs.

Her communal bank is in its 2nd loan cycle. Gerardina plans to invest her loan funds in purchasing used clothing to resupply her merchandise. 

Gerardina's dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines.

Maria requested a loan of 17,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

Maria has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Renacer 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Primitiva is the coordinator of her group, Renacer 1 & 2 (Reborn). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three of their five children. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying watching television and working in her business. 

Primitiva is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for a month, starting with a loan she took two years ago. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, and other goods. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business; one of her future plans is to have a supermarket and her house, and to invest in her business. She dreams of having a farm.

Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production; it is the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. Primitiva's business operates out of her house, like others in her group, who make their sales from home stalls and on foot. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, and canned food.

loans.name: Romulino

texts.en:
Romulino is from Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 47 years old and a widower. To make a living, Romulino owns and operates various business ventures, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale, including bananas. 

Romulino has been in his business for over 2 years and earns about 22,920 PHP a month from these activities. He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

In 2011, Romulino joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Faatafa

texts.en:
Faatafa is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Patamea. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Faatafa owns and operates an agriculture business. While not her only means for generating revenue, her business is based primarily on planting and harvesting taro to sell. Faatafa has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 1400 WST per month from these activities.

In 2008, Faatafa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1950 WST from SPBD, which she used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Faatafa is now requesting a new loan of 2450 WST, which she will use to purchase land to expand her taro plantation. This will be her fourth loan from SPBD. Faatafa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase land to expand her taro plantation.

loans.name: Pinzirayi Group

texts.en:
Precious is a 31-year-old lady and she is a widow. She has two children, age 14 and 12 years, and both of them go to school. She does not have any other dependents who stay with her.

She operates at a flea market at Garikai Market in Masvingo. She sells clothes, shoes, blankets and bags. She has been in the business for two years now. She does not have any employees who work for her. 

She faces a challenge of debtors failing to pay on time. She wishes to own her own shop in the central business district in the next five years. 

With the profits from the business, she will be able to pay fees and take the children out on holidays. She will also want to extend her residential home.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 31 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She has run a business selling tea in Kator, South Sudan, for three years.
Mary is requesting this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee for resale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old, married to John and they are blessed with three children.  She has been in the farming business for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 6,500, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  Elizabeth will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Eliane

texts.fr: Eliane est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Eliane n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Eliane est mariée a un certain Roger. Le couple a quatre enfants tous et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Eliane vend depuis quatre ans des tissus et des produits vivriers à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Eliane vend des chaussures, des jus de bissape et des glaces. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Eliane contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Eliane sollicite pour une quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les  trois crédits reçus antérieurement par Eliane ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Eliane is 38 and lives in Benin. She never went to school. She is married to a man named Roger. Together they provide for their 4 children, who all live with them. In order to contribute to family-related expenses, Eliane has been selling fabrics and food products at home for 4 years. In addition to this activity, she sells shoes, hibiscus juice, and ice cream. Thanks to the profits generated by this activity, Eliane is able to help support her family. In order to meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base, she is applying for a fourth loan from ALIDÉ. Eliane has successfully paid back all 3 previous loans.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Nu

texts.en: Nu is requesting a new loan to buy good quality rice to make better food for selling. Her previous loan enabled her to earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy good quality rice for her foodstall

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba cultivates maize for sale at Amoanda, near Cape Coast. She has done so for 3 years now. Aba is married with 5 children. She uses her income to help her husband feed and pay their children’s school fees. Aba will use her loan to cultivate more maize to sell.  With the new profit, Aba will expand her business.

loans.use: To cultivate maize for sale

loans.name: Rihab's Group

texts.en:
Rihab is a member of this group from Iraq. Rihab is 25 years old divorced. Rihab started her sewing business four years ago with an old sewing machine to generate enough income and not reach out to others for support herself.
She is requesting this (Qard Hassan ) loan that Izdiharona provide for divorced and widow women to buy embroidery machine  and table to help her increase her income.
She aims to open big place for her business and create jobs for other women.
The story of Rihab and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients .
They preferred to blur their face to cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Rihab's Group $ 3,000 loan is to buy embroidery machine and table.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily's desire to get ahead is admirable because, despite her young age and the obstacles she has experienced, she is not deterred in achieving her objective - what she sets out for, she gets. 

Emily is a mother of six who has been practicing agriculture for the past five years. Because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect among other farmers and she is viewed as a mentor in her village. She lives together with her children in the Kitale area of Kenya, which is known for maize plantations producing for both export and local consumption. Her primary income sources are eggs, milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. Generating an income through selling harvest is the part of farming she enjoys most. Availability of labour is a major challenge for Emily. She also keeps a dairy cow. 

Before joining Juhudi Kilimo, Emily could not access loans from established banks. She mobilized marginalized farmers and created the group Jaribu Tena self-help group. Through the group, she joined Juhudi Kilimo and learned about loan management and agribusiness. She also got to learn about Kiva. 

Emily is seeking a loan to buy farm equipment. With the loan, she will be able to increase her productivity on the farm. Effective modern tools will make her farm activities much easier. This will boost her income and enable her to pay school fees for her children. Emily waits for your kindness.

Support this great smallholder farmer who is not deterred by difficulty so that she can achieve a good future for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm equipment to increase productivity on her farm.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer soltera, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad del caserío Paculam, Juana es mujer que todos los días se esmera para darle a su familia una mujer estabilidad, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica de su región, con este negocio lleva ella 5 años de realizarlo. Con la época de fin de año su negocio de ropa tiene mucha demanda por esa razón solicita un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de güipiles, fajas y cortes y poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes.
Su gran sueño es fortalecer su negocio para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de productos de ropa típica como: güipiles, fajas y cortes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy shares on the stock market.

loans.name: Nazanen

texts.en:
Nazanen has 20 years' experience with poultry & animal husbandry. She started having poultry at the age of 20 when she lived with her father's family in the village.

Because of a lack of birds she took a loan through AFSG to buy seeds and chickens for her farm. She started her business by selling eggs but now she sells both the chicks and the eggs at the bazaar.

She believes that by borrowing a big amount she can buy sheep and birds to increase her business and find more income.

loans.use: Poultry

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda was born in 1967 and is married to Mr. Chah Joseph Ntong. She has six children. The most painful thing she has had to bear in her life was the loss of her child and her father, and the biggest challenge she has faced has been to pick up the pieces of her life and move on again after these bad incidents.

She has taken GHAPE loans six times and paid them back. What she loves most about GHAPE is its policy of transparency, the fact that it gives everybody equal opportunity to grow out of poverty and the fact that GHAPE gives loans on a very low interest rate. She intends to rent a new farm, employ more task laborers and buy chemicals that will improve her harvest. She also plans to expand her palm oil business. This will benefit the community because she will employ members of her community and be able to provide vegetables and other farm products for their local market. She will also hire a sales person to help her with the palm oil business.

Her greatest dream is to settle her children to start off on their own with the profit from her business. She plans to repay her loan during the term. She expects that her first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Matilda wants to buy palm oil to trade and farming supplies.

loans.name: Karomad

texts.en:
Karomad started her business over 6 years ago. She is renting a place in the fruit and vegetable open-air market in Panjshanbe in Khujand. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is her business partner. He is responsible for bringing grapes from the districts of Khujand town. They are constant clients of several grapes farms, from which they buy their product. Every day her husband brings 50 kg of grapes from the farms and Karomad sells them during one day.

Their shop is located in a passage of the market and Karomad successfully sells her product. But her problem is the hot sun in the warm season. She wants to roof her shop. For this purpose she is requesting 600USD.

loans.use: Put  a roof on her shop

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu is thirty four years old and sells cotton materials in the market of Magburaka in Sierra Leone.  Her husband is also a petty trader in the same town and as parents they are trying to provide a good life for their family.  This mother is interested in expanding her business and is asking for a loan of $175.

loans.use: To expand her clothing sales in the market.

loans.name: Khac Cuong

texts.vi: Anh Cương năm nay 30 tuổi, anh là người hiền lành và chịu khó. Anh có 3 con, 1 trai, 2 gái, các cháu còn đang đi học. Anh làm nông nghiệp.Gia đình anh trồng rất nhiều lúa, ngoài ra trồng thêm các loại rau màu ngắn ngày khác như rau cải, cà chua, đỗ... Vì Vậy gia đình anh lúc nào cũng có thu nhập thường xuyên.Vợ anh thì đi chợ mua phế liệu. Anh vay vốn đợt này mua phân đạm để bón rau nhằm tăng năng suất lao động.

loans.use: Having loans for selling vegetable

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Mrs. Uk N., 36, is married with three children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works on her rice paddy growing crops, while her husband works making cutting boards, earning collectively around $3.50/day in revenue. Mrs. Uk N. has humbly requested for a loan to purchase a saw and wood to facilitate and expand her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase a saw and wood to facilitate and expand her husband's business.

loans.name: Kitooro 2 (B) Group

texts.en:
Phiona (group leader) is married with four children. She has a public pay phone. Sarah has a saloon. Faridah sells charcoal. Silvia sells raw food in the market. Mariam sells furniture. The group has been together for one year. With the extra profits, Phiona wants to pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase another pay phone

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Mr. Luciano C. lives in the Alpacota section of the city of La Paz with his wife, Maria Capcha, and their three kids. Mr. Luciano works as a driver of a small truck transporting construction supplies. His wife works doing wash at individual homes.

With previous loans they were able to build approximately half of a perimeter wall, as well as two bedrooms. The credit they are currently seeking would be to finish the perimeter wall, and to demolish a bedroom made from adobe that is very old and deteriorated.

This will be his eighth loan, and the socioeconomic analysis completed indicates he qualifies favorably for access to credit. Luciano has been a client of ours since the year 2000 and has always paid back his loans satisfactorily.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Luciano C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Alpacoma de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa, la señora Maria Capcha y sus tres hijos. El señor Luciano trabaja como chofer de una volqueta realizando el traslado de material de construcción y su esposa realiza el trabajo de lavandería en casas particulares. Con anteriores créditos realizaron la construcción de muro perimetral en un 50% y la conclusión de dos habitaciones en planta alta. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de la totalidad del muro perimetral y la demolición de una habitación de adobe que por su antigüedad se encuentra en total deterioro. Esta es la octava ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Luciano es cliente nuestro desde el año 2000 y siempre ha pagado sus créditos en forma satisfactoria.

loans.use: Construction of a perimeter wall and demolition of a deteriorated bedroom.

loans.name: Aisas

texts.en:
Mrs. Aisas M. and her husband, AM. Sen, married in 1987. They have five children; three sons and two daughters. Four of their children are in school and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. Aisas has been selling fish for six years. Before starting this business, Aisas and her husband fished in the Mekong River since they got married. Currently, her husband is a motor taxi driver. For this fishing season Aisas and her husband want to start their business of fishing again and they need some money to repair their fishing materials. Their house is along Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Aisas is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $1000 to repair her fishing materials.

loans.use: To repair their fishing materials

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Mr. Luis A. Cordón lives alone in his own home in Alto Miraflores, north of the city of La Paz. He’s a locksmith, working independently for particular clients in the city of La Paz.

With a past loan, he was able to construct the initial walls of a room. The loan solicited will be used to finish construction and detail on said room, which will eventually become his bedroom. He currently sleeps at his sister’s place. This is the 6th time he applies for a loan. His loan credit history classifies him as a favourable candidate for a loan.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Luís A. Cordón vive solo en casa propia. en la zona de Alto Miraflores ladera norte de la Ciudad de La Paz. El señor Luís es cerrajero, trabajando independientemente para personas particulares en la ciudad de La Paz.

Con el crédito otorgado anteriormente realizo la construcción en obra gruesa de una habitación. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra fina y acabado de dicha habitación de ladrillo que será su dormitorio, ya que actualmente vive en una habitación prestada por su hermana Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To finish the construction and detail of a room, which will eventually become his bedroom

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov K., 44, and her husband, Mr. An Nov, have been married over twenty years and have seven children. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home. One of her daughters is in school and the other one has mental problems and stays at home.  An grows jicamas and corn in the farm a distance from home. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Pov has been a weaver since she was fourteen years old. It’s skill she learned from a relative. She sells their finished products to the middleman in the village who will take it to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of US$200 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
In the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, Ms. Adela F. has dedicated herself for several years to the sale of cosmetics which she sells to her clients from her home. She also sells clothing in smaller quantities as cosmetics are a stronger sale. This income allows her to support her nuclear family which is made up her herself and her two children who are of school age.

Today, the need which this lady is faced with is the urgency of acquiring the economic resource to purchase cosmetics for their resale. For this sole reason she has come to Ceprodel to become the beneficiary of a necessary loan to acquire her merchandise to then be able to resell it.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua, la señora Adela F. se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de venta de cosméticos los cuales comercializa en su propia casa de habitación ofreciéndolos a sus clientes muy amablemente. También vende ropa pero en menores cantidades siendo su fuerte la venta de los cosméticos. Por medio de estos ingresos logra mantener su núcleo familiar compuesto por ella y sus dos hijos en edades escolares.

Hoy en día la necesidad que esta dama atraviesa es la urgencia de adquirir el recurso económico para la compra de los cosméticos para su respectiva comercialización. Por esta única razón es que ella acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito necesario para adquirir su mercadería y así comercializarla en su negocio que atiende en su casa de habitación en San Rafael.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Juana is 39 years old who, sixteen years ago, used her savings to start a small business selling fried pork door-to-door using a cart. She has been able to grow her enterprise, and she now also sells baho (a traditional Nicaraguan dish made from a mix of meat, green plantains and yucca cooked in banana leaves), sodas and other products.

She thinks that now is a good time to grow her business further, which is why she is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs so she can offer a better quality of service to her customers.

After making this investment, she will build her own location from which to sell her goods. Juana is married and has two children who are now living on their own. Her husband works as a refrigeration technician and helps Juana with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase of plastic tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca is a saleswoman and sells goods such as fabrics for suits, perfumes and cosmetics by catalog. She sells her goods in offices and markets and charges her customers by the day, week or month. She is divorced and is the only means of support for her family; she has a daughter who is about to finish school. Her home is located in the Achachicala area of the city of La Paz

Her loan will be for purchasing more goods, fabrics, perfumes and cosmetics. This is the fifth time she has applied for a loan, and the second time she has asked for Kiva´s help. Her record qualifies her as a top client who meets her payment obligations. Her work and her efforts qualify her for this loan because of her experience in this type of sales.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Blanca es comerciante y vende mercadería, cortes de telas para trajes, perfumes y cosméticos por catalogo. Dicha mercadería la vende en las oficinas y mercados para cobrar a sus clientes cada día, a la semana o al mes. Es divorciada y la única que solventa a su familia ya que cuenta con una hija que esta por terminar en el colegio. Su domicilio ubicado en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz

El crédito será destinado la compra de más mercadería, telas y la compra de perfumes y cosméticos. Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito, y la segunda vez que requiere la ayuda de Kiva; su historial la califica como cliente 1 con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. Su trabajo y esfuerzo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en la venta de mercadería a pedido.

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as fabrics, perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Noha

texts.en: Noha is a 41 year old seamstress from Nabatieh, in Southern Lebanon. Noha is a member of "Al Wurud" solidarity lending group which means "The Roses" in Arabic. Noha is very devoted to her work and is eager to cooperate with other women to develop her business. Noha has requested a loan of $300 to purchase more thread to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase new thread for her business

loans.name: Mrs. Nheom Sorn's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people in Preark Roka Village in Kandal Province are applying for a village bank loan. 

Mrs. Nheom S. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. She owns 1.5 hectares of land (~3.7 acres), on which she grows rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Kung Roem, is a construction worker who makes less than $2 to support his family. Mrs. Nheom S. is 53 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory; the remaining two attend the local school. Although Mrs. Nheom S.'s family members have different businesses, they still live in an old house and in poor conditions. In order to improve her standard of living, Mrs. Nheom S. decided to ask for a loan. She will use the money, along with her savings to build a new house for her family. 

Mr. Prum V. did not come to the meeting, so he is represented by his wife, who appears in the photo. Mrs. Ky Navy is the group guarantor. She is also shown in the picture. 

This is a village bank loan which is paid in full at the end of its term. Eight of members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly-payment loans. Members with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. 

End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Mrs. Thanh Play, 42, is a widow with two sons and five daughters. Four of her children are married and live outside the family home, while the other three children work in a garment factory. The family lives in a small village across Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Mrs. Thanh has been a silk weaver, a skill learnt from her daughter, for three years. She sells her finished products to a trader in the village, who then sells her products in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials her weaving business and to help her son in-law purchase a boat for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and a boat

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en: Senor Martinez first worked with his father in his gift shop. Eight years ago he decided to take a microloan to start his own business. This business is his main source of income to support his wife and two young children. He would like this loan to enable him to expand his stock of figures for the holiday season.

loans.use: additional materials for his pottery sales

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Van H. is the group leader of six members who all live in Kandal Kraom village in Kandal province. He is a fisherman. In his fishing business, he now faces a problem because he does not have fishnets and a boat with a motor to go fishing. Thus, Mr. Van H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy them for this purpose. He hopes to increase his income and improve the living conditions of his family with this loan.

His wife, Mrs. Chhem Saroeun, is working in a garment factory. Mr. Van H. is 31 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only two years old.

Another member of this loan group, Mrs. Navy S. did not come to take the loan but her husband did, so he is present in the picture instead of his wife.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and a boat with a motor for his business

loans.name: Souad

texts.en: Souad is a 43-year-old woman who is married, with three children. She and her family live in Saida, Southern Lebanon. She started working from her house in 1995 to help her husband with the household expenses. Souad sells home appliances and kitchenware to her neighbors and friends. Today, she wants to borrow $1200 to buy more inventory to increase her client base.

loans.use: Buy more inventory

loans.name: Chipukizi Group

texts.en:
Rukia has been a seamstress in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 6 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 70. Every day she works at her business from 8:30am to 18.30pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tailoring items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Rukia is 32 years old, married, and has two children, ages 8 and 2. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mwanaid, Bertha, Lightnes and Erasmimi. Each woman also has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more sewing notions for her business

loans.name: Faaniniva

texts.en: Faaniniva T., 34, is married with two children.  She has one year of experience in the Cattle Farming business. She sells to the village people /public one day per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Faaniniva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of her loan will be used to buy a fence and nails to secure the cows.

loans.use: Purchase a fence and nails to secure the cows.

loans.name: Sris' Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sris P. is the leader of a group of six members who all live in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province. She sells fruit that is grown near her house. She also is a rice middlewoman. Now she wants to expand her business to earn more income to support her family. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy more rice to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Men Ly, is a construction worker. Mrs. Sris P. is 25 years old and the mother of a child who is just four years old.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina has been a fish, charcoal and firewood seller in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for six years. She belongs to Shida huzaa maarifa group loan (Group code 2017). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $85. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish, charcoal and firewood for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Madina is 31 years old, married, and has five children: ages 16, 14, 9, 7 and 18 days.

loans.use: To buy more fish, charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda G. is a rice grower. She is 51 years old and has 8 children. Her husband, David G., manages their farm. Everyday, they go out to the field and check their crop. They enjoy tilling the soil and they work under the heat of the sun to provide food for their children.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 (USD 225) from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy 5 sacks of complete fertilizers and seeds. This loan will help her increase her yield. She believes that her loan will also bring her more income.

CEVI is reaching out farmers to sustain their livelihood. CEVI offers not just loans but also provides training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy 5 sacks of complete fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 44 years old and is married to a Baranggay Captain. He is Santiago G. Jr. and is 47 years old. They were blessed with 3 children; Roxanne is 22 years old and a secretary in Isabela State University, Santiago III is 20 year’s old and nursing graduate, and Salvador is 19 years old and graduate of marine transportation. They live in Baranggay La Paz in a well organized place. 

Rosemarie operates a food vending business in their village. She cooks a homemade “Puto” (Rice cake). She is asking for financial capital to sustain and expand her business. She is able to generate an average income of PHP 400 daily. She would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to use as additional working capital in order to develop her rice cake making business. She loves cooking and she hopes it will become productive in the future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Thủy Nguyễn THị (804000158) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has four infant children.

Thủy owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,200,000 VND a month.

In 1999, Thủy joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to build a shelter for her pigs.

Thủy is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 9th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Reina Pricila

texts.es:
la sra, Reina Pricila C. tiene una pulperia y un comedor, ella tiene tres hijas las que le ayudan en los negocios los cuales abre muy temprano la pulperia, en su pulperia vende vende :arroz, maiz, frijoles, café, salsas, carnes, frutas, verduras etc. los productos que vende los compra  a  carros repartidores y otras cosas en bodegas de la ciudad, en el comedor vende todo tipò de comida tambien vende golosinas, tiene muchos clientes ellos la prefieren por su buena atencion. trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia, ella es madre soltera.
doña reina vive en un barrio de la ciudad de choluteca.
texts.en:
Ms. Reina Pricila C. owns a general store and a small restaurant. She has three daughters who help her with the businesses. She opens her general store very early in the morning and sells: rice, corn, beans, coffee, salsa, meats, fruits, vegetables, etc. She purchases some goods from delivery trucks, and others from other markets in the city. She sells all types of meals in her restaurant. She also sells candy. She has many customers who prefer her businesses because of her great service. She works very hard in order to help her family get ahead as she is a single mother. She lives in the city of Choluteca.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soap, coffee, rice, beans, corn, churros (fried dough pastries), pasta, salsa, soup, butter, margarine, dairy products, beverages, and canned juice

loans.name: Vũ Thị

texts.en:
M. Vũ Thị (535050989) is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has two adult children.

M. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 4,300,000 VND a month.

In 2005, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

M. is now requesting a new loan of 16,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 6th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: El Cielo Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Cielo está conformado por Benicia Victoria Murillo R., Magali M. R. y Katia R. P.; ellas son provenientes de Piedra Menuda una comarca de Nindirí. Esta es una zona rural de difícil acceso ya que  el transporte tan solo pasa dos veces al día. 

Este grupo de mujeres ya  han tenido dos créditos con adim con los cuales lograron incrementar su materia prima y sus clientes es por eso que podemos asegurar que son trabajadoras, emprendedoras, perseverantes y con muchos deseos de superarse.

La coordinadoras del grupo es la señora Benicia Murillo 57 años de edad, ella está casada con don Antonio M. quien es agricultor y con quien tuvo tres hijos. Ellos viven en una pequeña casa prefabricada que cuenta con los servicios necesarios.

Murillo hace dieciocho años decidió tener un pequeño negocio en casa;  ya que necesitaba mayores ingresos y es así que decidió establecer una pulpería que le permitiera atender a su hija que tiene síndrome de Down. 

Con el tiempo su pulpería ha ido creciendo poco a poco actualmente tiene mayor de manda de productos que representa un incremento el volumen de ventas pero para ello necita aumentar su inventario tanto en granos básicos que son maíz, frijol, arroz, trigo, aceite y chiverías entre otros.

Las otras dos integrantes son  Magaly Margarita Mana R. de 25 años de edad es soltera, estudio secundaria y actualmente se dedica a vender cosméticos de marca especialmente de la Avon y Zermat. Asimismo  Katia Lucia R. P. que vende cosméticos también de la marca de la Avon y Zermat. Ella está casada con Fredy M. Murillo  técnico en refrigeradoras y  con quién  vive en la casa de su suegra.  

Todas ellas necesitan contar con una reinversión para sus negocios ya sea en la compra de productos básicos como es el caso de la coordinadora o en la adquisición cosméticos, perfumes y cremas de las otras dos integrantes.
texts.en:
The Sky Group is made up of Benicia Victoria Murillo R., Magali M. R. and Katia R. P.. They are from Piedra Menuda, an area of Nindirí. This is a rural area that is difficult to access because transportation only goes there twice a day. This group of women has already had two loans with Adim, with which they succeeded in increasing their raw materials and their clients. Because of this, they were able to assure that they are hard-working, enterprising, persevering, and have a great desire to overcome. The group leader is Mrs. Benicia Murillo, who is 57 years old and is married to Mr. Antonia M., who is a farmer. They have three children. They live in a small house, which has the necessary amenities. Eighteen years ago, Murillo decided to have a small business in her house because she needed a larger income. As a result, she decided to establish a small grocery store, which would allow her to take care of her daughter, who has Downs Syndrome. Over time, her grocery store has been growing little by little. At present, she has a high demand for her products, which means an increase in the volume of her sales, but to accommodate this, she needs to increase her inventory a lot in basic goods, like corn, beans, rice, wheat, oil, and other things. One of the other two members is Magali Margarita Mana R., who is 25 years old, is married, has completed secondary school, and at present, sells Avon and Zermat brand cosmetics. The other member, Katia Lucia R. P., also sells Avon and Zermat cosmetics. She is married to Fredy M. Murillo, a refrigerator technician. They live in her mother-in-law’s house. All of them need to reinvest in their business, by buying basic products, as in the case of the group leaders, or by buying perfumes and creams, as in the cases of the other two members.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products, especially basic goods

loans.name: Mirnumon

texts.en:
K. Mirnumon is a 52-year-old farmer who lives with his family consisting of three children and his wife. He has two milk cows and sells dairy products to the local and capital traders. Mirnumon has 15 years of experience in raising cattle and selling dairy products. The milk products are in very high demand in his village. Mirnumon’s orders for these products are very high, but the milk his cows give is not enough for tradersm and he decided to apply for 6000 Somoni to purchase an additional cow and fodder. Mirnumon is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living with this loan. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasw cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha sells foodstuffs like bags of rice and vegetable oil. Aisha has been in this business since the past 10 years. Aisha is 45 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza C. is from the village of Pandan in Gingoog City. She is 23 years old and married with two infant children.  Riza recently started a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food and daily use products in the local community.  She joined HSPFI earlier this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
