Riza successfully repaid a loan of 5000 PHP which she used to expand her product offering.  Now she is requesting her second loan, for 8000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase generic medicines

loans.name: María Silvia

texts.es: María Silvia G. de 43 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután. María es una mujer soltera, actualmente vive en la casa de su tío don Julio de 75 años de edad. María es independiente económicamente trabaja en su negocio donde ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a él, es una venta de productos de uso personal como cosméticos y toda variedad de artículos para el cabello, ahora ella solicita de un crédito para comprar nueva mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
María Silvia G. is 43 years old and lives in the department of Usulután. She is a single woman who lives in the house of her uncle, Don Julio, who is 75 years old. María is financially independent and spends the majority of her time working at her business. She sells personal products such as cosmetics and a variety of items used for the hair. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy new merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise for her business

loans.name: Tserendash

texts.en:
Tserendash G. is 32 years old and lives with his mother in the Bayanhongor province of central Mongolia. G. works at the local gold mine during much of the year, but he also supplements his income by farming. In 2004, with the help of his mother, sister and brother-in-law, G. began planting vegetables on 0.2 hectares of land in the Bumbat of Ulziit soum. This year, he expanded his farmland to 1 hectare and hopes to continue growing in the future. Unfortunately, he won’t be able to grow as large or as fast as he wants to because he doesn’t have a storage building for his excess vegetables. Because of this problem, he is forced to sell some of the vegetables very cheaply and loses out on valuable profits. G. is requesting a 1,300,000 tugrug loan in order to build a storage facility that will enable him to increase the farming profits he and his family work so hard for.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To build a storage facility that will enable him to increase the farming profits he and his family work so hard for

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita A. is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Lita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lita owns and operates a business venture selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from making "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies for sale. Lita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month through these activities.

In 2007, Lita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for making rice cakes and other delicacies

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Lach P. is a humble villager living in the rural area of Phnom Penh, where she owns farmland that she plants with different kinds of crops to earn a living. Her husband works with her on the farm and also raises cows. This couple has a daughter and two sons. Both of their sons are construction workers and contribute their income for the family’s daily expenses. Lach P. always finds it hard to travel because she has no vehicle for transportation. She would like a loan from Kiva which will allow her to buy a used motorcycle for her family's transportation.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle for her family's transportation

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, de 51 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo (Basilio), de 53 años, y sus dos hijas: Sonia de 14 y Nury de 7 años, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos.
La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de leche; todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para ordeñar a sus vacas y así conseguir la cantidad de litros necesarios para ir a la feria dominical su poblado y satisfacer la demanda de sus compradores. La leche que vende es de muy buena calidad, ya que se preocupa mucho en la alimentación de su ganado.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar a sus animales, ya que les tiene mucho cariño, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar la alimentación de sus vacas, ya que cualquier cosa indebida que se coman podría afectar su producción de leche. 
Para más adelante, espera aumentar el número de vacas lecheras que tiene, ya que desea incrementar su producción.

Este es el primer préstamo de Mercedes con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable y siempre está pendiente de que se cumplan los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los novecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más forraje (pasto) para sus animales, ya que sabe que de su alimentación dependerá el progreso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is the 51-year-old mother of a very loving family. She lives in her own home with her 53-year-old husband, Basilio, and their two daughters, Sonia (14) and Nury (7), who are the main inspiration for all of her hard work. Her occupation is the sale of milk; every morning she wakes up very early to milk her cows to obtain enough liters to satisfy the demands of her customers when she goes to her village's Sunday street market. The milk that she sells is of very high quality because she takes great care with the nutrition of her livestock. What she likes most about her job is caring for her animals because she feels great affection for them. She has been in this business for 25 years and believes that the most difficult part is the proper feeding of her cows, since anything undesirable that they eat could affect their milk production. Going forward, she hopes to increase the number of dairy cows that she has because she wants to increase their production. This is Mercedes' first loan with MFP; she knows that she must pay on time and is prepared to do so. She is a very responsible member of her communal bank, always conscientious about making sure that agreements between members are fulfilled. With the nine hundred nuevos soles requested she will purchase more grass feed for her animals, because she knows that her business's success depends on their nutrition.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase feed for cows

loans.name: Haim

texts.en: Mr. Haim M. is 46 years of age, a rice farmer and a widower with a daughter. To earn a living, Haim M. plants rice and vegetables, which he then sells. His daughter is married and still lives at home. She built a hairdressing salon next to her house. Haim M.’s daughter has been running her beauty salon for a long time, but she still requires more tools to provide her services. Due to the lack of money, Haim M. requested a loan for his daughter to buy make-up, perfume, and other equipment. (Haim M. was busy working on the farm when the photo was taken, so his daughter is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To buy makeup, perfume, and other equipments.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay C. is 41 years old and a resident of Kompong Chhnang Province, where she has owned a plot of land that she inherited from her grandmother in 1979. On her land, she and her husband grow rice crops, which she plants twice a year. The couple has a child who attends school and also depends on their income. 

The daily income of this family is not adequate to support them. Svay C. would like to earn additional profits by investing in a new business, but she has no capital to start the process. Therefore, she is interested in requesting a Kiva loan through HKL to be used to buy mature rice from other farmers to resell to raise revenue.

loans.use: To buy rice for resale

loans.name: Charo

texts.es:
Charo es una mujer de 28 años, está casada con Santiago, de 30 años. Ambos viven junto a sus 3 hijos: Sergio de 11, Jack de 7 y Jean Pool de 4 años, en su casa propia ubicada en una zona  fría de la sierra central del Perú.

Para solventar los gastos domésticos ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos oriundos de la selva peruana; como café, cacao, maíz, fréjol y achiote (colorante natural) con la ayuda de su esposo. Asimismo, gracias a las buenas ganancias que obtienen de este negocio lograron adquirir dos terrenos productivos más amplios donde plantaron café y están a la espera de su primera cosecha, también pudieron compara  algunos artefactos necesarios para su vivienda, por lo que Charo considera que vive cómodamente sin apuro alguno, sin embargo le preocupa el asma que sufre el menor de sus hijos.
Lo que más le gusta de su labor diaria, desde hace dos años, es visitar las chacras y poder decidir si compra o no los frutos de acuerdo a la calidad que observa.
Para más adelante, tiene planeado situar un puesto en el mercado más antiguo de la ciudad para que sea más fácil distribuir los productos que vende en grandes cantidades, asimismo asegura que sus ventas serán más rápidas porque cuenta con clientes identificados.
 
Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y ante los miembros de su banco comunal se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos para no defraudar la confianza que están depositando en ella. Como tiene definido qué hacer para progresar, con el dinero que solicita piensa comprar los frutos que hasta hoy comercializa, pero en cantidades mayores que pueda revender para obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Charo is a 28 year old woman who is married to Santiago, age 30. They live with their three children – Sergio (age 11), Jack (age 7), and Jean Pool (age 4) – in their own home in a frigid area in the central mountains of Peru.

To cover her household expenses, Charo buys and sells products that come from the Peruvian jungle such as coffee, cacao, corn, beans, and annatto (a natural food coloring) with the help of her husband. Thanks to the profits from her business, she was able to acquire two plots of productive farmland for planting coffee and is currently awaiting her first crop to harvest. She was also able to buy some basic necessities for her home. Even though she believes her family lives comfortably without any troubles, Charo is concerned about her youngest child who suffers from asthma.

What she enjoys most about her daily work, which she has done for the past two years, is visiting different farms to determine whether or not to buy the harvested produce based on inspecting the quality of the product. In the future, she plans to secure a post at the oldest market in the city so that it will be easier for her sell her products in large quantities. This location will also guarantee her sales will generate faster because the market has its established customers.

Charo will be receiving her first loan from MFP. She has already promised to the other Communal Bank members that she will make her payments on time so as not to betray the trust they have placed in her. In order to progress in her business, she will use the money to buy the same kinds of fruit that she currently sells, except in larger quantities so that she can generate a higher income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit in bulk

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora C. is from the village of Baybay Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 34 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Flora owns and operates a business venture selling food daily in the local community. Flora has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Flora joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional raw products to sell. Flora is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as additional capital

location.town: Sindangan - Baybay Disud, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Felipa Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Felipa D. vive en casa propia en la cuidad de Luque. La misma cuenta con una despensa ubicada a media cuadra de su domicilio, dicho negocio posee hace 5 años contando con buena clientela formada a la fecha ya que su local se encuentra en un lugar estratégico en el barrio.
A la fecha la titular ha retirado un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías  para su despensa y así seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela.
texts.en:
Felipa D. lives in her own home in the city of Luque. She has a store half a block from her home. For 5 years, the business has counted on good customers, from the day that she found a good location at a strategic spot in the neighborhood. Now the owner will put aside the loan for the purchase of merchandise for her store to continue giving good service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of baked goods, dairy items, noodles, and sugar for sale

loans.name: Grupo Unido Group

texts.es:
JUDITH MARISOL, TIENE 34 AÑOS, TIENE DOS PEQUEÑOS HIJOS. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO D. NOMBRE "GRUPO UNIDO", FORMADO POR 10 PERSONAS MUY TRABAJADORAS RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO, QUIENES LA ELIGIERON COMO SECRETARIA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
JUDITH MARISOL TIENE DOS ACTIVIDADES, QUE SON LAS QUE LE GENERAN INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS PARA MANTENER A SUS DOS HIJOS YA QUE ELLA ES PADRE Y MADRE PARA ELLOS.
UNA D. SUS ACTIVIDADES HACE CUATRO AÑOS, ES PRESTAR SERVICIO A UNA EMPRESA EN LA FABRICACIÓN D. ARTICULOS D. ARTESANÍA, CON LOS INGRESOS D. ÉSTA ACTIVIDAD ELLA HA PODIDO ADQUIRIR POCO A POCO SUS MÁQUINAS PARA PRESTAR SERVICIO D. CONFECCIÓN ACTIVIDAD A LA QUE SE DEDICA HACE HACE DIEZ AÑOS.
CON SUS INGRESOS, ELLA HA LOGRADO TENER UNA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA, Y SE PROYECTA A CONSEGUIR MAS ADELANTE APERTURAR UN TALLER D. COSTURA CON MÁQUINAS COMPLETAS Y MODERNIZADAS.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA D. MATERILAES NECESARIOS PARA LA FABRICACIÓN D. ARTÍCULOS D. ARTESANÍA.
texts.en:
Judith Marisol is 34 years old and has two small children. She heads up the “Grupo Unido” [United Group] communal bank. Grupo Unido has ten hardworking members from the Carabayllo district, who have elected Judith as their secretary of the board of directors. Judith has two businesses to generate income for her family, where she fills the roles of both father and mother. For the last four years, she has worked for a company making handicrafts. With these earnings, she has, little by little, acquired the machines for making clothing, a traD. she has practiced for ten years. With her earnings, Judith has achieved economic stability. In the future, she plans to open a tailor workshop with complete and modern equipment. This loan will be used to buy materials for making handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials for making handicrafts

loans.name: Lita

texts.en: Married with children who go to school, 56-year-old Lita runs a sari-sari store at her house. She works hard to be able to provide for her family and sustain her children’s education. She also sought the help of CEVI, a microfinance organization in the Philippines, to gain financial support for her business. She says that its program is really helpful to entrepreneurs like her who need financial assistance. Lita is now applying for a loan of Php18,000, which she will use to acquire vinegar, sugar and other merchandise she sells in her store.

loans.use: Additional inventory

loans.name: Janery Del Carmen

texts.es:
Janery de 34 años de edad habita en el municipio de La Libertad, es casada con el Sr. Luis Alvarez con quien tiene 2 hijos, la mayor Hermida de 16 años de edad estudiando 3er año de secundaria y Danyeli de 2 añitos.  Trabaja como docente para el MINED de La Libertad desde hace 17 años, en la Escuela Base Rafaela Herrera en la comunidad de Cosmatillo. Su esposo es albañil y trabaja fuera porque aqui no encuentra mucho trabajo, pero le envia dinero para los gastos del hogar. 

Janery esta solicitando su 6to credito para mejorar la vivienda en donde vive, construyendo un sumidero, y desea hacerlo antes que empiece el invierno.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es que su familia viva con las condiciones necesarias y que sus hijas estudien y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Janery, age 34, lives in the municipality of La Libertad with her two children and her husband Luis Alvarez. The elder daughter Hermida is 16 and is a third-year high-school student; the younger Danyeli is two years old. For 17 years, Janery has been working as a teacher for the Ministry of Education of La Liberdad, in the Rafaela Herrera school, located in the Cosmatillo community. Janery's husband is a construction worker, and he works out of town because where they live there isn't much available work; he sends her money to cover household expenses. Janery is seeking her sixth loan which will be used to make improvements in her home; she is installing a drain and would like to finish it before the winter comes. Janery's biggest dream is that her family would have everything they need, and that her daughters would study and grow up to become good people.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of a drain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen S. is 39 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish in and around the community for more than nine years. She sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier and from other fishermen. She is married to Visal, 43, who has a great deal of experience in building stone and wooden houses from which he earns a living. 

Sen S. has given birth to two kids, both of whom are no longer in school and are now unemployed. She wants to encourage both of her children to have suitable jobs as vehicle repairmen, but she doesn’t have money yet to do so. Therefore, Sen S. decided to request a loan to buy tools for her children to begin providing that service.

loans.use: To buy tools for vehicle repair.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un pequeño hijo, radica en el caserío Pedregal del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Piura, ubicado en la región del mismo nombre. Se encuentra ubicado a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda. Allí ella pone al alcance de la mano de sus clientes productos de uso diarios por los que tendría que trasladarse hasta el pueblo. Esta actividad es la única que le genera ingresos por lo que trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.

Viviana desea adquirir más productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Viviana es una mujer luchadora que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de su condición de madre soltera, su mayor anhelo es darle a su hijo una educación de calidad que le permita convertirse en un hombre de bien.
texts.en:
Viviana is 30-years-old. She's a single mother with a small child. She lives in the hamlet of Pedregal in the district Tambogrande, an agricultural district in the province of Piura, located in the region of the same name. She lives more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For more than five years she has sold essential items and groceries in a store inside her home. At this store she puts essential daily items at the reach of her clients, who would otherwise have to travel to the nearest town to shop. This business is the best way for her to generate enough income to maintain a suitable quality of life. Viviana wants to acquire more products to satisfy the demand of her clients, expand her sales, and increase her income. For this reason she has asked for the first time for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency; equivalent to $550) from Edpyme Alternativa, which will help her achieve her goal. Viviana is a determined woman who has known how to come out on top despite being a single mother. Her greatest wish is to give her son a quality education that will help him become a good man.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of essential items and groceries to expand the store in her home

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen lives in the historic city called Lahore which is famous for its gardens and its culture in all of Pakistan. She is the mother of five children: four sons and a daughter.  

None of them were able to get their education due to poor financial conditions, but now things are a bit different because three of her sons have started doing work to support the family. Two of them make shoes and other is involved in Punjabi food-selling business. 

Parveen has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who sells fruit in the fruit market.  With the loan amount, he will buy fruit in bulk which will help him make more income as the result of the availability of more stock and more fruit variety.  

Parveen hopes that with the help of increased profit she will be able to send her youngest son to school as he is still just 7 years of age, and her family's financial problems will be solved.

loans.use: Purchase fruit for resale

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
M. Nodira is 36 years old. She is married with two children. Nodira is running her own business to help her husband to support the family. She is selling jewellery. Nodira has been in this business for more than 12 years. Today Nodira requests 7500 Somoni to purchase new items of jewelry like earrings, rings, bracelets, and chains in order to increase the range of goods she sells. This is the eleventh loan Nodira has taken out and she promises to observe all the procedures concerning the payment of the loan as she has done with previous loans. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more jewellery to sell.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban, de 49 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente, Esteban ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus platanales y cafetales, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de La Merced, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus verdes campos, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra todo el día, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para realizar otras actividades. Para más adelante, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado de cítricos, ya que por estas fechas es el fruto que mejor se vende. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudara bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su grupo comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Esteban is 49 years old. He is a very hard working, uncomplicated person. He lives alone in his own home. His greatest wish is to improve his quality of life. Working arduously Esteban has managed to successfully reap his fields. Every day he wakes very early in the morning to irrigate and care for his banana and coffee plantations. He sells his harvest in the city of La Merced, location where he always gets the best revenues for his products. What he enjoys most about his work is being able to enjoy the freedom of working in his green fields. He has been an agriculturer for 30 years. The most difficult part about his work is the long hours of work, especially around this critical time of year when the harvest is in highest demand. This is the second loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He realizes that this loan will help him significantly in the progress of his business. He is committed to making his payments on time. As a member of his community group he is known to be very responsible and he is very well respected for this. Withthe one thousand soles that he is requesting he will purchase fertilizer for his plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bicycle repair parts.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva, de 35 años, vive en una casa alquilada en compañía de sus 3 hijos menores, que aún estudian en el colegio, juntos desean salir adelante, habitan en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Hace más de 3 años, esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la comercialización de diversos productos comestibles (quesos, palta y carne) que compra cuando viaja a una provincia cercana de la ciudad, y cuando regresa coloca su mercadería en las tiendas de su barrio. Dice que el negocio es bastante rentable ya que tiene clientes fijos que le compran su mercadería una vez a la semana, y con las ganancias trata de brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Además se gana la vida lavando ropa para sus conocidos, por lo que cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos. Y como ella misma se considera una “mil oficios”, además trabaja como cobradora de un ómnibus que maneja su hermano; dice muy orgullosa que tiene los papeles en regla para desempeñar este trabajo. Para mas adelante tiene planeado ampliar su negocio de venta de comestibles pues se ha dado cuenta que le genera buenas ganancias. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar laborando en busca del progreso. Eva tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en quesos y palta pues tiene varios pedidos de diferentes tiendas, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Eva is 35 years old and lives in a rented house with her three young children who are in school. They want to get ahead together. Eva and her family live in a populous neighborhood north of the city. For more than three years, this hardworking woman has been selling different food products (cheese, avocados, and meat) that she acquires when she travels to the neighboring province. Upon her return, she distributes her merchandise to the stores in her neighborhood. Eva says her business is profitable enough since she has established customers who buy merchandise on a weekly basis. With her earnings, she is able to provide the best for her children. Eva says she has several jobs since she also works as a bus fare collector for a vehicle that her brother drives. She says she is proud to have achieved the proper registration papers needed to perform this work. In the distant future, Eva plans to expand her food sales business so that she can generate good revenues.

This is her first loan with MFP. Eva is very grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue working and making progress. She plans to invest the loan she requested in the purchase of more merchandise, such as cheese and avocados, since she has several orders from different stores. In this manner, she hopes to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese & avocados to fulfill her customers' orders

loans.name: Maria Albertina

texts.es:
María Albertina es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a s esposo y a sus cuatro hijos en el caserío Santa Isabel, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población ubicada en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre sí. El lugar pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Ella cría aves de corral y cuyes en unos corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio, alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales y cada quice dias los vende en el mercado de su distrito. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, que es comerciante de leña, en el sostenimiento de la economia de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas animales y mejorando la alimentación de los mismos para poder venderlos a un mejor precio, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de animales y alimento balanceado.

Su mayor anhelo es ver a su familia progresar y mejorar gradualmente su calidad de vida. Para ello se ha propuesto trabajar arduamente y seguir apoyando a su esposo. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
María Albertina, 32, is a mother living with her husband and their four children in the Santa Isabel settlement, a rural zone in Mórrope district, noted for having its population scattered among rural settlements that are quite far from each other. The place is part of Lambayeque province and is located over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. She raises small farm animals for sale. She raises barnyard fowl and guinea pigs in some pens located in her back yard. She feeds them grains and natural grasses and sells them every two weeks in her district market. Income from these sales help her husband, who is a firewood merchant, to support the family. María wants to expand her business buying more animals and improving their nutrition so that she can sell them for a better price. To reach this goal she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan to buy animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them. Her greatest wish is to see her family make progress and gradually improve their quality of life. For that, she has pledged herself to work hard and continue to support her husband’s efforts. People who are acquainted with her consider her to be a levelheaded, responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Serna

texts.en:
Serna T. is from the village of Bantug. She is 42 years old. Serna is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Serna owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from tending a canteen near the school. Serna has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Serna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Serna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Serna is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Serna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred N. O. is 27 years old and married and with one child. He distributes bread to people in his neighborhood. He uses his bicycle to transport bread. Thanks to Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer care, he has learned how to retain his customers. He also does bodaboda (bicycle transport) to boost his income. He sees himself building apartments in five years. He has requested 80000 KES to open a mini-bakery.

loans.use: To open a mini-bakery

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou J. is from the village of Malagana, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Marilou is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, biscuits & junk food in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn V. is a 28-year-old married woman selected as the group leader of this four-member loan. They all reside in Kong Noy village in Kandal Province and hope to improve their family living conditions with the loans.

Mrs. Phorn V. is a seamstress in a garment factory, while her husband, Mr. Hun Phearom is a bodyguard. She would like to ask for a loan to buy a wardrobe for home use.

loans.use: To buy a wardrobe for home use

loans.name: Yab's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Yab P. is a loan group leader. He has been selected by the other four members of the loan group. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose, but all hope that it will improve their family's standard of living. The members live in Lekh Bei Village in Kandal Province. 

He is a taxi driver who uses a trailer for taxi transportation. His taxi business supports his family. His wife, Mrs. Chreb Vet, does housework and cooks delicious food for her family. Mr. Yab P.'s trailer is too old to use, so he is applying for a loan to buy another trailer. 

He is 29-year-old and he has four children, two of whom are students. The others are too young to work or study. On the day that the loan was disbursed, Mr. Yab P. was busy working. Instead, his wife, Mrs. Chreb Vet, received the loan for him. The photo above is of Mr. Yab P.'s wife.

loans.use: To buy another trailer

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en: Kuy B., 39, is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, he would like to use any additional profits to repair his house. B. is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 8 per day. B. is married and lives with his wife and four children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for its garment factory industry. The family has to spend USD 70 on food, USD 10 on electricity, and USD 40 on other necessary expenses every month. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Maria Elena Mollano Group

texts.es: José U. es el secretario del grupo Marielena Moyano. Este grupo de 12 integrantes escogió su nombre en honor de una heroína peruana.  José U. de 48 años de edad casado y con tres hijos de los cuales uno aun es menor de edad,  tiene un negocio en que prepara buffet para eventos sociales, comenzó con este negocio hace mas de 6 años a raíz de que no avía este tipo de servicios en la zona donde vive, con el tiempo le gustaría ampliar su negocio a otros distritos y así poder expandirse y ser  más conocido su negocio, con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en compra de mercadería como bandejas y utensilios de cocina. Así como el señor José U. cada integrante de este grupo tiene una meta por cumplir y un desafío por realizar el cual es la mejoría económica en sus hogares y un negocio estable.
texts.en:
José U. is the secretary of the 'Marielena Moyano' group.  This group has 12 members and they chose their name in honor of a Peruvian heroine.

José U. is 48 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is still a minor.  He has a business in which he prepares buffets for social events.  He started out in this business more than 6 years ago as this type of service didn't exist in his area.  Over time, he would like to expand his business in other districts.  This will enable him to expand and enable his business to become more well known.  José U. will invest his loan in buying merchandise such as trays and cooking utensils.

Just like José U., every member of this group has a goal to achieve and a challenge in improving their household finances and maintaining a stable business.

loans.use: To buy trays and cooking utensils

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice, aged thirty-three, would like a loan to buy land.  She lives in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda, and owns a retail shop.  Alice dreams of building a good house and expanding her business.

loans.use: Purchase  of  land

loans.name: Butunduzi Bakyara Kweyombeka Group

texts.en: Leonard is a member of Butunduzi Bakyara Kweyombeka group, where each member guarantees for the others to access credit. Leonard is a farmer and he has been farming for the past eight years. With the profits generated, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. He desires to have his children educated and to become a large scale farmer. Leonard needs a loan to cultivate his land for crop growing.

loans.use: To cultivate land for crop growing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Open a radio repair shop

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng V. is 48 years old and his wife, Mrs. Phors Hin, is 38 years old.  The couple lives in a village about 30 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children -- three sons and one daughter. One is married. Two of their children are garment factory workers, one attends school and another one stays at home.   

Mr. Heng V. is a traditional Khmer doctor. He helps patients who have broken their hand or foot bones. His wife stays at home and does housework. Mr. Heng V. hopes to supplement their income with a new business, raising pigs, where he would sell the pigs when they grow big enough.  He is applying for his first loan, for $1,000, to purchase piglets to raise and build a pigpen.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and build a pigpen.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 24 years old, married, and has three children. She has been tailoring for ten years, and has benefited by getting business loans from Faulu Kenya. She has used her previous loans to boost her business. She plans to buy more sewing machines in the future. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy fabric and threads.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Lak

texts.en:
Lak S. is a 52-year-old married woman and mother who has been living in the province of Kompong Tom. Lak S. and her husband have spent most of their lifetime with growing rice and cashews on their existing farmland. They have seven children; two are married and have started to live in their own houses, while the rest are single and of one them is employed as a worker in the garment industry. 

Lak S. is concerned because she has one child who is going to marry soon, but her personal savings are not enough to hold the wedding party for her child. In order to deal with this problem, Lak S. would like to request some funds as a Kiva loan for assisting her child to prepare the wedding ceremony which is coming up in a short time.

loans.use: To hold a wedding party for her child.

loans.name: Maria Ignacia

texts.es: Maria tiene 49 años de edad. Vive con su esposo quien trabaja como chofer de taxi. Tienen dos hijos de 11 y 12 años de edad. Residen en el distrito de San José, unos 15 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Esta pequeña comunidad se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería. Desde hace 25 años, se dedica al servicio de costura en su domicilio. Cuenta con una máquina de costura. Brinda un servicio profesional y de alta calidad, por lo que es muy conocida en la zona. Su instrumento de trabajo ha sufrido un desperfecto, por lo que está solicitando un crédito para repararlo. De esa manera, podrá seguir apoyando con su servicio a la comunidad. Su más grande sueño es tener un taller de confecciones y dar trabajo a sus vecinos. Esté es su primer crédito con Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) y agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por la oportunidad brindada a ella a seguir creciendo su negocio.
texts.en: Maria is 49 years old. She lives with her husband who works as a taxi driver. They have two children who are 11 and 12 years old. They live in the San Jose district, some 15 minutes from the province of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. This little community is primarily agricultural and livestock-raising. For 25 years, she has been making clothes from her home. She has a sewing machine. She offers a professional, high-quality service, and so she is well known in the area. Her work tool has been damaged, and she is requesting a loan in order to repair it. In this way, she will be able to keep offering her service to the community. Her biggest dream is to have a tailoring workshop and to be able to give work to her neighbors. This is her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) and she is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the opportunity offered to her to keep growing her business.

loans.use: to fix her sewing machine so she can keep serving her customers.

loans.name: Barack

texts.en:
Barack O. O. is thirty-two years old and married. His wife helps him run his business, and they have five children between the ages of eleven and one year old.  They hope to provide their children with a good education to the University level.

Barack's business is located at the busy Juakali Market in Nairobi. He makes and sells items such as steel doors, metal boxes, and cookers. He serves the local people. He has been in this business for fifteen years and has four employees. He says that his business is profitable, but a major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He will use the loan of KES 85,000 to buy scrap metal to grow his business. He hopes to expand the business until it becomes a company that can provide employment to many people. Barack describes himself as dedicated, obedient, and God-fearing.

loans.use: purchase scrap metal for his business.

loans.name: Abdurafi

texts.en:
Abdurafi is 41 years old. He is married with 4 children. Abdurafi sells dried fruits in the central local market. He has been in this business for 10 years. The dried fruits are very popular in Tajikistan. Any hostess has dried fruits in store for serving in case there are guests in the house. Moreover, dried fruits are, as a rule, served during all family occasions like wedding parties, birthday parties and others. Considering the constant demand for this kind of item, Abdurafi's business is quite successful and brings a stable income for the family. 

Today Abdurafi requests a loan of 2,500 USD for purchasing dried fruits with the purpose of increasing the variety of goods he sells. Abdurafi has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history. Now he would like to thank all for their support and to promise to pay the loan in time.
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits to increase the variety of items he sells

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Uganda. She is married and has 8 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (in-laws).  

Hadjah has a business of selling local gin. She has been in this business for 5 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Hadjah sells her products from home, by means of wholesale.   

Hadjah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of local gin. The main business challenges for Hadjah include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and to own a delivery van.   

Hadjah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Kamirpata Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento Kamirpata,  esta conformado por un grupo de señoras que  viven en su mayoría en L. zona de kamirpata (alto achachicaL.) y se dedican al comercio minorista y otras actividades laborales,  L. presidenta es L. señora Daría se dedica al arreglo de refrigeradores en su taller de refrigeración de L. ciudad de el alto tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar  y vive en L. casa de sus papas ha sido elegida en L. directiva por sus compañeras por ser una de las socias que asiste a todas las reuniones  y ha sido L. coordinadora en el grupo para su conformación además de ser un apersona responsable y trabajadora, con el dinero del crédito comprara herramientas para su taller de refrigeración  ya que las que tiene ya están descompuestas, el deseo de L. Sra. Daria es el de poder ver un día a sus hijos profesionales y personas de bien es muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con L. institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The entrepreneur's bank Kamirpata is made up of a group of women who mostly live in the Kamirpata zone (AchachicaL. Heights) and work as small merchants and other trades. The president, Daria, fixes refrigerators in her refrigeration workshop in the city of El Alto. She has three school-aged children and lives in her parents' house. She has been chosen to be on the board by her peers because she is one of the members that attends all of the meetings and has coordinated the group during its formation, in addition to being a hardworking and responsible person. 

With the money from the loan she will buy tools for her refrigeration workshop because the ones that she has are falling apart. Daria wants to one day see her children be professionals and well-off. She is very hardworking and is grateful to the institution for the support it has given her.

loans.use: to buy tools for her refrigeration workshop.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has 4 children. She has been selling rice and other food items such as onions, garden eggs, etc. in Abura for 3 years. Her husband is a driver. To assist her husband, Ama provides food and clothing for the family's daily needs.  Ama is going to use this loan to purchase bags of rice and onions to resell. The profits from her business as a result of the loan will be used to build a store room.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and onions to resell.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Mrs. Pen, 27, lives in the province of Siem Reap and cares for one child. She runs a small wooden store in front of her house, where she sells little snack foods, soft drinks, shampoo, and some groceries to her neighbors. 

To generate more income, her husband works as a motor taxi driver in and around his village. Mrs. Pen is requesting her loan to buy grocery inventory for her store. She will use the rest of the money to buy a new motor for her husband to run his motor taxi service.

loans.use: to buy grocery inventory for her store and to buy a new motor for her husband's taxi

loans.name: Savouen

texts.en: Savouen, 43 year old, is selling food in the market. Her income is $8 per day. She is a single mother with four children. Two of the children are studying and the other two are working with an income of $2 per day. Every month she has to spend $40 on food, $30 on school fees, $30 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would to request a loan of $500 to buy construction materials to build a small shop for her son to do car polishing. In the future, she would like to send the rest of her children to study at the university so that they can have a good job to do.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a polishing shop for her son

loans.name: Houdalo

texts.fr:
Houdalo est une femme âgée de 56 ans.Elle est veuve et sans enfant.
Houdalo travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend du charbon de bois et revend à domicile dans sa maison sise à Adamavo.Elle effectue seule cette activité.
Houdalo a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin de s’approvisionner en sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en: Houdalo is a 56-year-old woman, a widow with no children. She has been working as a retailer since 2000. She sells charcoal and resells out of her house located in Adamavo. This is the only work she does. Houdalo has requested her second loan from WAGES to stock up on sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru:
Исматулло шустрый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и отец 3 детей. Когда ему было 18 лет он начал свой собственный бизнес. Он начал реализовать хлопковое масло и пшеничную муку. Он покупает товар с других рынка районов, а продает на местном рынке. Он старается, содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни и обеспечит нужд своих детей. Кроме этого Исматулло дома занимается скотоводством. Исматулло хочет увеличить свой оборотный капитал и расширить свой бизнес. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США. Он заранее благодарит всех за поддержку и поощрение.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Ismatullo is a smart and honest man. He is married and is a father of three children. When he was eighteen years old he started his own business. He began to sell cotton oil and wheat flour. He buys his product from markets in other regions and then sells in on the local market. He tries to provide for his family with best living conditions and satisfy the needs of his children. Besides this Ismatullo does animal husbandry at home. He wants to increase his working capital and expand his business. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $2,000USD with this purpose. Ismatullo is thanking everyone for the support and encouragement in advance.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cotton oil and wheat flour

loans.name: Laok

texts.en:
Laok, 31, is a married man and father of three school-aged children. He currently opens a small store in front of his house. From this trade he gains a low income per day. Taking time from this business, Laok has been running a small business as a charcoal seller. Here Laok earns about $3 each day also. 

He now wants to improve his charcoal business but has a lack of capital, so he has decided to request some funds from HKL and Kiva. He will use these funds to purchase more charcoal. He expects that this fund will develop his business and gain more revenue everyday.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 29 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Raúl de 32 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Maida de 09 y Aurelio de 04 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Rebeca, es una mujer de ardua labor, se esmera a diario por entregar lo mejor de si misma a los miembros de su familia, ella se dedica al trabajo del agro donde siembra café y cacao. Viene realizando esta actividad hace 05 años con mucho cuidado y laboriosidad,  porque gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus plantas, ella compró una cuadra más de terreno para seguir cultivando. En tiempo de cosechas y deshierbo de malezas tiene que contratar jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Ella cuenta con espacios de tierra sin cultivar, lo cual inevitablemente necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para llevar consigo su trabajo, tiene planeado sembrar sus fincas con más plantas de café, por ello acude a los créditos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas de bajos recursos con miras a progresar. Con el tiempo espera comprar más espacios de terreno. Este es su segundo crédito y esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con lo planeado. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más semillas de café.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 29, and from the city of Santa Rosa.  She is a hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her partner Raúl, 32, and their two dear children; Maida, who is nine, and Aurelio who is four. Their children are the reason for all their efforts. Rebeca is industrious, and every day she tries very hard to do her best for the members of her family. She is a farmer, and grows coffee and cacao. 

She has been doing this work for five years, with great care and diligence. Thanks to the harvest that her crops provide, she bought another block of land in order to continue farming.  At harvest and at weeding time she has to hire day laborers, in order to get the planned work done more quickly. 

Part of her land is not cultivated, and inevitably, support from a financial institution is required to carry forward the work. She plans to sow her lands with more coffee plants, and for that reason applied for one of the loans that MFP makes available to low income people looking to progress in their lives. In time, she hopes to buy more land. 

This is her second loan, and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support. In this way she will feel confident of moving forward with her plan. She will use the loan to buy more coffee seeds.

loans.use: To buy more coffee seeds.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en: Jenalyn, a 21-year-old single woman who lives in the Philippines, has had a shop that sells green and yellow bananas for the past two years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, she has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Jenalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.es: Napoleon de 49 años es soltero, trabaja en su propio negocio de Cyber café, el cual esta ubicado cerca del parque central de Nueva Guinea donde ofrece a sus clientes servicio de internet y taypeo de trabajos, encolocado de material didactico y venta de articulos escolares. Esta solicitando su 1er crédito a la institución de AFODENIC, para invertirlo en compra de equipos y articulos con el objetivo de equiparlo mejor y darle mayor calidad de atencion a sus usuarios, que en su mayoria son estudiante de secundaria y universitarios. Napoleon se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable, con mucho deseo de superación.  Su mayor sueño es poder ver su negocio bien establecido para dejarle a su familia mejores oportunidades de crecer.
texts.en:
Napoleon, 49, is single and works in his own Internet café business located near Nueva Granada’s central park where he offers his customers Internet access service, typing services, school project binding and the sale of school supplies.  

He’s asking for his first loan from AFODENIC to invest in equipment and articles to better equip it and provide better quality attention to his users who for the most part are high school and university students.  

Napoleon is noted for being a hardworking, responsible man with a strong drive to succeed.  His greatest dream is to be able to see his business be well established to leave his family better growth opportunities.

loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Jose  Mauro

texts.es: El Sr. José es un hombre muy emprendedor pues comenta que hace ya diez años empezó vendiendo los juguetes de sus hijos ya  que no los  utilizaban  por  que  con el paso del tiempo  fueron creciendo , gracias  a  esto el  se  dio cuenta  que  este  negocio  le  generaba  ingresos que le permitían sacar  adelante a  su  familia, es por  ello  que  necesita  de nuestro apoyo para   realizar  la compra  de mercancía  además  que   desea   iniciar la  venta  de  ropa  usada, agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en: Jose is a very enterprising man. He tells us that it was ten years ago that he started out selling his kids' toys that they were no longer using because they were growing up. He realized that this business generated an income, enough to be able to support his family. But he now needs our help to purchase more merchandise. He wants to start selling used clothing. He is thankful for the support in helping him realize his project.

loans.use: to purchase toys and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Connie has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Oscar tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y cuatro hijos de 8, 10, 12 y 14 años de edad respectivamente. Él es una persona trabajadora, que toda su vida ha trabajado en la agricultura y ganadería, estas actividades las aprendió gracias a su papá, quien le enseño la manera de ganarse la vida honradamente, a pesar de su grado académico, Oscar a puesto todo de su parte para superarse y también forma parte de un comité que le ha fortalecido sus conocimientos educativos.

El préstamo que solicita Oscar, será invertido en la compra de dos vacas lecheras, con el objetivo de tener una fuente de ingresos y la otra parte la empleara en la compra de una achicadora para riego de la agricultura en verano. Debido a que Oscar tiene los residuos de la cosecha de invierno, quiere comprar ganado para aprovechar el pasto y obtener ganancias de la venta de la leche. De esta manera Oscar continuara trabajando en lo que siempre ha realizado y generar ingresos extra que le ayude a él y a su familia.

Con esos ingresos, él desea terminar de construir su casa que tiene las paredes y le falta el techo, ese es su mayor deseo el tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Oscar is 36 years old.  He lives with his life partner and his four children who are 8, 10, 12 and 14 years old.  Oscar is a hard-working person who has worked in farming and livestock raising his whole life.  He learned these businesses from his dad, who showed him how to earn an honest living.  In spite of his academic level, Oscar has worked hard to improve himself.  He is a member of a committee which has strengthened his educational skills.

The loan that Oscar is requesting will be invested in buying two dairy cows with the aim of creating a source of income.  The rest will be used to buy a small water pump for watering his crops in the summer.  As Oscar has waste left over from his winter harvest, he would like to buy cattle so that he can make the most of the pasture and make profits from selling their milk.  In this way, Oscar will continue working, doing what he has always done, and will make extra income which will help him and his family.  With this income, he would like to finish building his house which has walls but still lacks a roof.  Owning his own home is his biggest wish.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: 070301-Thôn 5-Hoằng Thịnh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Tính is 58 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents. She is the leader of a six-member group.

Tính works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. Tính has been involved in this business for six years. The main harship that Tính faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. 

In 2007, Tính joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tính has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Tính hopes to buy land of her own, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, de 25 años, es una mujer muy  trabajadora, convive junto a Pedro de 26 años y sus 02 hijos menores Britney de 07 años y Teddy de 05 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Irma comienza con el cuidado de sus tierras, ya que sabe que de la calidad de sus productos dependerán las ganancias que obtenga por su venta. Sus cultivos de cacao los lleva a vender en su misma localidad, ya que es donde mejores precios obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha alegría, lleva 07 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta su localidad, ya que los sacos son muy pesados. Con el crédito solicitado desea hacer el mantenimiento de su cultivo comprando abono y fertilizantes para que pueda obtener mejores resultados de su producción. Este será préstamo numero 02 con MFP, por tanto espera su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes de trabajo. Con los 500 nuevos soles, podrá realizar el mantenimiento de su cultivo comprando abono y fertilizantes para que pueda obtener mejores resultados de su producción.
texts.en:
Irma, 25, is a very hardworking woman living with Pedro, 26, and their two minor children, Britney, 7, and Teddy, 5, who she wants to provide a better quality of life for. Very early in the morning every day Irma starts caring for her fields because she knows that the quality of her products determines the profits she’ll earn when they are sold.  

She sells her cocoa bean crops in her same community because that’s where she gets the best prices.  What she likes best about her work is planting her fields, something she does with much joy.  She’s been doing this type of work for seven years and considers the most difficult part transporting her products from her field to the location because the sacks are very heavy.  

She intends to use the requested funds to provide care for her crops buying manure and fertilizer so that she can obtain the best results in her harvests.  This will be MFP loan #2 and she hopes to get your collaboration so that she can realize her work plans.  With the 500 new soles she’ll be able to care for her crops buying manure and fertilizer so that harvests will be the best possible.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Portal Group

texts.en:
Numu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Numu is thirty-eight years of age. She is married to a trader and the couple has four children – two in primary school and two in secondary school.  Numu sells margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, sugar, mints, sardines, pens and pencils, etc. She has been in business for the past seven years. 

With the help of this loan, Numu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Numu will use her share of the loan (700,000 SLL) to buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy margi, salt, sugar, mints, sardines, pens and pencils, etc. in large quantity to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 34, is married and has one child. He runs a grocery, as well as a retail shop that has been operating for three years.

This is his first loan with KADET. He will use the funds to buy sugar, rice, milk, vegetables, and fruits. Peter hopes to open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, milk, vegetables, and fruits.

loans.name: Koem

texts.en:
Mr. Koem, 64, and his wife, 62, are in the same business of cultivating rice crops from Takhmao. From the business, they typically earn in the neighborhood of $5.00 per day. On the day the photo was taken, Koem was not available so his wife appears alone in her yard. This couple has been blessed with 5 children, four of whom are already married and live independently. 

Mr. Koem would like to take out a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to put in his farmland. In the future, Koem plans to expand his farming business and grows additional rice crops.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to put in his farmland.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María, originaria de la Ceiba un pequeña comarca localizada en las afueras de Leo tiene 2 hijos, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos , lleva 5 años trabajando en esta actividad. Inicio esta actividad cuando tenia 25 años de edad, pues este negocio lo aprendió por tradición de su familia quien se dedicaba a lo mismo. Ella realizo el crédito para compra de cerdos de desarrollo y compra de concentrado para alimentarlos.
Uno de sus sueños es tener una grana de cerdos reproductores para mejorar sus ventas y poder tener ganancias que le permitan mejorar su vivienda ofrecerle un techo digno a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is originally from La Ceiba, a small region situated on the outskirts of Leon. She has two children. She is a merchant, and she makes a living raising pigs. She has worked in this activity for the past five years. She set up this business when she was 25 years old. She learned this business as a family tradition, as they worked in the same. 

She requests this loan to buy fattening pigs and concentrated feed for them. One of her dreams is to have a pig breeding farm in order to improve her sales and be able to have earning which would allow her to improve her home and offer her children a decent roof over their heads.

loans.use: to buy fattening pigs and concentrated feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Poder pagar la operación de la próstata de tal manera poder ejercer sus funciones con normalidad

loans.name: Dzifa

texts.en:
Dzifa A. was born in Tsévié in 1980. Lacking money, she had to quit school in the 10th grade. She then learned upholstery as a trade, that is, making drapes, cushions, and other furnishings. This is her current craft. She is married but without children. Nevertheless, she is the guardian of her mother’s orphaned niece. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession. But without a car, he currently drives a moped. An energetic woman, Mrs. A. is an excellent upholsterer with a good command of her craft, but she lacks the funds for growing her business and augmenting her income. She has to help with the household expenses, since her husband’s income falls far short of covering them all. For this reason, Dzifa is requesting a loan of $850 to buy the basic materials for her work. She will then be able to help improve the daily life of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Dzifa est née en 1980 à Tsévié. Par manque de moyens, elle a dû abandonner ses études en deuxième degré. Elle s’est formée alors à la tapisserie, métier qu’elle exerce actuellement. Elle est mariée, mais n’a pas encore d’enfant. Néanmoins, elle a à sa charge une nièce orpheline de mère. Son mari chauffeur de profession fait actuellement Zémidjan (taxi-moto) à défaut de voiture. Dynamique, Madame A. Dzifa est une excellente tapissière qui maîtrise bien sa profession, mais manque de moyens pour accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus afin de contribuer au besoins du foyer car les revenus du marie sont très insuffisants pour couvrir toutes les charges y afférentes. Pour ce faire, Dzifa sollicite un crédit de $850 pour acheter les matières premières dans le cadre de son métier. Ce faisant, elle pourra alors contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie quotidienne de la famille.

loans.use: To buy the basic materials for her work

loans.name: Inna

texts.en: Inna G. is a hard working 32-year-old entrepreneur. Besides from working on her farm she looks after her 1- and 9-year-old boys. Inna's husband is employed as a construction worker for the village of Pruteni where they live. Pruteni lies on the Romanian border and is small, with a population of about 1000 families. There is no running water and only the main road is paved. Inna is a typical Moldovan farmer; she works long days with her bees, 4 cows to produce milk , 30 chickens and ducks and 4 pigs. There is always something for her to do on the farm. She would like a loan to purchase some materials for construction and to make repairs on some of her animal's cages.

loans.use: Working capitol and materials to make repairs on her animal cages.

loans.name: Améle

texts.en:
