Améle A. was born in 1964 in Aklakou, where she still resides. She is married and the mother of six. Her husband, a farmer by profession, does not completely cover all household expenses. To address the situation with regard to the needs at home, she started selling cold water. She was successful in saving a little money and invested it in selling smoked and fried fish. Today, she has good experience from 15 years in the fish business. Warmly accommodating and innately moral, Ms. A. is requesting a loan of $600 to buy more fish to meet customer demands. The success of this project will help her family to fully thrive where health, nourishment, schooling, and clothing are concerned.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Madame A. Améle est née en 1964 à Aklakou où elle réside toujours. Mariée et mère de six enfants, la profession d’agriculteur de son mari n’assume pas la totalité des charges du foyer. Pour pouvoir contenir la situation familiale en matière de besoins, Madame A. a commencé par vendre de l’eau fraîche. Elle réussit à épargner un peu d’argent et a investi dans la vente de poissons fumés et fris. Aujourd’hui elle a une bonne expérience dans le commerce de poissons après quinze ans de service. Dotée d’une bonne moralité et d’un accueil ouvert, Madame A. Amélé sollicite un crédit de $600 pour acheter plus de poissons pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle. La réalisation de ce projet aidera Madame A. à atteindre l’épanouissement total de sa famille en matière de santé, de nourriture, de besoins scolaires et vestimentaires.

loans.use: Buying, smoking, and selling fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fish-selling business

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha Roman is 26 years old and married to Pablo Olmendo who is 32 years old. They live in a neighborhood called Corazon de Jesus. They have their own house, and do not have any children yet. At one point, they had to emigrate to Argentina because in their village they had no opportunities for work nor to progress, so they took that detour. Mirtha had the good luck to find good employement as a housekeeper for a family. With great effort and sacrifice, getting through bad times, they were able to get the money to realize their only goal, to return to their country, start their own small business, improve the quality of their lives, and not have to leave their native city again. They returned to Paraguay, and thanks to their savings they began to buy and sell domestic appliances. In a short time they secured a good customer base, visiting them house to house and offering them very good prices. Today they also have exclusivity for a brand of motorbikes to sell to their customers. Mirtha would like to increase the volume of their business, and with the loan they will buy refrigerators, as they have various requests for the summer.

Mirtha R. tiene 26 años de edad esta casada con el señor Pablo Olmendo de 32 años, viven en el barrio Corazón de Jesús tiene casa propia y aún no tienen hijos. En un momento tuvieron que emigrar a la Argentina ya que en su pueblo no tenían oportunidades de trabajo ni de progreso así que tomaron ese desafió. Mirtha tuvo la suerte de que conseguir un buen empleo como empleada domestica en una casa de familia. Con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pasando necesidades y malos momentos lograron hacerse de capital tenían una única ilusión, el de volver al país, y montar un pequeño negocio que sea de su propiedad para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y no tener que volver a salir de su ciudad natal. Fue que volvieron a Paraguay, y gracias a sus ahorros iniciaron la compra y venta de electrodomésticos; en muy poco tiempo consiguieron muy buena clientela ya que les brinda comodidad realizando la visita casa por casa y ofreciéndoles muy buen precio hoy día también tiene la exclusividad de una marca de motos para la venta financiada a sus clientes. Mirtha desea aumentar el volumen de su negocio y con el préstamo comprara heladeras ya que tiene varios pedidos para este verano.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Purchase refrigerators

loans.name: Pauline Nchotu

texts.en:
Pauline is married to Nchotu Aaron and is the mother of eight children, three of whom died in one year. Though their deaths were attributed to witchcraft, the root cause was poverty and lack of money to pay for their medications and carry out a proper diagnosis.

In order to have some income, she decided to start a business and solicited loans from GHAPE. With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to buy and sell foods, such as corn, sweet potatoes, ginger and cocoyam (taro root) so she can raise money to pay the school fees for her children. She also plans to feed her family with some of the food sold.

She will repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase cocoyam, corn, ginger and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Moin

texts.en: Mrs. Moin N., age 38, works raising pigs, making $3 each day. Her husband is a fisherman, earning around $4/day. They have three children, two who are students and one who is unemployed. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase a boat with a motor to expand her husband’s fishing business to meet customer demand. This will increase the family’s income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat with a motor.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose E. is a Bini by tribe from Edo state, Nigeria. She sells yams at market. She is 51 years old, married with 8 children. She is a LAPO member and she needs the loan of $450 to buy more yams for sale. She learned this business for 12 months and started her business 1998.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en:
Mirian is thirty-four years old and the mother of two boys, ages ten and twelve, both of whom attend school. Her husband works at a nearby hotel. To supplement her family’s income, Mirian sells an assortment of women’s shoes and slippers. Most of her customers are friends and neighbors in her community, but Mirian also travels to Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic, to sell her shoes.

Mirian is excited about the opportunity to increase the sizes and styles of her shoe inventory with her loan. She explains that her business will help support her children’s educations and her family’s well being.

loans.use: To buy new sizes and styles of shoes to sell

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 37-year-old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Zangilan region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He settled in the town of Khirdalan.

Three years ago, Iman started a taxi business. Now he is requesting a loan of $600 to buy the spare parts for maintaining his taxi.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to maintain the taxi

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
Celina H. P. is a member of the Comunal Bank Carmen Cabrejos, which is located on the street Jr. Guido Bonzano, No. 180, in the district of Calleria in the state Ucayali. Celina is 56 years old and a mother of two children.

The first loan which Celina received from “Manuela Ramos” was S/.300 ($120). Celina invested this sum in groceries and other merchandise.

Since the first loan Celina has expanded her business into a small grocery store. Celina awakes every morning at 7:00 AM in order to prepare breakfast for her husband and children. Afterwards, Celina attends to the clients of her grocery store until 7:00 PM.

With the currently requested loan of S/. 1,000 ($375), which will be repaid in 5 months, Celina will purchase 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 box of eggs, etc.

Celina is very proud of herself. She is confident that she has managed to better her life through her personal conviction and need provide for her family. She is also grateful for the assistance that “Manuela Ramos” has provided her and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein and Perla Mendoza.

La señora Celina pertenece al Banco Comunal Carmen Cabrejos, ubicado en el Jr Guido Bonzano No 180, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 años y es madre de 2 hijos. Celina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de abarrotes. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su espos, luego se dedica a la atención de su bodega hasta las 7 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de huevos, 1 caja de leche, etc. Celina esta muy feliz, por que esta convencida que salió adelante por convicción propia viendo las necesidades de su familia ahora esta orgullosa de ella misma y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mr. Em C., 65, and his wife, Mrs. Nut SOUN, 53, were married in 1972. They have three sons, one of whom weaves mosquito nets at home. The other two of  are masons. And their only daughter has full time employment. The family lives across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Em and his wife have been mosquito net weavers since 1985. He is in his middle 60s but still strong enough to work. They sell the finished products to the middleman in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh. 

Now, Em is requesting a loan of US$1100 to purchase a looming semi machine for weaving mosquito nets.

loans.use: To purchase a looming semi machine for weaving mosquito nets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy  and sell women's clothing

loans.name: Nicida

texts.es:
For a lot of time, Nicida has dedicated herself to the sale of groceries, she is 51 years old and mother of 6 children of which 5 are already independents, while the last is studying. She also dedicates herself to the sale of food at lunchtime and has a steady clientele that enjoy her good flavors. Nicida does everything for her children and only hopes that they will be professionals and good men. Mrs. Nicida has the proposal, to better her business (store) and bring success to her Minimarket and later build a kiosk for selling her food, for this she requests more capital that will help solidify her objective. With your help, Nicida will see her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Nicida se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace mucho tiempo, ella a sus 51 años de edad es madre de 6 hijos de los cuales 5 de ellos ya son independientes, mientras que la última está a su cargo y estudia, la misma, que significa el camino a seguir adelante en su negocio, ella a su vez, se dedica a la venta de comida en la hora del almuerzo y cuenta con una concurrida clientela que degustan de su buena sazón. Nicida hace de todo por sus hijos y sólo espera que en un mañana sean profesionales y hombres de bien.La señora Nicida tiene un propósito, que es ampliar su negocio (bodega) y llegar a tener más adelante su Minimarket y posteriormente mandar a construir un kiosco para la venta de comida, para ello requiere de un capital que la ayudará a concretar su objetivo a mediano plazo. Con tu ayuda, la señora Nicida verá crecer su negocio en el tiempo menos esperado.

loans.use: To improve and carry out her business.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna K. sells footwear (shoes and boots). He is married, but his wife's income in her business is not sufficient for them and their 3 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Luis Francisco

texts.es:
Luis Francisco inició el negocio porque no alcanza con su sueldo para poder solventar los gastos de sus hijos tanto en sus estudios como en los problemas de salud de dos de ellos. Por lo que se empezó a dedicar a reparar pulidoras y aspiradoras, y gracias a esta actividad ha podido sacra adelante a su familia.

El necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar herramienta para dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes y así obtener mayor ganancia para el sustento de la familia.
texts.en:
Luis Francisco started his business because he was not able to afford his two children's educational or health care expenses on his salary. This is the reason he began to repair polishing devices and vacuum cleaners. Thanks to this activity, he has been able to help out his family.

Luis needs a loan of $475 to buy tools that will allow him to provide better service to his clients and will therefore increase the contribution he makes toward supporting his family; he will repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz H.  is 55 years old. She is married and has three children. Gulnaz sells drugs at a drug store. She has an education in pharmacy, and now she is one of the leading pharmacists in her region. She rents a place in the center of town. She has been running her small business for more that 15 years. Gulnaz works very hard to give her children a good education and to make them happy. 

In order to cover the higher education expenses of her oldest child at the university, Gulnaz wants to increase her range of goods. For this reason she applied for a loan of $1200 USD. She thanks you for your support and promises to repay the loan on time. She is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Gulnaz's business.

loans.use: To increase increase her range of goods

loans.name: Norena

texts.en: Norena J. is 46 years old and is married with four children. Norena runs a viewing centre where teenagers play computer games. She also sells drinks and pure water. In addition to this shop she has a kiosk where she sells phone calls and rechargeable phone cards. She has been in this business for a long time. She buys ice blocks to cool drinks in these coolers that are showing in the picture. She is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge to cool her drinks. Usually, she loses her customers when she does not get blocks to cool the drinks. She will also purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says "thank you" to all of the people that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge and rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sr. Josefa  tiene 54 años de edad, casada, su marido tiene 74 años, el cual recibe una pensión de asegurado y ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Habitante Healeah, los clientes tienen un bus que viaja de Managua a Juigalpa, lo trabajado  uno de sus hijos. Su casa es de zinc y tablas, no posee una seguridad. Sus planes son construir la casa de concreto. La Clienta cuenta con 6 años de experiencia en el servicio de trasporte y como unas de su meta a futuro es cambiar la unidad de trasporte que poseen debido a que la actual tiene unas fallas y darle un mejor servicio a los pasajeros. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic encuentra una forma de realizar sus planes y proyectos de crecer con su negocio. Brindándole al publico en general una forma de viajar a sus puntos de trabajo y seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Josefa is 54 years old and married. Her husband is 74 years old, receives retirement benefits and helps with the cost of living. They live in Healeah and own a bus that travels between Managua and Juigalpa, one of their sons also works on the bus. Her house is made of tin and planks and she does not have social security. They plan to build a house of concrete. Josefa has 6 years of experience in transportation services and one of her goals is changing the bus they have as it has some faults. Thus, she can offer a better service to her passengers. Owing to the loans of Afodenic she can achieve her plans and projects to grow her business and offer the public a way of travel to their workplaces and security to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material to build her house

loans.name: Mr. Oeurn Kroeurn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Oeurn K. is the president of a village bank in Phum Dabprambei village in Kampong Cham province. The bank has twenty members.

Mr. Oeurn K. is 48 years old. He is a laborer who earns a small income that supports his household. To improve his family's living conditions, he has decided to request a loan to buy piglets to start a pig-breeding business. He hopes to increase his income and to provide a better life for his family when he sells his pigs. 

His wife, Mrs. SU. Ny, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. Mr. Oeurn K. has five children. One of the children is a laborer, three are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest is just five years old.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Elida is active member of a Bank of Hope outside of San Pedro de Macoris. She works as a street vendor selling various products. Her business provides for her three children, who attend the local elementary school.  All three of them are wonderful kids, full of energy and life.  

She would use this loan to add a supporting wall dividing her house into two rooms and to finish pouring her cement floor.  Presently, the house has only one room, and only part of the floor is cement.  Elida believes the cement floor and wall will greatly enhance her family's daily life and give her children privacy.  She plans to bring up her family in this house and wants her children to benefit from a stable shelter that promotes health and dignity.

Please support Elida with a loan.  Thank you!

loans.use: A supporting wall and part of a cement floor

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah has been a  a maize seller in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha for 11 years. She belongs to Ikunda group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $235. Every day she works at her business from 8am to 5pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more maize  for resale to expand her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Leah is married, and has three children: ages 14, 9 and 7. She also cares for one additional dependant.

loans.use: To buy more maize for resale.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en: Mr. Huon S. lives in the Krang Roung Village in the Takeo Province. He is an ice cream vendor in the local district. His wife, Mrs. Cheat Rith, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. On her plantation, she does not have enough money to cultivate rice during the dry season; nor does she have the sufficient materials needed such as fertilizer, pesticides, and hired laborers to work in the field. In order to deal these problems, Mr. Huon S. decided to ask for a loan for his wife’s purpose. He is 29 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. His wife is shown with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and to hire laborers to work in the field

loans.name: Ratt

texts.en: Mrs. Ratt K. is a villager in Khlaung Tvea village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder. She wants to expand her poultry business to earn more income. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to request a loan to buy more ducks for her poultry business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Khut Run, is a farmer who owns a piece of land used to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a palm juice collector. Mrs. Ratt K. is a 50-year-old mother of four children; two of them work in a garment factory and the others attend the local school. Her husband appears in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina has owned a small shop of mattress and sofa chairs in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for seven years. She belongs to Haturudi nyuma group loan (Group code 2060). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $165. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her shop. She is hopping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Amina is 34 years old, married, and has five children aged 13, 11, 6, 3 and 2-months.

loans.use: To buy more items for her shop

loans.name: Biola

texts.en: Biola sells crates of drinks in retail and wholesale. Biola hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. Biola is 40 years old and married to A. who is a cobbler and they have two children. She says Thank You to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Buena

texts.en:
Buena I. is engaged in a unique type of business. She buys scrap materials, empty bottles, cans and other recyclable materials then she resells them at a higher price to gain an income. She is 46 years old, married and has 6 children. Three of her children are married and her younger three children still attend school. Together with her responsible husband, they were able to maintain their business until now. 

She is requesting a loan from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 9,000 to increase their operating capital, allowing them to buy and sell more items and bring in more profit. They even collect old newspapers, used bottles and boxes, plastic bottles, etc. Despite the hardship they are encountering in their business, Buena said that with God’s help, they can overcome the challenges of life. She hopes to set up a junkshop business and purchase a motorcycle to use as they roam villages buying junk materials to sell in higher price. She also prays that her three children may someday finish their studies through college allowing them to obtain a better job in the future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
El señor Victo Hugo vive en casa de sus padres en la Av. Jaimes Freyre de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como procurador en una consultora de abogados y el crédito que solicita es para continuar sus estudios y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2004 y pagó muy bien sus anteriores créditos, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Hugo lives in his parents’ house on the Av. Jaimes Freyre in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. He works as a paralegal in a law firm. The loan is to continue his studies in order to improve his income. He has been a client of Impro since 2004. He made his previous loan payments well, and he is qualified for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University enrollment fees to continue his studies in the legal profession

loans.name: Charito Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Charito Elizabeth C. T. tiene 39 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, en la provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 5 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Charito se dedica a la venta de cajas para calzado, negocio que ya administraba cuando formo parte de Manuela Ramos, pero elaboraba en menor. Actualmente cuenta con buenos clientes, esto debido al trato amable y productos de calidad a la cual ella siempre hace referencia. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Sus materiales lo obtiene de otros almacenes de Trujillo, recientemente ha comprado una maquina para iniciar con la elaboración de sus propios productos.
Con el crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Viva con Esperanza II, lo invirtió en la compra de cajas.  
Con el crédito de 800 soles, continuará invirtiendo en la compra de cajas y de andamios para exhibir su mercadería.
Charito tiene como sueño contar con una tienda en el cual pueda ofrecer diversos materiales para la confección de calzado.
texts.en:
Charito Elizabeth C. T., 39, lives in the El Porvenir district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She completed high school. She has five dependent children. Charito sells shoe boxes. She managed this business when she became part of Manuela Ramos, but she produced less. She currently has a good customer base due to her kind manner and quality products, which she always makes reference to. The business is in her house. She obtains the materials from other stores in Trujillo. She has recently purchased a machine to start making her own products. With the loan for 300 PEN that she received from her Community Bank, Viva con Esperanza II, she bought boxes. With the loan for 800 PEN she will continue to buy boxes, and she will buy scaffolding to display her merchandise. Charito’s dream is to have a store where she can sell a variety of materials for making footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy boxes and scaffolding for her merchandise

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena F. tiene 56 años de edad. Mario dio inicio a esta actividad con unos pocos ingresos que tenia de su trabajo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. A María le gusta que sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos con sus productos. Por lo que ella tiene que viajar a otros departamentos en busca de precios muchos más accesibles. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, cosméticos y prendas. El sueño de María es establecer el negocio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Elena F. is 56 years old. María started her business with the small funds that she had from her work. Her business is in the sale of general merchandise; she has run this business for over 7 years. María likes for her clients to be satisfied with their products. For this reason she has to travel to other departments in search of much more affordable prices. The loan that she is requesting will be used as work capital to purchase clothing, cosmetics, and other garments. María’s dream is to establish a business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase clothing, cosmetics, and other garments).

loans.name: Ada Francis

texts.es: Ada Francis C. Rodríguez tiene 36 años. Es una mujer casada y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo que todavía dependen de ella. Su actividad económica es la elaboración y venta de bloques, ladrillos y decorados. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que anteriormente el negocio era de sus padres, pero a ella siempre le gusto mucho esta actividad, y debido a eso fue que sus padres deciden ella se haga cargo de este humilde negocio. Ada enfrento un desafío muy grande porque no tenía a una persona que trabajara de una manera permanente con su  negocio. Pero esto no la detuvo para que su negocio ofreciera lo mejor. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cemento, arena entre otros productos para la elaboración de ladrillos. Ada tiene el sueño de poseer su propio camión para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Ada Francis C. Rodríguez is 36 years old, married and has 2 dependent children. She produces and sells blocks, bricks, and building sets. Her business has been in operation for 9 years. It was previously owned by her parents, but since she enjoyed working there so much, they decided that she should take over their modest business. Sra. Ada’s biggest challenge is that she does not have any full-time employees working for her. However, this hasn’t stopped her business from succeeding.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cement, sand, and other supplies needed to make bricks. Sra. Ada dreams of having her own truck so that she can transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ben K.

texts.en: Ben G. is 37 years old and married with two children. He lives in, and operates his business in, Zambezi which is a very busy business center and with a lot of construction work going on. Hence, his hardware shop is strategically placed and stands a good chance of expanding. His customers are mainly retailers and builders. Ben was introduced to KADET by a friend, and this will be his first loan. He has not borrowed from other sources before and with the loan he has applied for he hopes to restock his hardware shop. Ben hopes to expand his business and be able to supply to construction companies and grow the business to wholesale. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To restock his hardware shop so as to meet his customers' needs

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a member of The Dawn village bank. She is 39 years old and has been a widow for nineteen years. She has one son who is 23 years old, is married and has a daughter of his own. They all live together in Juana’s house.

Juana became pregnant with her son when she was 14 years old. She decided to work selling food from her house. Sadly, for years she suffered from kidney problems and had to stop working for a while. When her health improved, she decided to start selling clothes to her neighbors and this business is currently going well.

Since joining FINCA Juana feels more secure because of the loans and she has learned how to save. She needs a loan of 1,200 soles to pay for clothes and to place more orders for clothes. Her dream is to have more clients.

loans.use: To pay for clothes and to place more orders for clothes

loans.name: Ronette

texts.en: Ronette B. is from the village of P-3, Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 25 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Ronette owns and operates a specialized retail business selling a variety of viands like "litson" (whole roasted pig) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years. In 2009, Ronette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Fokaben Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Fokaben est composé de quatre  femmes mariées vivant toutes dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies. Ayant en moyenne 37 ans et 2 enfants, elles habitent dans le village Noumouwèrè  dans la préfecture de Ségou (4ème  Région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de mariage et font la production et vente de la poterie (canaris, gargoulettes, passoires et marmites) et des calebasses décorées de gravures. 
Dans le but de d’associer d’autres activités artisanales à celles qu’elles mènent, elles décidèrent d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso. Après six prêts de groupe tous remboursés sans aucune difficulté, elles  sont à leur 7ème  prêt solidaire qui sera  utilisé pour acheter,  20 colis de calebasses (chaque colis contient 20 à 30 calebasses). Les calebasses achetées sont limées et gravées de dessins avant d’être mises au marché.  
Elles se ravitaillent en calebasses dans les foires de Tonan, Cinzana et au grand marché de Ségou.  Les produits sont revendus au comptant au bord du goudron à proximité de la grande mosquée et en ambulant à travers la ville de Ségou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 26.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et prendre en charge le pétrole et les dépenses des scolaires qui sont à Ségou. 
Elles ont pour ambition l’installation d’un moulin dans le village afin qu’elles aient plus de temps pour leurs activités génératrices de revenus.

loans.use: Achat  de calebasses.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: Rosa Lidia A. D. C. D. 50 años D. edad, resiD. en Cojutepeque municipio del departamento D. Cuscatlán. Rosa vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos graduados D. la universidad que son el orgullo D. Rosa. Ella maneja su negocio D. venta D. cosméticos con 14 años D. experiencia y también trabaja en la elaboración D. ropa a la medida. Rosa necesita D. un crédito para consolidar su negocio D. costura el cual tiene mucha demanda, pero no posee tela para elaborar ropa, es para ello el destino del crédito para invertirlo en telas y otros productos cosméticos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Lidia A. D. C. lives in Cojutepeque, in the department of Cuscatlán. She is 50 years old and lives with her husband and her two children. Both children have graduated from the university, and they are Rosa’s priD. and joy.

Rosa has had a business selling cosmetics for 14 years, and she also makes custom-tailored clothing. She needs a loan to consolidate the tailoring business, which has great demand. The loan will be used to buy fabric and also some cosmetics for sale.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and cosmetics

loans.name: Heraclia

texts.en:
Heradia has been married for 20 years. She is 46 years old and has three children. 

Heradia sells groceries. Also, along with her husband, she transport passengers and cargo in her family's large truck. She began selling groceries in San Pedro market eight years ago, and she is still selling there today. Heradia began working when she was a little girl in Potosi and moved to the municipality of Buena Vista, Cochabamba when she became an adult. She travels with her husband when he transports cargo and passengers in his truck.

Heradia plans to use this loan to purchase more merchandise for her grocery business in the San Pedro D. Buena Vista market. Providing more merchandise will help Heradia to increase her earnings so that she can remodel her home and fund her childrens' studies. Her two oldest children are currently finishing high school. Heredia hopes she will be able to offer her youngest child, who is just one year old, a very comfortable future, and she hopes that he can always be able to rely on her.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery stall in market

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en: T. Byambasuren is 53 years old and lives with her daughter in the Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. She operates a garment making business with the help of her daughter in her town. Byambasuren started her business in 1990 with 50,000 tugrugs (~35 USD). Over the years she has managed her business quite successfully and built a loyal customer base that frequently buy her hand-made clothes. With nearly 20 years experience as a seamstress, Byambasuren produces quality products and is trusted by her customers. Today, her working capital exceeds 600,000 tugrugs (~420 USD).  Byambasuren is a hardworking businesswoman and has many plans for her business. She says, "I hope to expand my business in the near future." She is requesting a 400,000 tugrug (~280 USD) loan to purchase fabrics and materials to sew more clothes.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita C. is from the municipality of Jimenez. She is 61 years old, married, but has no child.

Estelita owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Estelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC and is now requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her fifth loan from PMPC.

Estelita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, thread, pins, and other materials needed for her tailoring business

loans.name: Jamyansharav

texts.en:
Jamyansharav lives with her husband and 20-year-old son in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son attends university.

Jamyansharav operates a meat retail business in town. She began her business in 2000 with working capital of 50,000 tugrugs. After nine years of operating, she has grown her business and now her working capital is 500,000 tugrugs. She hopes to continue to grow her business, improve her family’s standard of living and purchase a car in the future. 

She is requesting a 700,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase livestock so that she can grow her inventory this winter.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Zain Al Abdeen

texts.en:
Zain A. Abdeen is a 45-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his spouse and their four children. Zain A. Abdeen has been working in agriculture for over 25 years. He owns livestock. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to increase his livestock. This is the first time that Zain A. Abdeen has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

His clients are his friends and neighbors. Zain A. Abdeen got into this business after taking over his family’s business.

loans.use: To increase his livestock.

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: D. Georgette est née le 06 Janvier 1981 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a quatre ans environs que Georgette s’est installée au quartier Kpondéhou à Cotonou. C’est une célibataire sans enfant. Georgette vit seule et supporte seule ses charges. Georgette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins quotidiens, Georgette mène comme activité, la vente d’ustensiles de cuisine (plats, bols, glacières), par le système de distribution. Georgette s’approvisionne au Nigéria et parfois au Togo, deux pays limitrophes du Bénin. Georgette mène cette activité depuis cinq ans. Georgette avait obtenu quatre crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Malgré la passion que Georgette a pour son activité, elle ne dispose pas suffisamment de fonds pour mener à bien son activité et se faire plus de revenus. Pour ce fait, Georgette sollicite un cinquième crédit pour renforcer son activité afin de mieux faire face à ses différentes charges.
texts.en:
Georgette D. was born January 6, 1981 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. About four years ago Georgette settled in Cotonou’s Kpondéhou neighbourhood. She is unmarried without children. Georgette lives alone and supports her own needs. She has not attended school. To meet her daily needs, Georgette sells kitchen utensils (platters, bowls, iceboxes), through the distribution system. She gets her supplies from Nigeria and sometimes from Togo, two countries adjacent to Benin. Georgette has been practicing this activity for the past five years. Georgette had been granted four previous loans from ALIDé, all of which were fully reimbursed. Despite Georgette’s passion for her business, she lacks sufficient funds to bring it to fruition and generate more income. For this reason, Georgette is requesting a fifth loan to strengthen her business so she can better deal with her various expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils (platters, bowls, iceboxes)

loans.name: Floribel

texts.en:
Floribel B. is from the town of Garit Norte, Echague. She is 26 years old. Floribel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Floribel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling mobile phone credit loads in the local community. Floribel has been engaged in her business for over  years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Floribel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Floribel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 27000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Floribel is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Floribel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Charito's Group

texts.en:
Maria Charito A. is from the village of Brgy. Lantap, Bagabag, Neuva Vizcaya. She is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Maria Charito is 46 years old, married and she has 3 school-aged children. To make a living Maria Charito sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Maria Charito has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Maria Charito joined ASKI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Charito successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which she used to purchase additional products to sell.

Maria Charito is requesting her fourth loan from ASKI, for 12000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business.

About ASKI

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Maria Agustina

texts.es:
Maria Agustina Ramírez R. tiene 35 años, es casada, y  tiene cinco hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Maria trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, trigo y también a la cría de chanchos y  borregos.  Vende los productos en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Maria le  gusta caminar.
 
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Maria Agustina Ramírez R. is 35, married, and has five children. She lives in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province. She is a member of the Grupo Enmanuel Communal Bank. It is in an area that is located 45 minutes from the Guaranda Canton, the capital of the Bolívar province. There are 17 members in all. It is a farming and livestock community. They are indigenous people, and they all speak Quechua. Maria works in farming to increase the family economy. The crops that do the best are corn and wheat. She also raises pigs and sheep. She sells the products in the Guaranda wholesale market every six months. The principal cultural event of the area is the Carnival, which is celebrated every year in February. Also, Maria likes to walk. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for working in the field. Mostly she will buy chemical and natural fertilizers. Her goal is to have a good economic activity for her family. The challenges she faces are climate problems and illnesses that affect the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Mayra Alexandra

texts.es:
Mayra T. es socia del Banco Comunal  Sol Naciente, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo esta ciudad muy conocida por sus ríos, su belleza arquitectónica, su gastronomía y su gente que es muy cálida y amable. Nuestra socia tiene 31 años,  de estado civil casada y madre de tres hijos de 13, 12 y 7 años,  todos estudiantes de educación básica,  su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de elaboración de estucos (cielos rasos), aún  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en  casa de un familiar.

Mayra se dedica al arreglo y limpieza  de casas de  lunes a viernes en un horario extendido de  8 a.m. a 7 p.m. actividad que realiza por ya siete años,  los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de salchipapas en las canchas deportivas de su sector y lleva cinco años en esta dura labor;  como es una mujer luchadora siempre ha buscado la manera de salir adelante y ahora  se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo dentro de su banco comunal  y todos los créditos los ha invertido en  su negocio y en su hogar, con el dinero que reciba del crédito solicitado va a pagar de  una freidora y cocina industrial que compró a sus jefes para incrementar su negocio de comida rápida.

Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mayra T. is a member of the Sol Naciente (Rising Sun) Communal Bank. She lives in the suburbs of the city of Cuenca, well known for its rivers, beautiful architecture, restaurants and warm, friendly people. Our member is 31 years old, married and mother of three children ages 13, 12 and 7. All the children are basic education students and her husband works in a factory making stucco ceiling tiles. Although they don’t live in a home of their own, they live in the house of a family member. For the past seven years, Mayra has tidied and cleaned houses from Monday to Friday from 8am to 7pm. On the weekends she sells “salchipapas” (a type of fast food made of fried potatoes and sausages) at the local sports fields. She has been doing this for the past 5 years. As she is a high-spirited woman, she has always looked for ways to advance herself. She is now in her 4th cycle with the communal bank and all the loans have been used for her business and for her home. With the money she receives from the loan she is currently soliciting, she will pay for a deep fat fryer and an industrial cooking range that she bought from her bosses in order to expand her fast food business. Her goal is to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for the purchase of a deep fat fryer and an industrial cooking range.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a hardworking married man with two children who are in school.  To earn a living, for the past six years he has been conducting a business whereby he uses scrap metals to make spoons, metal boxes and cooking pans, a very profitable enterprise though the competition is stiff due to changing technology.  He was previously employed in the same kind of business before he saved enough money to start his own.  He saves part of his earnings with his group in Faulu Kenya called Genesis, which guarantees loans to its members. He is now requesting a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to add a stock of scrap metals. Henry hopes to open a manufacturing company and improve his living standards in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of scap metal to make more cooking pans, metal boxes and spoons.

loans.name: Glenda Yamilet

texts.es:
la sra. Glenda Yamilet E. E. es una mujer que se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, se esfuerza mucho para sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos. Glenda todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparase para atender a su clientela  es por eso que tiene mejor demanda en su negocio.
el prestamo lo necesita para incrementar su inventario de productos y asi tener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Sra. Glenda Yamilet E. E. is a woman who engages in the retail business. She manages a store in her home. Glenda is a single mother with four children and works hard so that they can succeed. Every day she wakes up at 4am to prepare herself before attending to her customers. Her business generates great demand.

This loan will be used to increase her inventory of products so that she can generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor, es una mujer ejemplar y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene 48 años y convive con Elías de 56 años, con quien tiene 6 hijos, viviendo solo con dos de ellos en su casa propia. Hace más de 30 años, ella y su esposo se dedica a la siembra de frutos como palta, plátanos, piña y café, por lo que disfruta mucho de la tranquilidad que le transmite su chacras, sin embargo el lograr tener bien cuidado sus plantaciones, le resulta muy pesado ya que tiene que retirar la maleza de sus cultivos. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a preparar diversos platos de comida, que vende en un espacio de su casa, de esa manera se genera otros ingresos adicionales al de la agrícola. Gracias a las utilidades que recibe, pudo adquirir sus bienes, cubrir la educación de sus hijos y solventar los gastos domésticos. Es por ello que en el futuro piensa terminar de construir su casa e instalar un restaurante, de igual manera desea plantar en mayor cantidad café y plátanos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y se siente muy agradecida por la confianza que continúan depositando en ella, esto lo motiva para continuar laborado en su grupo comunal de manera activa. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sacos de abono, además contratará operarios que lo ayuden a mantener limpios sus cultivos e incluso quiere comprar algunos materiales como bambú y clavos para arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Leonor is an exemplary woman with a lot of desire to get ahead. She is 48-years-old and lives with Elias, who is 56-years-old. Together they have six children, and live with two of them in their own home. For more than 30 years, she and her husband have grown crops such as avocadoes, plantains, pineapple, and coffee. She really enjoys the tranquility of her farmhouse, but taking care of her crops can be very burdensome, since she has to weed her fields. Together with her farming, she prepares a variety of dishes which she sells from her house, and in this way she generates additional income, along with what she earns farming. Thanks to that income, she could buy her things, cover the educational costs of her children, and pay her household costs. This is why she is thinking about finishing building her house and putting in a restaurant in the future, and she would also like to plant more coffee and plantains. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is very thankful for the trust that they continue to place in her. This motivates her to continue working actively with her group. With the loan she requests, she will buy bags of fertilizer, and also hire laborers who will help her maintain her crops, and she would also like ot buy some materials such as bamboo and nails to fix her house.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer, and hiring workers

loans.name: Salorn

texts.en: Mrs. Salorn V. is a 30-year-old married woman who lives in Lvea Sa Kandal village in Kandal province. She is a fish seller and her husband, Mr. Thorn Penh, is a cow middleman. With both businesses, they can earn a small income to support their family. Mrs. Salorn V. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to support her husband's business. This couple has four children: three are students in the local school while the youngest one is 2 years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Nelly Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora Nelly V. es nuestra socia hace 3 años y ha sido invitada a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres emprendedoras gracias a su suegra, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca capital del Azuay, reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, su gente, su gastronomía siendo nombrada como Patrimonio cultural del Ecuador en 1999.

Nelly es socia del banco comunal Fe y Alegría, tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 9, 8, 7 y 3 años de edad,  sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo se dedica al comercio de CD de audio y video, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Nelly es comerciante de calzado actividad que la realiza hace 4 años,  ha llegado a tener un local en el mercado de la Feria Libre, trabaja solo los días miércoles y el resto de la semana se dedica al cuidado de sus hijas ya que aun son muy pequeños.

 Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más calzado para así ampliar su negocio, su meta es de salir  adelante junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Nelly V. has been a member for three years and was invited by her mother-in-law to join this great group of enterprising women. She lives in the Feria Libre section of the city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay. Cuenca is well-known for its beautiful architecture, its people, its cuisine, and was named a World Heritage Site for Ecuador in 1999.

Nelly is a member of the Communal Bank “Fe y Alegría” (Faith and Joy). She is 28 years old, married, and has given birth to four children who are now 9, 8, 7, and 3 years of age. Her first two children attend school in the city. Nelly’s husband is a merchant who sells audio and video CDs. They do not have a house of their own, so they live in a rental property.

Nelly is a shoe merchant and has been in this line of work for four years. She has her own vending location at the Feria Libre Market. Nelly only works on Wednesdays and during the rest of the week, she takes care of her daughters who are still very young.

This new loan will be invested in more shoes so that she can expand her business. Her goal is to move forward together with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran belongs to a historic city of Lahore Pakistan which is famous for its food and culture. She is the mother of two children and her husband sells milk to earn an income. Sughran bibi is a housewife but she also helps her husband and takes care of her cattle. 

She is applying for a loan from Asasah for her husband because he wants to buy a buffalo to increase the production of milk. With the help of another buffalo, her husband will be able to supply more milk and able to fulfill more orders. This will ultimately increase their household income.

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new wedding dresses to sell.

loans.name: Señor De Liwirico Rural Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Señor de Liwirco - Rural esta ubicado en el departamento de Huancavelica, inicia su quinto ciclo con 9 socios.
Haydee es Presidenta del Banco Comunal, tiene 05 hijos de 9, 18, 20, 27 y 29 años de edad, de los cuales sólo el menor asiste a la escuela. Haydee, hace 06 años que se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, negocio que realiza desde su casa y el cual ha ido creciendo durante este tiempo gracias a los préstamos que ha recibido. 
Haydee, solicita un préstamo para poder adquirir mercadería para su negocio, ropa variada de la estación, de esta manera tendrá prendas de vestir para vender y así ir incrementando mas su negocio y tener mauores ganancias. La meta de Haydee es abrir una tienda en la ciudad de huancavelica.
texts.en:
The Señor de Liwirco – Rural Communal Bank is located in the Huancavelica department. They are beginning their fifth cycle with nine members. Haydee is the president of the communal bank. She has five children; 9, 18, 20, 27, and 29 years old. Only the youngest goes to school. Haydee has been selling clothing for six years. She sells from her house. Her business has been growing during this time thanks to the loans she has received. Haydee is requesting a loan to be able to get merchandise for her business. She will get varied seasonal clothing. That way she will have clothes to sell, she will be increasing her business, and she will have greater income. Haydee’s goal is to open a store in the city of Huancavelica.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Various seasonal clothes

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Álvaro N. M. es un señor de 40 años de edad quien vive con su esposa y sus dos hermanos en una pequeña comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  
	
El desarrollo agroindustrial de esta zona le dado la oportunidad de  tener nuevas fuentes de empleo a sus habitantes. Hoy Don Álvaro se dedica a la jardinería privada de unas de las empresas que operan en la zona.  El necesita un préstamo de ¢400,000 (cuatrocientos mil colones) para comprar una desbrozadora, la cual necesita para continuar con su trabajo, y hacerlo más efectivo.
Su sueño es que en unos años tenga su propia compañía de jardineros.   

Álvaro  es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Álvaro N. M. is a 40 year old man who lives with his wife and two brothers in a small community named La Trinchera de Pital, located in the province of Alajuela. Alajuela's main economic activities are ranching and agriculture-mainly pineapple, which is sold primarily on international markets. The agroindustrial development of this area has provided its residents with opportunities for new sources of income. Today, Alvaro works as a private gardener for one of the companies that work in the area. He needs a loan of ¢400,000 (400,000 colones) to purchase a trimmer, which he needs to continue with his work and to work more effectively. His dream is to have his own gardening company in a few years. Alvaro is a member of the Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Exito de la Trinchera de Pital [Communal Enterprise of the Successful Women of La Trinchera de Pital], one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and with it he hopes to continue growing personally and economically.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of a trimmer

loans.name: Horlinda

texts.es: Horlinda tiene 65 años, es una madre de familia muy cariñosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijas ya mayores. Hace más de 30 años vende gaseosas, cervezas, productos comestibles y condimentos en general, de esa manera ha logrado tener bien surtido su bodega, situado en el pequeño espacio de la parte delantera de su casa. Siendo así uno de los negocios más concurridos de su barrio, debido a la atención que tiene con sus clientes y la variedad de productos que vende, que son de mucha demanda y a un precio bien cómodo. Disfruta mucho su trabajo, por tanto espera mas  adelante ampliar su negocio, ya que le permite captar buenas utilidades que las comparte con su adorado esposo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas, ya que le gustaría contar con posteriores prestamos. Con este crédito que solicita, piensa comprar más mercaderías para abastecer su bodega.
texts.en:
Horlinda, 65, is an affectionate, hard working mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and five adult daughters. For over 30 years she has sold soft drinks, beer, food items and condiments. She has kept her store, which is located in the front of her house, well stocked. It is one of the neighborhood’s most popular stores thanks to the variety of goods she stocks and the customer service she provides; her goods are in high demand and her prices are fair. She enjoys her work very much so hopes to enlarge the sore in the future because it produces good profits that she shares with her adored husband. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she commits to repaying it on time because she’d like to be able to count on future loans. She will use the requested funds to buy more merchandise to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more items to stock her store.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Nelida es casada, tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Nelida tiene un puesto en el mercado Santa Clara en donde vende juguetes, ganchos, discos, actividad que realiza con su esposo, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja mensualmente. Nelida abre su negocio a las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.
Nelida solicita un crédito de 3000 soles para la compra de discos y ganchos.
Los sueños de Nelida es educar a sus hijos y aumentar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Nelida is a member of the Sonrisa communal bank. She is married and has 2 children who are students. She has a stand in the Santa Clara market where she sells toys, hangers, and disks with her husband. She gets her products in the city of Lima, where she travels once a month. Nelida opens her business at 7am and closes at 9pm.

She is requesting a loan of 3000 PEN to purchase disks and hangers. Nelida’s dreams are to educate her children and to increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase disks and hangers

loans.name: Archangel

texts.en:
Archangel is a 50-year-old man, married to a wife who is a farmer with whom he has six children, living in a semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Just like his wife, Archangel is a farmer and has been farming for the last 10 years. Having been a subsistence farmer at the start, Archangel is now a commercial farmer but adds that farming is unpredictable due to weather changes which sometimes are not expected. 

His desire is to have all his children well educated but for now, he doesn’t have enough money for school fees thus needs a loan. Archangel intends to use the loan funds to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: Paying school fees for the children

loans.name: Dariyakan's Group

texts.en:
Dariyakan T. is the leader of the group. She is a 59 year old widow. She has a grown up son, who is 32. 15 years ago the family had landed property of 1 hectare square. Since then, the main source of family incoming has been gardening. In this way the mother and son make 60000 soms per year. Dariyakan hopes to get a loan in order to obtain hens and turkey cocks for breeding. The members of the family are dreaming about opening a reserve.

Chynarkan T., 58, is married. She is the group’s treasurer. She has 8 children. Chynarkan is engaged in a trade business. She raises 5000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase goods for sale and to make repairs in a billiard room.

Buajar Z., 58, is married. Her son is a student. The family makes their income by cattle breeding. The loan purpose is to purchase 3 farm animals. 

Kasiet E., 74, is a widow. She has 2 children. Kasiet in the course of her conscious life has been breeding cattle. Her loan purpose is to purchase 2 calves. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To obtain hens and turkeys.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob K. is a 21-year-old man married to Lydia Cheruiyot who does horticulture farming with him. They have one children a year old, so Jacob supports a family of two. Jacob does horticultural farming in Kapterik near Tambach trading centre in Keiyo district.

He has been in this business for the last two years and he gets an average profit of Kshs 15,000 per month. He has taken out a loan of kshs 49,750, this being his second loan, after successfuly repaying the first loan. He intends  to use the loan to purchase pipes for irrigation, fertilizers, and pay for plowing the land and pay labour.

Jacob anticipates using the profits from the business to expand it and also to pay back the loan. He hopes and dreams of providing adequately for his family and saving for future education costs.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs e.g., pipes for irrigation, buy fertilizers, pay for plowing and labour

loans.name: Chet

texts.en:
Mrs. Chet T. is 39 and is a married woman who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. This family earns an average of $6.50 per day. They have three children, and all of them are single. Two of them are studying in public school, while the other one works in the factory as a garment worker, and has a proper salary every month. Mrs. Chet T. is a local farmer, and her husband assists her in the farming business also. Mrs. Chet T. grows different kinds of crops such as rice and cucumbers on her farmland, and they are growing well.

Mrs. Chet T. thinks that it is a good time for making additional income to support her family's expenses. So she would like to request a loan to purchase more cucumbers for planting, and to pay the plowing fee.

loans.use: To purchase more cucumbers for planting, and to pay plowing fee.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet B. is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her relatives). Annet lives in the Kawala neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Annet sells secondhand shoes. She has been in this business for two years, and she works six days out of every week. Annet sells her products door to door at retail prices. She also sells used clothes. The main business challenge for Annet is the rainy season.

Annet has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of shoes. Her goals for her business are to get a permanent business spot and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand shoes

loans.name: Margaret Njeri

texts.en:
Margaret is 42 years old. She is married to Harrison Thuo, who contributes to the family's income.They have three dependent children. Margaret has been knitting pullovers for about two years now and gets a monthly income of about Kshs.11,000.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD which she intends to use to buy more buttons and thread for knitting. She hopes to have more knitting stalls, give her children a quality education, and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy more buttons and knitting thread

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es: Rigoberto Dionisio pertenece  a la alcancía comunal  Sarita Colonia compuesta  por siete integrantes que se dedican a  diversos comercios  pero teniendo en común el deseo de superación y de salir adelante por el bienestar de sus familias. Rigoberto Dionisio  de 51 años de edad casado y con tres hijos de los cuales  dos son independientes y  uno aun esta a su cuidado. El se dedica al negocio de cabina de internet hace más de cinco años, El cual inicio con alquiler de juegos de video,  con el negocio de cabinas de internet a logrado mejorar su casa y dar mayores comodidades a su hogar así también  cubrir gastos como alimentación y estudios para sus hijos. En el futro le gustaría expandir su negocio a otros lugares para así poder generar mayores ingresos. Con el presente préstamo  piensa comprar herramientas para su negocio como son teclados y monitores. Un grupo con el solo objetivo de mejorar sus condiciones económicas es lo que caracteriza a esta alcancía comunal Sarita Colonia.
texts.en:
Rigoberto Dionisio belongs to the 'Sarita Colonia' community bank which has seven members who work in a different businesses but who share the common goal of improving themselves and getting ahead for the well-being of their families.

Rigoberto Dionisio is 51 years old, married and has three children.  Two of his children live independently and one is still in his care.  Rigoberto has been in the business of providing Internet access through his Internet terminals for more than five years.  He started his business renting out video games.  His business has enabled him to improve his home and provide it with more conveniences.  He is also able to cover food expenses and pay for his children's studies.  In the future, he would like to expand his business to other places so that he can make more profits.  He will use his current loan to buy tools for his business such as keyboards and monitors.

The sole aim of this group is to improve their financial conditions.  It is what characterizes the 'Sarita Colonia' community bank.

loans.use: To buy keyboards and monitors

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy car parts

loans.name: Olmoskan's Group

texts.en:
Olmoskan S. is the leader of this group. She is 41, married, and has five children, all of whom attend school. In order to earn money, Olmoskan and her husband breed cattle. They earn money by selling cattle after fattening at a higher price. With money received from the loan, she wants to increase the number of cattle they own. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 49 años de edad, tiene cinco hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú.  Marcelina se dedica a la venta de ropa, la socia Marcelina nos cuenta que viaja a la ciudad de Anta los días domingos para vender ropa. Ya son 10 años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien,  ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar  mercadería como por ejemplo chompas, pantalones, camisas y otras cosas más.
     
Marcelina pertenece al banco comunal “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 49 years old, has five children and lives in Cusco, Peru.  Every Sunday she travels to the city of Anta where she sells clothing.  She's been in this business for 10 years and it is going very well for her.  She plans to use the loan to buy items such as sweaters, trousers, shirts and other clothing articles.

Marcelina is a member of the "Unión, Fuerza y Amistad" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association.  She is very grateful for the opportunity she is being given and is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, trousers, shirts and other clothing items

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is 36 years old and married with five children. They live in Hioma, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children.

He has a motorcycle transport business and has been operating it for one year. He started it from his savings and hopes to get another motorcycle in the future.

Deo wants the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan M. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, one of whom is in school. Susan has had a restaurant business for 10 years, and she works 7 days every week. She sells her products in a retail shop. Susan has requested a loan of 900000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, beef and chicken. She also generates additional income selling Airtime cards.

The main business challenge(s) for Susan include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to own 1000 laying birds and also to build her own house. Susan lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more food staffs like bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, beef and chicken for her restaurant

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 30 years old.  She has 4 children who are between 4 and 10 years old.  Her husband is a business man.  Claudine sells sorghum and beans and has been in this business for two years.  Her business has enabled her to feed her family and pay her children's school fees.  Claudine is requesting a loan to buy beans and sorghum in order to make more profits.  With the profits she hopes to make, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more sorghum and beans to resell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian I. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old and married, with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Vivian runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, shampoo, soap and instant noodles in the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for more than 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Vivian joined HSPFI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, to be used to purchase additional snack foods and instant noodles. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional snack foods and instant noodles

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is a divorced woman with nine children, one of whom still attends school; the others have graduated. She lives in a house that they own, which has no electricity or running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, Mealii has operated a vegetable-selling business.  She sells from a stall at her home to her neighbors and passersby. Mealii faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season, most people have enough food from their own farms, and the demand for her products is lower. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan she is requesting, Mealii intends to purchase bundles of dry fish, sacks of vegetables, and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of dry fish, sacks of vegetables, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah N., who lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda, is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school. Deborah has operated a pub business for over 10 years; working six days a week, she sells her products in a retail shop. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.
