Deborah is requesting a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerry cans of local gin.

The main business challenges for Deborah include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build her own business premises and also to own a fully stocked bar. Deborah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerry cans of local gin.

loans.name: Sabatoe

texts.en: Sabatoe is 33 years old and lives in West Point. He is married and is a high school dropout. His wife is a businesswoman. For the past nine years, Sabatoe has been selling ladies' and gents' clothes, shoes and bags. During the rainy season his sales are very low. He is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes and bags for his business. He plans to send his children to quality schools in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and bags for his business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Fortaleza, tiene 67 años y solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio que es la venta D. flores. Ella está casada y tiene siete hijos que ya son mayores D. edad. El primer crédito que recibió lo utilizó para invertir en su negocio D. venta D. flores que ya lleva 28 años. El crédito que está recibiendo ahora lo utilizará para aumentar la mercadería D. su tienda D. abarrotes que solo lleva 3 meses, la cual implementó junto con la venta D. flores para poder tener mayores ingresos, es por ello que actualmente no solo venD. flores sino que tambien venD. otros productos. Lo que más le gusta a Isabel D. FINCA Perú es el apoyo y la ayuda que recibe D. sus amigas en el banco y D. FINCA Perú mismo. D. las capacitaciones que ofrece FINCA Perú ella ha aprendido como tratar a la familia y convivir sanamente con sus hijos. Sus sueños son sacar profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Communal Bank “Fortaleza” (Strength).  She is 67 years old and requesting a loan to invest in her business of selling flowers.  Isabel is married and has seven adult children.  The first loan she received was invested in her flower business, which has been in operation for 28 years.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase the inventory of her grocery store which she just opened three months ago. She opened the grocery store to be able to have more income, and it is for this reason that she sells not only flowers but other products as well.  What Isabel enjoys most about FINCA Peru is the support she receives from her friends in her Communal Bank and the FINCA Peru staff.  The training classes offered through FINCA Peru have helped her learn how to deal with her family and live peacefully with her children.  

Her dreams incluD. seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is standing close to the oven she uses to smoke fish. She is a widow taking care of 10 children. She wants to increase the quantity of smoked fish sold so she can take care of her children. The loan when received will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale.  Ekua plans to reinvest the new profits back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: buy fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with two children, one who graduated from school and one who still attends. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a vegetable-stall business, selling at the market to neighbors and passersby. Major challenges she faces include seasonality and the high cost of transporting vegetables from rural areas to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a grocery business in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Janyl's Group

texts.en:
Janyl, 63, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a nice village in the Isykul region. Together with her husband she has raised five children, all of whom are married and employed. 

Eleven years ago, with an initial investment of 8,000 soms, Janyl started to breed livestock. She resells livestock at a higher price after fattening them. In this way she earns about 10,000 soms (~$226) per month. This profit makes it possible to improve the family’s living conditions. 

Janyl applied for the loan because she needs money to increase the number of livestock. The purpose of the loan is to purchase three livestock animals. In the future Janyl wants to expand her business, and with the profits gained she wishes to build a new big house for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pedro pablo   vive en la ciudad de Managua.
El señor Pedro    visito nuestra oficina para solicitar un crédito ya que piensa hacerles  mejoras a su vivienda.
La inversión que el  señor  va hacer es la compra  de  materiales de construcción como cemento, piedra, arena, hierro, las mejoras que el señor va hacer es el construcción de una cocina.
 agradece mucho a ceprodel por que gracias al financiamiento va poder  mejorar su vivienda y así también sus condiciones de vida para ella y su familia
texts.en: Mr. Pedro Pablo lives in the city of Managua. He visited CEPRODEL's office to request a loan because he would like to make improvements to his home. He will invest in the purchase of construction materials like cement, stone, sand, and iron. The improvement he would like to make is to build a kitchen. He is very grateful to CEPRODEL because thanks to this loan, he will be able to improve his home and therefore also improve his and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to improve his home by building a kitchen

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 58-year-old married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 34 years old and the youngest is 25.

Ana and her husband are both farmers. They till a land in Surallah, South Cotabato. Rice is the main crop that they grow and sell. Ana works hard to improve their business and support her family. She applied for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Ana hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en:
Beathe, a 30-year-old married woman, operates a well-organized and well-known business selling sheets. Working five days a week from from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m., she has three years of experience.

Beathe has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more sheets to increase her sales volume. She will reinvest any additional profits in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sheets for sale.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
With her desire to improve her family's living conditions, Jovita patiently endures hardship in managing her piggery business as a source of income. According to her, this kind of work isn’t easy.  It requires hard work and endurance to provide nourishment to her pigs so that she will boost her previous profit. She is 55 years old and has been eight years operating her business. She earns about P5,000 every month, and is frequently behind in her daily expenses.

She wants to earn a higher income to sustain the education of her youngest child. Jovita is now asking for a loan of P3,000 to buy feed and vitamins needed by her pigs. With the help of this loan, she hopes to improve her business as well as her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins needed by her pigs

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is married and has five children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past three years, she has made a living by selling food to neighbors and passersby. Her biggest challenge is competition from other retail operators, but she dreams of expanding her business into a wholesale operation in the future. To make this possible, she is applying for a loan for Kshs 10,000 to buy bundles of maize flour, sugar and beans to sell to her customers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans that will allow her to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of maize flour, sugar and beans to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is an active and hard-working man of 35 years. He is married and the father two children. Zaur always tries to improve his living conditions and that’s why he engages in the wholesale of different food products such as flour, nuts, rice and macaroni. He has been in this business for 4 years and he has a good business experience.  

Zaur would like a loan of 1,500 AZN for purchasing more merchandise in order to expand his business and improve his living conditions. Zaur has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to increase profit.

loans.name: Sokros

texts.en: Sokros is 28 years old and has an embellishing shop where she earns $3 per day. Her husband is a worker earning $3 per day. They have two children: two years old and two months old. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $10 electricity, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work. She wants to expand her embellishing shop and provide more services but she needs a long time to save the money to achieve her plan.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 51, a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ponciano, a security guard, and the mother of their five children, two of whom are working while the others are still studying in grade school. 

Lolita is working hard to put her children through college because, like many Filipino parents, she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can give their children.

Lolita makes a living by selling ornamental plants. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and a variety of hanging plants and others. She’s been 11 years in this business. Aside from this she also earns from the rentals of rooms in her place. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the community. And she earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of PHP 14,000. She will be using the money to buy things needed for planting such as fertilizer, pots, seedlings. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Lolita hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Kuña Kyrey ya que las mismas son mujeres muy activas (que en guaraní quiere decir kyrey). Ellas se han unido y han asumido el compromiso D.  mantener unido al grupo y trabajar bajo siempre respetándose las unas con las otras. Actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por  17 personas quienes invierten sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades. 
La señora Justina se dedica a la venta D. gallinas y D. los huevos que estas ponen. Dice que este es un trabajo muy lindo pero muy sacrificado, ya que debe D. estar muy pendiente D. los animales que tiene, ya que quiere ofrecer a sus clientes buenos animales. Comenta que gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar con los gastos D. la casa y D. ella misma. Quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ya que le va muy bien, y es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra D. gallinas ponedoras y también para la compra D. alimento para las mismas.
Ella, al igual que las integrantes del comité está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que reciben D. la fundación y D. Kiva.
texts.en:
This group is called Kuña Kyrey since they all all active women and in the Guarani language kyrey means to be active. They have been close-knit and have maD. the commitment to keep the group together and to always work with respect for one another. They are in the 4th cycle with excellent rating, and they have 17 members who use their loans in their respective work.

Justina works selling chickens and eggs that they lay. She says that this is very agreeable work but she makes self sacrifices. She must be very watchful over her animals, so that she can offer her customers good animals. She says that thanks to this work she has been able to succeed and help with the household expenses, and with her own.

She wants to continue investing in her business since it is going very well, and that is why she is asking for a loan in order to buy laying hens and to buy food for them. 

She, along with the members of the group, are very grateful for the opportunity they receive from the communal bank through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy laying hens to breed and later sale

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Raising hogs keeps Marta busy with a schedule of cleaning and feeding the hogs three times a day. She decided to establish her business to generate income instead of just lazing at home and doing household chores. She is 46 years old and married with three children who attend school and need daily allowances. 

She would like to buy vitamins, vaccines, and feed for the sustenance and proper growth of her hogs, but she has insufficient funds. Marta is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000. She wants to diversify her business in the future and hopes this loan will be granted as it is her only chance to improve her business and her family's lives as well.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines, and feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Alicia Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Alicia, tiene 35 años  de edad, es madre soltera de una hija de 11 años que estudian en escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres y estudia en una Universidad a distancia para licenciada en ciencias de la educación. 

Ella trabaja en una escuela de la localidad como maestra, además en la misma escuela en sociedad con su papá son los encargados del bar de la escuela en el cual venden bocadillos, jugos naturales y varios productos saludables para los niños que llegan a este centro de estudios.  También en su casa se dedica a la venta de tarjetas y recargas telefónicas. Lleva 5 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 8 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y los créditos son de gran ayuda.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Vicente meets every 15 days in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a place that is known for its commercial activity, its traditional patron saint San Pedro and San Pablo festivities, and the happiness of its people.

Here we meet Alicia, 35, who is a single mother of an 11 year-old daughter who is in school.  She lives in her parent's house and is completing a degree in Education via distance learning.

She works in a local school as a teacher.  In addition, she and her father are in charge of a snack bar at the same school where they sell snacks, natural juices and a variety of healthy products for the children who come to the school.  She also has a business selling calling cards and cellular phone recharges from her house.  She has had this business for 5 years and it is going very well.

She will use this loan to buy groceries to make her food.  She has been with her communal bank for 8 years, and she likes it because her group is very close knit and the loans have been very helpful to her.

She dreams of finishing her education and becoming an accomplished professional.

loans.use: to buy food for her business

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe BADEYA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41  ans, et  en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à MAMASSONI un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
KADIATOU, debout au milieu, fait le commerce de pommes de terre, il y’a environ  10 ans  et jouis d’une grande renommée à la matière.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  cinq sacs de 50kg de pommes de terre. Elle s’approvisionne chez les producteurs dans les voisinages de Sikasso ville.
Elle les revend en détail au marché et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: The five members of the BADEYA group are mainly married women with an average age of 41 and an average of three children. For the most part, they live in polygamist families in Mamassoni, a suburb of Sikasso. They are on their tenth loan with the Microfinance Instituion Soro Yiriwaso so that they can meet the needs of their clients. Kadiatou, pictured in the center, sells potatoes, she has been doing this for about 10 years and has a good reputation. With her loan, she plans to buy five sacks of 50kg potatoes. She buys from producers in the Sikasso neighborhoods. She resells them at a retail market and to family; her clientele is made up of both men and women. She plans to make a monthly profit averaging 23,500 FCFA part of which will pay for the loan and its interest and the other part for savings. She plans to increase her business to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her eldest son’s mobile phone business. With the loan investment, he will purchase different models of mobile phones and accessories to improve his business. He has been operating his business for some time now, and Khalida is hopeful that an investment will help him to become better established.

Khalida is the mother of 3 sons and 2 daughters. Her other children stay at home and do not work. In order to financially support her family, Khalida sews clothes for local clients. Because she is very good at her work and believes in providing quality work to her clients, she receives regular orders every month.

She is very confident that, after investing the loan, her family will have a better standard of living and she will be able to provide a dowry for her elder daughter, who is nearing marriageable age.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Khalida.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 37-years-old, married to John and they have two children. She has been into the wood carving business selling carved wood artifacts to her customers for the last 2 years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 20,000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 15,000. She will use the funds to buy more stocks of wood to carve and sell. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With anticipated profits she will open another word-carving stall

She hopes to open a distribution store for external markets and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more wood to carve and sell to clients.

loans.name: Cloche Plus Group

texts.en:
Angel is the chairwoman of the community bank named “Cloche Plus,” which means "bell" in English. It is composed of 10 micro entrepreneurs. These members are united for the same goal--to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Angel is 30 years old. Her activity is selling timber. She buys timber in bulk and resells it in detail at a profit. She sells her products daily in her area.

Angel started her business in 2004. She is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having nine times obtained and correctly repaid loans. Her next loan will allow her to increase her stock by buying timber in larger quantities and increase her sales to make a better profit. Angel makes a profit of about US $50 per week. She is married and the mother of three children whose ages range between 6 months and 9 years old. One of them goes to school. She is also responsible for her niece.

loans.use: to increase her stock by buying timber in large quantities and reselling it at profit

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: El Sr. Leonor en la actualidad vive y trabaja en la comunidad de Cumandayti del Municipio Villa Vaca Guzmán del departamento de Chuquisaca, quien en la actualidad se dedica a la actividad Agropecuaria que es el único ingreso con el que cuenta por el momento, tiene un hijo que depende de la unidad Familiar y requiere de un apoyo económico para poder iniciar la actividad de producción de miel ya que cuenta con el conocimiento necesario para iniciar esta actividad por la capacitación que recibió de ONG´s. como la Fundación Nor Sud y Ayuda en Accion Bolivia, actualmente vive en su domicilio junto con su esposa e hijo; el préstamo sera para implementar su producción apícola para producir miel, mencionar que dicha persona se dedicó desde jóven a la actividad Agropecuaria y es el único medio que tiene para su sustento diario y otros gastos Familiares y con esta nueva actividad podrá obtener a futuro un mejor ingreso económico y de esta manera vivir en mejores condiciones de vida junto a su Familia.

loans.use: Implementar producción de miel de abeja para su venta y de esta manera generar mejores ingresos para su hijo

loans.name: Adjo

texts.en:
Born in Tsévié in 1970, Adjo B. sells cooked rice. She quit school because of work opportunities as a porter in the city of Lomé. After her first child was born, she went from house to house to wash clothes for people. Later, she returned to her hometown. She married a shoemaker, had two children, and now they have three in all. Looking back on her life, she is attempting to go in another direction. As a very energetic woman, she runs her business in all modesty.

Ms. B. is requesting a loan of $650, so that she can sell charcoal, in addition to her sales of mush. She will stock up on wood from surrounding villages. This loan would allow her to bolster her income in order to provide more for her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1970 à Tsévié, Madame B. Adjo vend du riz préparé. Elle a abandonné les études au profit du travail de portefait à Lomé. Après la naissance de son premier enfant, elle fait la lessive de maison en maison avant de revenir à Tsévié. Mariée à un cordonnier, elle a eu deux (02) enfants, ce qui porte ses enfants à trois. Prenant conscience de son passé elle essaie de redonner un autre sens à sa vie. Très dynamique, elle gère avec modestie ses affaires.

Madame B. Adjo sollicite un crédit de $650 va lui permettre d’associer à la vente de bouillie, la vente de charbon qu’elle s’approvisionnera de bois villages environnants. Ceci va lui permettre de renforcer son revenu dans le but de subvenir plus aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Sale of mush, charcoal.

loans.name: Audencio

texts.en:
Audencio is a rice farmer from the Santa Lucia province. He has been farming rice and raising cattle for about 50 years since he was young. He and his wife Germania have been living on this farm since they were married. They have raised their two kids and fed their family thanks to the fertility of their lands. Their children are all grown up now, but Audencio continues to cultivate rice in order to feed himself and provide additional support to his sons.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

This borrower is part of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. Their association works cooperatively to help in the commercialization of the product after it has grown. They will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical micro-entrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Cultivate Rice on his farm

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is 38 years old and has two young daughters. Originally from Veracruz, she moved with her husband to the town of Cadereyta, in the state of Nuevo León, 21 years ago in search of better opportunities. As soon as they arrived there, Guadalupe began selling various foods and tacos in order to help with the household expenses. Her business is located in front of some factories. Most of her customers work in the factories and she has a steady demand for her products.

One of Guadalupe’s dreams is to open a small restaurant, for which she is saving money. She would like to improve her business and is requesting a loan of $550.00, which will be used to buy items necessary to the production of the foods she makes, such as frying pans, utensils, ingredients, etc. You can help improve this family’s life. Guadalupe needs your help and is sincerely grateful for your generosity and trust.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Guadalupe tiene 38 años de edad y dos pequeñas hijas, es originaria de Veracruz, se mudó junto con su esposo en busca de mejores oportunidades a la localidad de Cadereyta en el estado de Nuevo León hace 21 años, desde que llegaron Guadalupe empezó vendiendo comidas y tacos para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar, ahora ubicó su negocio frente a unas fábricas, de donde son la mayor parte de sus clientes y tiene una demanda segura por sus productos.

Uno de los sueños de Guadalupe es poder abrir un pequeño restaurante, para lo que esta ahorrando, ahora desea mejorar su negocio y solicita un préstamo de $550 dólares que destinará la compra de artículos necesarios en la elaboración de sus comidas, como sartenes, utensilios, insumos, etc. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, Guadalupe necesita de tu ayuda y agradece sinceramente tu generosidad y confianza.

loans.use: To buy kitchen equipment and supplies

loans.name: Elena Martina

texts.en:
Elena Martina C. is just 17 years old, but has been weaving beautiful huipiles, the traditional Mayan blouse, since she was a child. She can turn out one of these works of art in about fifteen days of weaving, and then can sell it for almost US$200, realizing a profit of about US$130 for her work after purchasing the yarn. She sells to her neighbors who check on her work and may place an order when they see something they like.

Elena Martina is still single and her goal right now is to finish high school with a secretarial specialization. Later on she'd like to open a store to sell woven goods in the town center. She'll invest this credit, as always, in yarn for weaving.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving huipiles

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth R. Vargas is part of the association Inti de Villa Tejada, in the city of El Alto, where she carries out functions as head of the group.

Ruth works together with her husband in the creation of shampoo, a product that is the result of a small company the two of them have set up. SEL-DE is the name of their product, the name comes from the first few letters of the names of their children, Selena and Denisse Their main market is in the fairs of different cities, such as Oruro, Potasi, Uyuni and Desaguadero.

They buy the main material for their product from wholesalers who are in charge of the direct importation, making the production is less expensive. Ruth and her husband will use the capital to buy plastic bottles wholesale, looking towards the end of the year, the season when sales increase, but so do the prices to buy the material. Only in this way can they generate the resources necessary to satisfy the needs of their 4 children. Between them, the two little girls were the inspiration for the business.

Ruth R. Vargas, pertenece a la Asociación Inti de Villa Tejada en la ciudad de El Alto, donde cumple funciones de Jefa de Grupo. Ruth trabaja conjuntamente con su marido en la elaboración de Shampoo, producto que es el resultado de la pequeña empresa que han instalado entre los dos. SEL-DE es el nombre de su producto, el nombre proviene de las primeras letras de los nombres de sus dos hijas, Selena y Denisse. Su principal mercado se encuentra en las ferias de distintas ciudades, como ser la ciudad de Oruro, Potosí, Uyuni, Desaguadero. La materia prima para su producto la compran de mayoristas que se encargan de la importación directa, de esta forma les resulta más barata la producción. Ruth y su marido precisan de capital para poder comprar envases de plástico al por mayor, en vista de la proximidad del fin de año, época en la que se incrementan las ventas, pero tambien incrementan los precios de la materia prima. Solo de esta manera podrán generar los recursos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de sus 4 hijos, entre ellos, las dos nenas que fueron la inspiración de su empresa.

loans.use: To purchase plastic bottles wholesale before prices go up at the end of the year.

loans.name: Eki

texts.en: Mrs. Eki O. is 45 years old and is married with 4 children.  She lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she operates a salon and sells clothes to people.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  She is requesting a loan of $400 to enable her to buy more weavon, hair cream and clothes to sell.  She is currently a LAPO member and is also the secretary of her union.  She promises to repay her loan in 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more weavon, hair cream and clothe for sale

loans.name: Sulochana

texts.en:
Mrs. Sulochana S., 34, lives in Tinkuna. Tinkuna is located in the Lalitpur district of Nepal. Tinkuna is very busy city of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in business. Mrs. S. lives together with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Tika Prasad S., is a broker who sells land. Her sons are studying in grades 10 and 3 respectively.

Mrs. S. opened her cosmetics shop 3 years ago. She wants to add other personal care products to her shop because the demand is constantly increasing. Due to their economic conditions, however, she cannot invest more capital in her business. So she is asking for her first loan of US$ 175 to buy more cosmetics for her shop. Mrs. S. spends her income providing good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy personal care products for her shop

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara owns a cassava mill. She is 50 years old and is married with 6 children. She is a member of LAPO and a native of Bini. She needs the loan amount of $375 to buy an additional grinding machine. This, she said, will help her serve her customers better. She has 11 years experience in this business. She thanks you!

loans.use: To buy a cassava mill machine

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo S. sells vegetables. He started his business as a street vendor, but now his business is situated in his home in the city of Leon, specifically in the El Sauce village.

He is father to three children and his obligation is to provide them with an education they deserve. For this reason Gerardo sacrifices to sell his products and thus continue maintaining his modest family who depend greatly on him. It is necessary to emphasize that despite his modest living, which he has survived for some time now, he has been able to offer his children an education, nourishment, and a proud life.

At the moment, his home is in poor condition. The roof is bare, and he needs to invest in infrastructure desperately. For this reason CEPRODEL has disbursed immediate loans so that he may invest in his business. According to him, the loans have been incredibly helpful in improving his economic situation and in acquiring greater quantities of vegetables for sale. He has procured 5 loans from CEPRODEL, and at the moment he is urgently seeking to purchase vegetables and to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Gerardo S. se dedica a la actividad de venta de verduras el cual en un inicio ofertaba sus productos ambulantemente pero ahora se ubica en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de León específicamente en el pueblo El Sauce.

Es padre de tres niñas y su obligación es brindarle la educación que ellas se merecen. Por esta razón es que Gerardo se esfuerza para vender estos productos perecederos y así continuar manteniendo su humilde familia que tanto necesita de el. Es necesario destacar que a pesar de la pobreza que este caballero ha tenido desde mucho tiempo atrás ha logrado mantener a sus hijas brindándoles educación, alimentación y un techo digno.

Actualmente su local no posee buenas condiciones, el techo se encuentra descubierto y por tanto necesita invertir en infraestructura. Es por tal razon que CEPRODEL le ha otorgado créditos inmediatos para invertir en el negocio y según comenta, estos créditos le han servido de mucho bien por el hecho de que ha mejorado su condición económica y ha adquirido mayores cantidades de verduras para comercializarlas. Su record crediticio actualmente es de 5 créditos con Ceprodel y su necesidad es la urgencia de compra de las verduras y de igual forma la mejora de su localidad.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
The client, who has asked that his name not be released, is a 41-year-old man who lives in southern Lebanon. He is married and has three children. He is in the printing business.

This is the first time that the client has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy paper and ink to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy paper and ink for his printing business.

loans.name: Bienaventuradas Ii Group

texts.es:
The women that belong to the Bienaventuradas group have two characteristics that make one believe that they will do well with the loan that you’re going to give them: assuredness and confidence in themselves and in their respective businesses which they stress to be so important.

The disbursal took place in the garage of an old house. An old pickup truck, on which the children were swinging, was parked inside. The women were seated on typical plastic benches that they had just brought from the church. All of the women are faithful followers of the churches within Santo Tomás la Unión.

In this group the majority of the women invest their loans in breeding animals and in the resale of both typical and American clothing. You can also find some that invest the money in cases of thread to make beautiful, embroidered blouses that are typical in the region. Others have convenience stores where they sell the products in high demand by the townspeople. With their loan they buy beans, rice and soap along with various other products.

The women think that working under the communal bank’s methodology is very positive because, even though they live in the same community, they don’t know each other that well. Because of Friendship Bridge, they know many more women that live close by, but not only do they know them, they work together and cooperate with each other. This creates an interpersonal bond that’s very strong among the group members. They also believe that due to the training and interaction, many women lose their shyness when speaking in public and their self esteem is raised. By believing in these women, through Kiva, you are aiding in their development. Keep doing it!

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Las mujeres que pertenecen al grupo Bienaventuradas 2 tienen características que a uno lo hacen confiar que a ellas les va a ir bien con el préstamo que se les va a otorgar. La seguridad y confianza en ellas mismas y sus respectivos negocios que ellas irradian es importante.

El desembolso se llevo acabo en el garaje de una casa antigua. Un pick-up viejo, en el cual los niños se estaban columpiando, estaba estacionado dentro de él. Las mujeres estaban sentadas en los típicos banquitos de plástico que los acababan de traer de la iglesia. Todas ellas son fieles seguidoras de las iglesias dentro de Santo Tomás la Unión.

En este grupo la mayoría de mujeres invierten su préstamo en la crianza de animales y reventa de ropa típica y americana. También se puede encontrar clientas que inviertan su préstamo en la compra de cajas de hilo para elaborar bellos bordados en las blusas típicas. Otras tienen tiendas de conveniencia donde ellas venden los productos que son altamente demandados por las personas de la aldea. Con su préstamo ellas comprar fréjoles, arroz, jabón, entre otros varios productos.

Las clientas piensan que trabajar bajo la metodología de bancos comunales es muy positivo ya que las mujeres, a pesar de que viven dentro de la misma comunidad, no se conocen bien. Consecuentemente, a través de Friendship Bridge ellas conocen a muchas más mujeres que viven cerca de ellas, y no solo las conocen sino es que trabajan y cooperan seguido. Esto crea un lazo interpersonal muy fuerte entre las integrantes del grupo. Además ellas creen que por medio de las capacitaciones y la convivencia muchas mujeres pierden la timidez de hablar en público y su auto estima incrementa. Al apostar por estas mujeres, por medio de Kiva, tú estas ayudando al desarrollo de estas mujeres. Siguelo haciendo!

loans.use: Sale of both typical and imported clothing; animal breeding

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Maria Jesus belongs to the San Miguel of Ayacucho Communal Bank. She is from the community that has the same name. It is in a small valley where the majority of the settlers are dedicated to the cultivation of vegetables.

Maria is married, 41 years old and has 7 children. Maria is dedicated to the cultivation of vegetables and to raising cattle, which are sold in the markets of the city of Ayacucho.

Maria Jesus needs a loan of 1500 soles; money that will be invested in the purchase of cattle and agricultural supplements.

The dreams of Maria Jesus are to improve her business and to offer a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Jesus pertenece al Banco Comunal San Miguel de Ayacucho. Ella es de la comunidad que tiene el mismo nombre, es un valle pequeño donde la mayoría de sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura de verduras.

Maria es casada, tiene 41 años y 7 hijos, Maria se dedica a la agricultura de verduras y además al engorde de ganado vacuno, los cuales son vendidos en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Maria Jesus necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno y abono.

Los sueños de Maria Jesus son mejorar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy cattle for fattening and agricultural supplements for her vegetable crop.

loans.name: Amin

texts.id:
Amin S. sells mixed rice for living. He starts the day very early in the morning to go to the local market to buy ingredients for his mixed rice. By 6 am he usually has arrives back to his house and together with his wife, Wasita, they will start to cook the rice. Around 10 am he already goes to Denpasar to sell his mixed rice. His regular customers are construction workers at construction sites located around Denpasar. College students in Denpasar also usually buys his mixed rice. He hopes to expand his business with the loan money from Dinari.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Amin S. sehari-harinya menekuni usaha jual nasi bungkus. Pagi-pagi sekali dia sudah harus pergi ke Pasar untuk membeli sayur mayur dan lauk pauk. Setibanya dirumah pukul 06.00 pagi ia dan istrinya Wasita memasak dan mempersiapkan masakan dan pukul 10 pagi dia sudah keliling Denpasar untuk menjual nasi bungkus dan biasanya pembelinya adalah buruh-buruh bangunan dan proyek serta anak-anak (mahasiswa) yang kost di Denpasar. Penghasilan yang didapat dari usahanya ini selain untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari rumah tangganya, juga disisihkan sedikit untuk modal berjualan lagi. Dia berharap melalui DINARI dia bisa memperoleh tambahan modal untuk usahanya.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Jose Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso started his business because his wife made midday meals for him and their children to take to the factory. It occurred to them to sell the meals to their co-workers. Now he delivers them all week long and collects each Friday.

He works as a watchman in a factory. His salary was small and the family numerous, so they needed to undertake their food business. His wife puts together the orders of sopes, tacos, or tamales and he sells them in factory and business offices. First he takes the orders, then delivers them and collects.

Five years ago they began selling and taking orders house to house. Now he has his own clients and many orders, including making tamales for children's parties.

He needs a loan of US$400, which he will repay in 6 months, to buy ingredients, steamers and freezers to carry the products on sale, and some kitchen utensils.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Alfonso inició el negocio porque su esposa les hacia comida a el y sus hijos para que llevaran de almuerzo, pero como sus hijos laboran en fabrica, se les ocurrio ofrecerlos entre los compañeros de trabajo para asi ayudarle a tener mejores ventas y le ha dado resultado ya que les llevan toda la semana y cobran los viernes. El trabaja como velador en una fabrica y era muy poco el sueldo y ademas la familia es numerosa tuvo la necesidad de poner su negocio de comidas donde su esposa elabora las ordenes de sopes, tacos o tamales y el las vende en las oficinas fabricas o negocios primero va las ofrece y despues entrega y cobra. Comenzó el negocio hace 5 años vendiendo y ofreciendo casa por casa hoy en dia ya tiene sus propios clientes y muchos pedidos incluso ya hacen tamales para fiestas infantiles.

El necesita un prestamo por US $ 400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar de ingredientes ademas de unas vaporeras y hieleras para llevar el producto para su venta y algunos utencilos de cocina que necesita.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and equipment

loans.name: Ruth Gladis

texts.es:
Ruth has two small children, she dedicates herself to selling clothing. She began this business with a small clientele who were companions from her husband’s work as a taxi driver. She never imagined that her business was going to grow so much. The quantity of order she now has had surpassed her expectations and this is what inspires her to continue working hard to get ahead. This business has become an important source of income for her family. She is asking for a loan to travel to Lima so she can buy a greater quantity and variety of merchandise at a low price, that she can then sell in her town, earning greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Ruth tiene dos hijos pequeños, se dedica a la venta de ropa, inició este negocio con un reducido número de clientes, que eran los compañeros de trabajo de su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, nunca imaginó que su negocio iba a crecer tanto, la cantidad de pedidos que ahora tiene, han superado sus expectativas y es lo que le anima a seguir adelante y ser perseverante. Este negocio se ha convertido en una importante fuente generadora de ingresos económicos para su familia.El motivo por el que solicita este préstamo, es para viajar a la ciudad de Lima y comprar ahí, mayor cantidad de mercadería, más variada y a bajo precio, que pueda vender luego en su localidad, obteniendo mejores ganancias.

loans.use: Travel to Lima to buy merchandise for her clothing selling business

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa A. is 50 years old, married and the mother of five children, two of whom are currently in school. For the last 12 years, she has made a living and supported her family by selling grocery products and yams. She says business is slow because she lacks enough money to buy supplies. That's why she has applied for a loan to increase her inventory. She believes the loan will help her increase her savings and provide for her last two children, who are now in school. She is a member of the group called Partners. Members agree to  support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more products like tin fish, canned tomatoes, cocoa, skimmed milk and body pomade.

loans.name: Mahman

texts.fr:
Madame Mahman Sangaré est âgée de 44 ans et vit avec ses 7 enfants et son époux dans une famille traditionnelle élargie (beau père, belles mères, beaux frères et belles sœurs...) au quartier Pelengana Sébénikoro de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après plusieurs tentatives sans succès au diplôme d’études fondamentales, elle s’essaya à beaucoup d’activités génératrices de revenus mais finit par faire le commerce d’habits pour enfants et des pagnes wax (des tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’Ouest). En plus elle fait de l’achat et de la vente des chaussures et des bijoux (bracelets, boucles d’oreilles et chaînes généralement appelés garantis au Mali).
Dans le souci de maintenir sa clientèle de plus en plus importante, elle décida de rejoindre le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elle est en relation depuis 3 ans. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel après 4 prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire avec une association de son quartier) tous remboursés sans difficultés.
Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter, 34 complets pour enfants, 10 pièces de pagne wax et 10 paires de chaussures sur place à Ségou et au grand marché de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès de commerçants grossistes. Avec une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes, elle effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et à crédit payable mensuellement au niveau des entreprises, dans les quartiers et chez elle à domicile. 
Madame Mahman Sangaré compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA.qui lui permettra d’augmenter la taille de ses affaires et épauler son conjoint pour supporter les charges de la famille élargie.  Son ambition est d’avoir un terrain à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. Mahman Sangaré is 44 years old and lives with her seven children and husband in a traditional extended family (in-laws: father, mothers, brothers, and sisters) in the Pelengana Sébénikoro district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After several unsuccessful attempts at a diploma of basic studies, she tried many income-generating activities but ended up doing commerce in children's clothing and in Wax pagnes (highly valued cloth in West Africa). In addition, she trades in shoes and jewelry (bracelets, earrings, and chains generally called guaranteed in Mali). Concerned about maintaining her large and growing customer base, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which she has had an association for three years. She is on her second individual loan following four group loans (solidarity loans with an association in her district), which were all repaid without difficulty. With this loan, she intends to buy: 34 children's outfits, 10 pieces of Wax pagnes, and 10 pairs of shoes locally in Ségou and at the grand marketplace of Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). This stock will be gotten from wholesale merchants. With a customer base essentially composed of women, she makes her sales in cash at the retail level and also on credit, payable monthly for enterprises, from district to district and out of her home. Ms. Mahman Sangaré intends to realize a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which will enable her to increase the size of her business and to cover the expenses of her extended family. Her ambition is to acquire a plot of land for building a house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's clothing, Wax pagnes, and shoes

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing lives in Badagry, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. Blessing is 30 years old and married with 3 children. Blessing has been in this business for the past 4 years. She is a LAPO client. As a young woman who is eager to expand her business, she hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. Blessing appreciates the kind gesture shown to her by Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Amelida

texts.es:
La señora Amelida, socia del BC “Las Violetas II”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia D. Rioja y distrito D. Nueva Cajamarca. Tiene 42 años D. edad, es madre D. 04 hijos, ya todos son independientes y vive con su esposo que es agricultor y motocarrista. Se dedica a la venta D. productos naturales D. la marca Natura. Sale constantemente a vender en lugares cercanos a su distrito.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos como uña D. gato, penca D. tuna, calcio, jabones y otros productos que son muy solicitados entre sus clientes, también quiere invertir en ropa para damas caballeros y niños. Quiere aprovechar que su hija vive en la capital para que le envíe desD. allá.  

Amelida es una mujer emprendedora. Está agradecida a Manuela Ramos por la confianza que le dio al brindarle un préstamo que la ayudara a crecer en su negocio. Más adelante desea surtir más su negocio, tanto D. ropa como D. productos naturales.
texts.en:
Amelida is a member of the Las Violetas II (the Violets II) Village Bank, and lives in the San Martín region, in the Nueva Cajamarca district of the Rioja province. She is 42-years-old and the mother of 4 children, all of whom are independent. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer and motorcycle-taxi driver. She earns her living by selling Natura-brand natural products, which she is constantly out selling in and around her district. With her loan of 1000 Soles, which she will pay back in 6 months, Amelida will buy products such as cat’s claw, Nopal (prickly pear cactus), calcium, soaps, and other products in high demand by her customers. She would also like to invest in clothing for women, men and children. She hopes to take advantage of the fact that her daughter lives in Lima, and receive some orders from there. Amelida is an enterprising woman. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for having confidence in her and giving her a loan, which has helped her grow her business. In the future she would like to stock her business with as much clothing as natural products.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cat's claw, nopal, calcium, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en:
Eustaquia has been a member of our microcredit program for a long time, and she’s requesting her third cycle loan in order to reinforce her small business. The entrepreneur sells sheets metal in her neighborhood in order to sustain her family of 7 people.

Eustaquia explains that metal prices have shot up over the last 6 months, and she doesn’t have enough money to stock her business. She hopes that with this loan, she’ll be able to get back on track with her activity, and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase sheet metal for a small business.

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor José Guadalupe M. es casado, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, el señor José M. tiene un negocio de reparación de lavadoras y de aires acondicionados llamado “Refrigeración M.” el cual lleva en operación 18 años y es atendido por él.
El señor José M. está solicitando un préstamo para comprar lavadoras usadas para repararlas y posteriormente venderlas, ya que este negocio es la principal fuente de ingresos del señor José M. con los cuales él mantiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. José Guadalupe M. is married, lives with his wife and 4 children. He has his own washing machine and air conditioners repair business called “Refrigeración M.", he's been in business for 18 years and he runs it himself.

Mr. José M. is requesting a loan to purchase used washing machines. He will then repair them and then re-sell them. This is his main source of income which he uses in order to support his family.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used washing machines in order to repair them and re-sell them

loans.name: Iyabo Comfort

texts.en: Iyabo A. is 46 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband sells kerosene. She sells sarongs of various colours to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en:
C., 52, is a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province in Cambodia. She has four children: One is married and lives separately, two work as motor-taxi drivers, and another one is attending school. C. is married to Sameoun, 62, who owns a number of rental rooms for construction workers.

C. has sewn clothes since 2000 and earns a good income, for she famous in her skill. Therefore she has a lot of customers who buy her clothes in bulk. Recently, C. is facing difficulty with her accommodation. So C. is requesting a loan of $300 to build a small bridge with bamboo poles to her house. The loan will make the family a more comfortable living.

C. was not available during the photograph so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To build a small bridge with bamboo poles to her house

loans.name: Duk

texts.en:
A medium-sized stone house in Phnom Penh is the location of Mr. Duk S.'s home and grocery store. He usually buys produce in bulk from a marker supplier and sells it from his house. Normally, he can make average income of $6.00 per day. He has been running his business since early 2008.

His wife, SamArt, age 45, helps him with the business. She also sells a few vegetables in the market. The couple now has six children, four of whom still live with them in the family home.

Mr. S.'s investment is main source of income for the family and he recently sold all of the produce in his store. Therefore, he would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
A. Jacqueline est née le 07 mars 1975. Jacqueline est mariée à DOSSOU YOVO Philippe et mère de trois (03) enfants, tous scolarisés. Jacqueline réside avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Jacqueline vend de bijoux et des mèches de coiffure depuis trois ans dans le marché de GBEGAMEY. Grâce aux revenus de son activité Jacqueline arrive à porter de l'aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges de la famille. L'activité de Jacqueline marche bien mais elle a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu'elle n'en a aujourd'hui pour la développer. Ainsi, Jacqueline pourra mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients et faire plus de profit. C'est pourquoi Jacqueline demande de crédit auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Jacqueline was born on March 7, 1975. She is married to DOSSOU YOVO Philippe and is the mother of three children, all in school. She resides with her family in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Jacqueline has been selling jewelry and hair extensions for three years at the GBEGAMEY marketplace. Thanks to the revenues from her business, she’s managing to bring assistance to her husband where family expenses are concerned. Her business is doing well, but she has need of more funds that she currently lacks for its development. She would be able to respond better to the demands of her customers and to make more profit. These are the reasons why she’s asking for a loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry and hair extensions for hairstyling

loans.name: Adefusi

texts.en: Adefusi sells drinks and pure water. She hawks (sells door-to-door) her drinks and pure water. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more drinks and pure water to sell. She is 32 years old and married with two children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pure water to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina and her husband Santiago own and operate a general store in the village of Natappian, which is west of Solana, Cagayan. They sell a variety of items in their store, including dried fish, vegetables, candy and household tools. Much of their income goes towards raising and providing for the education of their children. She is requesting this loan to expand the store and increase her income. Lina and her husband are working hard to give their children a better life and quality education.

loans.use: To expand her small grocery store

loans.name: Prodige Plus Group

texts.fr: Isabelle est une dame qui est mieux connue dans son quartier situé à l’est de Kinshasa par son amour du travail, la bonne qualité des poissons salés ainsi que des babouches qu’elle vend. Elle est aussi caractérisée par un courage et détermination particuliers. Elle est toujours prête à servir ses clients. Quand il y a un nouvel arrivage de ses marchandises, elle fait un tour dans le quartier pour les informer de l'arrivage. Elle a commencé le commerce en 1990 en vendant des poissons fumés avec un capital initial de $75. Après avoir acquit une solide expérience, elle a durement travaillé avec une bonne gestion, les bénéfices accumulés lui ont procuré en 2004, un capital de plus de $400. De 2004 à 2007, la dépréciation monétaire ainsi que la hausse des prix ont perturbé l’évolution de son activité et lui ont causé une baisse. En aout 2008, Isabelle décide de rejoindre un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Prodige » dans le but de renforcer son capital et d’avoir un appui financier permanent. Elle est une cliente fidèle qui a reçu des crédits chez Hope RDC et les a totalement remboursés à temps. Le crédit qu’elle a obtenu ce mois de juin lui a servi d’acheter  des poissons salés ainsi que des babouches à revendre en vue d’accroitre son revenu. Actuellement, son capital propre est de $150. Son rêve est d’ouvrir un jour une boutique générale. Isabelle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 2 et 20 ans. Cinq d’entre eux étudient. Elle est fière d’être micro-entrepreneur
texts.en:
Isabelle is a lady who is best known, in her neighborhood situated in the east of Kinshasa, for her love of work and for the good quality of the salted fish and flip-flops she sells. She is also characterized by particular courage and determination. She is always ready to serve her customers. When she gets a new shipment in, she goes around the neighborhood to let folks know.

Isabelle began this business in 1990, selling smoked fish, with an initial capital of US$ 75. After having acquired a solid experience, she worked hard and managed her business well, and the profit she put aside amounted to a capital of more than US$ 400 in 2004.

From 2004-2007 the currency depreciation and price hikes perturbed her business and caused it to decrease. In August 2008, Isabelle decided to join one of the groups of Hope RDC called "Prodigy", intending to increase her capital and find permanent financial support. She is a faithful client who has received several loans from Hope RDC and has reimbursed them on time. The loan she has received this month of June allowed her to buy salted fish and flip-flops to resell so as to increase her revenue. Presently, her personal capital stands at US$ 150. Her dream is to open a general store.

Isabelle is married and the mother of 7 children, whose ages vary between 2 and 20. Five of them are enrolled in school. Isabelle is proud to be a micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing flip-flops and salted fish to resell

loans.name: Denis Del Socorro

texts.es: Denis C. Rodríguez tiene 44 años de edad, es un hombre casado. Tiene 3 hijos. La actividad económica a la que se dedica a es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Denis inicio este negocio por la necesidad de brindarle a su familia el pan de de cada día,  por lo que Denis empezó a invertir en la compra de ropa y ofrecerlas a sus amistades, al inicio el no poseía mucho la experiencia necesaria para ofrecer sus productos, pero con el tiempo logro instruirse a conocer los que sus clientes necesitaban y así proporcionarles prioridad a sus pedidos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, perfumes, ropa y bolsos. su deseo es ampliar su negocio para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Denis C. Rodríguez is 44 years old and is married with three children. He sells general merchandise and has done so for more than 5 years. Denis began his business out of the necessity to feed his family. He began by purchasing clothing, which he offered to his friends. At the outset, he did not have much experience in sales, but with time he learned the needs of his customers and was therefore able to purchase goods efficiently. This loan application is for the purchase of footwear, perfumes, clothing, and purses for his business. He wants to expand his business to give better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business

loans.name: Tạ Thị

texts.en:
L. Tạ Thị (43698122) is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling herbs and spices in the local community. L. has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid previous loans from TYM Fund. These previous loans were used to purchase additional products to sell. L. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Dirita Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Dirita lo integran Luisa Antonia H. R., Teresa de Jesús Velásquez y Mayra del Carmen Velásquez, estas tres mujeres provenientes de la comarca Dirita y de muy bajos recursos son muy valiosas ya que son laboriosas, emprendedoras y con deseos de salir adelante.

Dirita ya ha trabajado en conjunto  con Adim lo que le ha otorgado   mayores oportunidades para su negocio y su familia. En la actualidad ellas desean seguir trabajando pero para ello necesitan de capital para invertir en la compra de productos para sus negocios respectivamente como frutas y verduras (limón, naranja, ayote, chayote, sandilla, paya…etc.) y granos básicos.

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Luisa Antonia H. R. de 22 años de edad que hace cuatro años  inicio con la comercialización de frutas y verduras para ayudarse con los gastos de su casa y de sus hijos de 7, 6 y 5 años de edad. De la misma manera su compañera de grupo Teresa de Jesús Velásquez que también vende frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya.

Mientras Mayra del Carmen Velázquez tiene una pequeña pulpería que cuenta con los productos de consumo diario como el arroz, frijoles, aceite, huevo, carne, maíz, jabón, detergente…etc.  Ella desea poder salir adelante y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The Dirita Group consists of Luisa Antonia H. R., Teresa de Jesús Velásquez and Mayra del Carmen Velásquez. These three women come from the Dirita area and have few resources; they are very brave and hard working, entrepreneurial, with great desire to succeed. Adim has granted Dorita great opportunities for their respective businesses and families. Today they need to continue working but in order to do so they need capital to invest in buying products for their respective businesses such as fruit and vegetables (lemons, oranges, squash, chayote, watermelon, papaya, etc.) and basic grains. The coordinator of the group is 22 year old Luisa Antonia H. R. who 4 years ago began selling fruit and vegetables to help with her household expenses and her children ages 7, 6, and 5. Her fellow group member Teresa de Jesús Velásquez also sells fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market. Meanwhile Mayra del Carmen Velázquez has a small convenience store where she sells products commonly used every day such as rice, beans, oil, eggs, meat, corn, soap, detergent, etc. She hopes to be able to be successful and continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en: Bosede is 48 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives with the entire family in Lagos State. Bosede sells drinks and has been in this business for the past eight years. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase a freezer for cooling the drinks. This will enable her to reduce costs, increase profits and satisfy customers. She promises to repay the loan and says "thank you."

loans.use: To purchase a freezer

loans.name: Talahahou

texts.fr: Cette femme a appris la couture et est mariée à un journaliste. Le couple n’a pas d’enfant. Elle a ouvert sa boutique de couture dans le quartier d’Agoè Zongo à Lomé. Malheureusement elle ne trouve pas de clientes mais doit toujours payer les frais de location de son atelier. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle a décidé l’année dernière de commander une moulinette artisanale pour rendre le service consistant à écraser du piment et tomate en grande quantité, et bien d’autres condiments de cuisine. Cette nouvelle activité lui permet désormais de réaliser de bons chiffres d’affaires ; elle a beaucoup de clients actuellement. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter une autre moulinette dans le but de satisfaire à temps sa clientèle. Elle pense recruter un jeune homme pour cette future acquisition.

loans.use: Achat de moulinette de fabrication artisanale

loans.name: Eliezer

texts.en:
Eliezer B. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 58 years old. Eliezer is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Eliezer owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Eliezer is just starting this business.

In 2007, Eliezer joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliezer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,500 PHP from PMPC. Eliezer is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Eliezer from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Norma Marlen's Group

texts.es:
el grupo hermanas unidas lo integran 3 mujeres las cuales son muy trabajadoras y simpaticas, ellas son muy dedicadas a sus negocios, a continuacion se detalla las actividades que ellas realizan para ganarse la vida:
Norma Z. tiene 33 años de edad, es la coordinadora del grupo, esta casada con el Sr. Henry Licona. su esposo en estos momentos esta viviendo en USA y le manda mensualmente dinero para que pague los estudios de sus hijos y tambien para algunos gastos del hogar. ellos tienen 3 hijos y todos estan en la escuela.
Norma se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de pan y galletas como ser: semitas, galletas de varios sabores y pasteles. Su producto lo distribuye en diferentes pulperias de su zona, dicha actividad le ayuda a no depender de su esposo y ganarse dinero para el sustento de su hogar y de su familia. norma necesita el credito para comprar una batidora industrial para hacer mas rapido su trabajo y asi poder cumplir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
 Wendy F. tiene 24 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Roberto Espinoza con quien tiene un hijo de 3 años, Wendy se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, ella necesita el credito para comprar una maquina para elaborar tortillas, ya que tiene mucha demanda su producto y no se da abasto para cumplir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes, esta maquina le va a ahorrar mucho tiempo de produccion.
Santos Leonor Z. tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera, sus hijos ya estan graduados de la secundaria, Santos a mantenido a sus hijos a pura venta de tortillas, necesita el credito para comprar mas materiales para elaborar las tortillas ya que tiene que estar comprando a cada rato y esto hace que pierda tiempo y dinero, ademas que se atrasa en la produccion.
todas ellas necesitan el credito para salir adelante con sus familias y negocios.
texts.en:
The Hermanas Unidas group is formed by 3 hard-working and kind women. They are very dedicated to their businesses. More details about how they earn their livings follow: Norma Z. is 33 years old and is the coordinator of the group. She's married to Mr. Henry Licona who right now is living in the U.S. and who sends her money each month to pay for the kids' education and some of the household expenses. They have 3 children and all are in school. Norma makes and sells bread and cookies, specifically "semitas," a local sweet bread, and various kinds of cookies and pastries. She distributes her products to different grocery stores in the area. Her business helps her to not depend on her husband and helps her to earn money to take care of her family. Norma needs the loan to buy a commercial mixer to make her work go more quickly and therefore be able to fulfill all of her clients' requests. Wendy F. is 24 years old and is married to Mr. Roberto Espinoza with whom she has a three-year-old son. Wendy makes and sells tortillas. She needs the loan to buy a tortilla machine as there is a lot of demand for her products and she cannot make enough to keep up with demand. The machine would save her a lot of production time. Santos Leonor Z. is 40 years old and is a single mother. Her children have already graduated from high school. Santos has supported her children through the sale of tortillas. She needs the loan to buy materials to make tortillas as she now has to buy supplies frequently which makes her lose time and money and she gets behind in production. All of the women need the loans to help their families and businesses to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a commercial mixer and of a tortilla machine and supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Sela Ry Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of 15 people, and they all live in Rumcheck village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sela R. has been selected by the members as the village bank president. 

She is a silk weaver, and now she wants to expand her business by purchasing more silk raw materials. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's quality of life with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Phang Seng KR., is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantatiO., he is a recycling collector. Mrs. Sela R. is 36 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk raw materials to support her business.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis vive en la calle  “Tacaya” de la zona  Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto, en una casa como cuidador.

Luis posee un terreno donde pocp a poco está construyendo su casa.
 
Vive junto a sus dos hijos menores, los cuales están en edad escolar, pues sus otros hijos, son mayores,   ya tienen su propia familia y son independientes. 

El trabaja como contratista en trabajos de decorado y pintado de viviendas, los cuales los realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de materiales de construcción (arena, cemento, ladrillos) para continuar edificando su casa.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
