Luis lives on Tacaya Street in the Villa Ingenio zone of El Alto city. He resides in a house as a caretaker. Luis owns land on which, little by little, he is building his own house. He lives with his two minor children, who are of school age. His other children, already adults, are independent and have their own families. The loan is destined for buying construction materials (sand, cement, bricks) to continue building his house. This is his first credit with IMPRO. The evaluation carried out qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS FOR CONSTRUCTING WALLS FOR HIS HOUSE

loans.name: Funke

texts.en:
Funke lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is 55 years old and married with seven children, all of whom are excelling in school.
Funke makes and sells yam flour, popularly known as “elubo” in Nigeria. “Elubo” is used in the preparation of “amala" (a yam paste or porridge). She has been in this business for a long time. Funke is requesting a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more tubers of yam to make more yam flour to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional goods for her shop

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario F. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 45 years old. Rosario is married. To make a living, Rosario owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosario has been engaged in her business for over  years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosario joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosario from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mr. Phally S., 32, and his wife, Mrs. Sorin Vann, 36, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1996 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. All of the children are in school.   

The family has three lines of business: producing rice wine, raising pigs and silk weaving. Phally is asking for a loan of $1,000 to continue producing rice wine and raising pigs.

loans.use: To use for producing rice wine and raising pigs.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas P., 59 years old, is a rice grower from Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. Despite her age, she is still active and very capable of managing her business. She has workers on the farm and she monitors her harvest all the time.

Leonidas desires to have more income to support her family needs. She likes to grow her income and that is why she would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Luz's Group

texts.en:
Luz R. is from the village of Magsaysay. She is 43 years old. Luz is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Luz R..

Luz is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Luz owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling vegetables in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $87 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Luz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Luz is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kathlene

texts.en:
Kathlene B. is from the village of Sugarland, Lumbo Valencia City. She is 23 years old. Kathlene is single and has two infant children. To make a living, Kathlene owns & operates a business providing manicure and pedicure services to local community members. Kathlene has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Kathlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kathlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Kathlene is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Kathlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
Rosa Aurora Milán M.  tiene 32 años, es soltera, y  tiene cuatro hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Rosa trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, cebada, mora  y papas  además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como chanchos y cuyes   los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Rosa  le gusta lavar cocinar y coser en los tiempos libres. 

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 32 years old. She is single and has four children. She lives on the edge of the town of Guaranda, in the Bolívar province. She is a part of the "Rural Window Group Enmanuel," which is an enclave located 45 minutes from Guaranda, the capital of the Bolivár province. There are a total of 17 members in this farming and agricultural community. They are indigenous people and speak Quechua. Rosa farms in order to improve the economic status of her family. The crops that she mainly grows are corn, barley, blackberries, and potatoes. She also raises livestock such as hogs and Guinea pigs. She sells the livestock from her home, but she takes her harvests to the main marketplace in Guaranda every six months. The principle cultural activity is the carnival that is celebrated every year in February. Rosa also likes to cook and sew in her spare time. She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies for her farm work, particularly fertilizers. Her goal is to have a good income for her family. Her biggest challenges are the problems with the weather and the plant diseases that affect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Candida Del Socorro

texts.es: La   Sra. Cándida del Socorro Q. M.    su actividad es trabajar con venta de abarrotes y cosméticos   ella  tiene seis   años de  trabajar con este negocio,  es casada  actualmente. Este es su  crédito nº diez con CEPRODEL y este préstamo lo quiere para la compra de granos básicos y ampliar mas su negocio por q con estos préstamos es que ella ha llegado a crecer con su negocio y le ayudan en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Cándida del Socorro Q. M. is married and has sold groceries and cosmetics for six years. This is her tenth loan from CEPRODEL and she will use it to purchase staple merchandise to continue developing her business. Her previous loans have helped her in both her personal and professional life.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of staples such as rice, sugar, beans, and soft drinks for Holy Week

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
Kadie is 30 years old, and married with six children--a girl and five boys--four of whom are in primary school, and two in nursery school.  She owns a shop in Laka, where she sells building materials.

Kadie is a very good member of LAPOSL and has taken three previous loans to expand her shop and assist her husband in paying the children's school fees.  She now needs a loan of SLL 3,000,000 to grow her business and also to help her family.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena tiene 36 años, está casada y tiene 7 hijos. Reside en la localidad de Pichari, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tienen su casa propia.

Es una mujer luchadora que no tuvo complejos de vender sus productos en la calle; recuerda que había empezado en producir hoja de coca, ya que algo tenía que vender para cubrir los alimentos del día. Cuando tuvo hijos, ella y su esposo empezaron en cultivar cacao y café para cubrir las necesidades familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida y hasta hoy le viene dando buenos resultados. Generalmente trabaja junto su esposo en su chacra y hacen un buen equipo, sus productos los vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad a precio de mercado. Lleva 25 años de labor y sus planes a futuro son de abrir una tienda de abarrotes con el propósito de obtener ingresos adicionales.

Este su cuarto préstamo con MFP y asegura fielmente cumplir con su pagos respectivos, además está conforme por el buen grupo que conformó su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en darle mantenimiento a su terreno cultivo, con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de sus productos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Filomena is 48 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in the town of Pichari, specifically in the beautiful Cuscan jungle, where she has her own home.

Filomena is a determined woman who does not have complex products to sell on the street. She recalls starting out by growing coca leaves so that she could have something to sell to feed her family every day. When she had her children, she and her husband began growing cacao and coffee to cover the family necessities and improve their quality of life. As of today, they have produced good results. Filomena and her husband generally work together and they make a good team. Their products are sold at the local collections centers at market price. Filomena has been working for 25 years and has future plans of opening a grocery store in hopes of earning additional income.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Filomena is careful about completing each of her payments. She gets along well with the group that started her Communal Bank. The money she requested will be invested in the maintenance of her farmland with the goal of improving the quality of her agricultural products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of her farmland

loans.name: Lilliam Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Lilliam  es madre de familia de un hijo de dos años, tiene 38 años de edad,  y vive junto con su esposo en el barrio Enrique Smith, el trabaja en la alcaldía de Managua, desde hace un año formo un pequeño comedor en donde vende una variedad de alimentos,  inicio con el objetivo de prosperar para un futuro, lo ha logrado con ayuda de ahorros propio de su esposo el cual también lleva a sus compañeros de trabajo que son varios al comedor. Y así ha captado clientes, gracias al esfuerzo de su esposo construyo su casa de concreto, pero es pequeña es por eso desea hacer la inversión y formar un piso arriba para el comedor y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que su objetivo es poder crecer en su pequeño negocio. Para esto comprara los materiales necesarios para comenzar la obra como: perlines, zinc, arena, cemento, hierro y otros. Que será de mucho beneficios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lilliam is the mother of a two-year-old son. She is 38-years-old and lives together with her husband in the Enrique Smith neighborhood. He works in the mayor's office in Managua. About a year ago she started a little restaurant where she sells a variety of foods. She started with the idea of prospering for the future, and she has achieved this through her own savings, and with her husband, who takes many of his co-workers (and there are a lot) to eat at her restaurant. In this way, she's earned clients. Thanks to the efforts of her husband, she has built her own concrete house, but it's quite small, so she would like to invest in putting in a second floor for the restaurant and give a better quality of service to her clients, since her goal is now to grow her little business. For this reason, she will buy the necessary building materials to start the project, such as beams, zinc, sand, cement, iron, and others, which will be of great help.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of building materials

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en: Dioscora S. is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fishing. Her husband, Hedrito, who is 43 years old, is a fisherman and they have four adult children. Dioscora joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 2008 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a fishing business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 8,000 from her business activities. Dioscora is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 13,000 was used to fund operations of her fishing business and it had a positive impact on both the business and on her family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 15,000 for her 5th loan which she intends to use to fund her fishing activities. Dioscora is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu I. is married and has two children. She has received a junior high education.  Salamatu prepares tuo zaafi (often called TZ) at Abura for sale. Tuo zaafi is a local dish common with the people in the Northern Region of Ghana. It is either prepared from corn flour, sorghum flour or millet flour and accompanied with okro soup and groundnut soup with any kind of meat or fish of your choice. She has been doing this for six years. Her husband is a mason.  Salamatu uses her income to help her husband take care of her family.  Salamatu will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare tuo zaafi to sell. With the new profits from her extended business, Salamatu plans to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare tuo zaafi to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Kheng Say Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people make up a village bank loan and they have selected Mrs. Kheng S. as a village president. She is a 38-year-old located in Koun Chreae village in Kandal province. All the members will use their portion of the loan for varied purposes to improve their lives. Mrs. Kheng S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land in which to cultivate rice to support her family, while her husband, Mr. Thol Chor, is a fisherman who can also earn some money to support his family. 

Now she has a problem because her husband’s fishing boat is broken. So to solve this problem, Mrs. Kheng S. is applying for a loan to buy resin for the fishing boat and with the rest of the loan, she'll pay for a motorbike lien. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while another is attending a local public school and the youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: To buy resin to fix a fishing boat

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 44 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 4 children, ages ranging from 19 and 28. Her youngest child is currently attending school. 

Nancy has been farming for the last 3 years in Kisii town, Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize and groundnuts which she sells to the local market. She also owns and earns income from her rental houses in the same area. Her major challenges have been lack of enough capital and seasonal changes which affects her produce.

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of KES.45,000 to purchase and feed a dairy cow. She says that she will have enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will enable her to send her child to college.

She says that Juhudi should increase the amount of first loans and is grateful to Juhudi for supporting farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and feed a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz, de 24 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jesús de 39 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. Con mucho esfuerzo Mariluz ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, café y piña, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado de La Merced, lugar donde las vende al por mayor. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y aún le gusta cuidar sus cultivos y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y desea ser muy puntual en sus pagos. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los quinientos soles que solicita, hará limpiar su chacra y contratará peones, para que la ayuden en el cultivo.
texts.en:
Mariluz, age 24, is a very cheerful and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house, together with her husband Jesús, age 39, and her 2 beloved children, who are the main inspiration behind all her efforts. With great effort, Mariluz has been able to cultivate her fields and make them highly productive. She grows coffee and pineapples, which she later takes to sell on a wholesale basis at the market in La Merced. She has done this work for 2 years, and she still enjoys taking care of her fields. What she considers most difficult is transporting her products to the market, since the sacks she carries are very heavy and she gets quite tired. In the future, she would like to buy new fields to expand her plantings. This is her first loan with MFP, and she wants to be very punctual with her payments. In her communal bank, she is a very participative member, and she is always up to date on the agreements reached within her group. With the 500 soles she is requesting, she will have her fields cleared and hire laborers to help her cultivate them.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hiring laborers to clear her fields and help her with planting

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa F. is 27 and married with three children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting 'taamu' (giant taro root) for sale.  Temukisa has three years of experience in this business.  Temukisa needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Temukisa joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Temukisa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es: Mario Ernesto M. de 31 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador y un padre de familia responsable con su hogar, el vive junto a su esposa, quien le ayuda con el negocio y así mismo realiza los quehaceres del hogar, también vive junto a sus tres hijos, todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Mario posee un bazar, en el cual comercializa: ropa, zapatos, accesorios para arreglar regalos, cremas, shampoo, tintes para el cabello y otros productos más los cuales son destinados para diferentes usos. El negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación en donde vende con sus vecinos y amigos, los cuales dan muy buenas referencias de él ya que se destaca por ser una excelente persona. Mario solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir el bazar con más productos de primera necesidad, así de esta forma él espera contar con más ganancias las cuales sean de mucho beneficio para su familia, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos que posee, por lo que desea mejorar su servicio.
texts.en:
Mario Ernesto M. is 31 years old. He is a very hardworking man and is a father who is responsible. He lives with his wife, who helps him with the business and does the household chores. He also lives with his three children, all of whom are young and are students.

Mario has a small store where he sells clothing, shoes, gift wrapping accessories, creams, shampoos, hair dyes and other products for various uses. The business is located in his home and he sells to his neighbors and friends, who give very good references of him since he stands out for being a great person.

Mario is requesting a loan so that he can stock his store with more basic needs items. In doing so, he hopes to have more earnings, which are very beneficial for his family since it is his only source of income. This is why he wants to improve his service.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic needs items

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana; ella tiene 33  años de edad y es casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos ella vende en el mercado de Huancaro que queda ubicado en la ciudad de Cusco desde las 7:00 a m hasta las 4.00 p.m   y después se va y también lleva a las distintas ferias que se realizan en la ciudad de Cusco, ella quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes en el distrito de Yuncaypata que está ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  granos secos como trigo, garbanzos y quinua al por mayor. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ana, 33, is married and has four children. She is a member of the “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata” communal bank located in Yuncaypata, Cusco province, Cusco department. She alternates her daily chores with the sale of dry grains in Cusco’s Huancaro Market. She works from 7am until 4pm. Then she leaves and also goes to the various farmers markets that take place in Cusco. She wants to have a grocery store in Yuncaypata which is located fifteen minutes from Cusco. She is asking for funds to buy dry grains like wheat, chickpeas and quinoa at wholesale. She makes use of this forum to thank all those who share in her dream and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dry grains like wheat, chickpeas and quinoa at wholesale.

loans.name: Cecelia Aba

texts.en: Cecelia Aba A. sells 'kenkey' and maize at Elmina.  Cecelia Aba has no educational background. Her husband is a farmer. Cecelia has been selling 'kenkey' for two years. She helps her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare 'kenkey' for sale. She hopes to reinvest the new profit back into her business.

loans.use: buy more maize to prepare' kenkey' (fermented maize dough) for sale

loans.name: God Our Father Group

texts.en:
Ivy K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Our Father. She is 41 years old, married, and has two children who are between the ages of 2 and 16 years. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of support. 

For 3 years, she has been selling bowls (dishes) in Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 16,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 74,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bowls (dishes). She describes herself as a friendly and respectful woman whose dream is to improve her business.

IN THE PHOTO THAT ACCOMPANIES THIS PROFILE, MARY IS INSET AT LOWER RIGHT BECAUSE SHE WAS ABSENT DURING DISBURSAL.

loans.use: To buy more bowls (dishes).

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen J. is 33 years old and from the Chemisoi area in the outskirts of Kisumu city. She is married to Sammy Too, and they have six children who are all over 18 years old.

Hellen has a business selling baked scones, locally known as "mandazi," which are a delicacy here. They are mostly used for taking tea. Hellen is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD and has a good credit history with us. She is in need of baking flour, cooking oil, and baking powder, which is her reason for applying for this loan. Her profits will be used to buy household items and educate her children. 

Her desire is to start another business alongside the current one.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, cooking oil, and baking powder to add to her stock

loans.name: San

texts.en: San Y. has been a farmer for many years. She and her husband live in the province of Kompong Cham. San Y. cultivates rice from which she makes a daily income. On average, she makes US$2.50 of profit a day. San Y. is married and has no children. Currently, she also raises pigs to make additional income in order to support her family's needs.  San Y. would like to use her loan to purchase more pigs to raise for selling and to use the remainder of the loan to buy cucumber seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to raise for selling.

loans.name: Mrs. Samrit An Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Samrit A. and her husband, Mr. Sorn Khiev, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land upon which they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. They have two children who are employed in garment factories and live in Spueu village in Takeo province. Although they work hard, they earn very little in income.

Samrit was selected by the other fourteen members of their village bank to be the bank loA. president. Each member will use their portion of the loA. for different purposes. Samrit will use her portion of the loA. to buy two piglets and pig feed to start a new pig breeding business. With the rest of the loA. she is going to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy two piglets, pig feed and fertilizer

loans.name: 16-02-10 Group

texts.en:
Hue N. T. (8) is a 41 year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Hue is the group leader of a six member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 10-Dong hai (16.02.10).

Hue is married and has three school-aged children.  To making a living, Hue owns and operates a fishing business.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community.  Hue has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Hue joined Kiva partner Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hue is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in the amount of 4,248,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell.  Hue plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  B. T. Phien (39) is a 56 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

2.  L. T. lan (33) is a 58 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  N. T. Phuong (32) is a 36 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

4.  N. T. Tuyen (70) is a 29 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

5.  L. T. Nga (4) is a 48 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hue N. T. (8) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hue là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 10-Dong hai (16.02.10).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hue thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hue kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Hue đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hue đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  B. T. Phien (39) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  L. T. lan (33) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  N. T. Phuong (32) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  N. T. Tuyen (70) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


5.  L. T. Nga (4) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: El. Sr. Mauricio García desea comprar un videojuego para unas maquinitas que tiene en su tienda ya que argumenta el Sr. Mauricio que abra mas flujo de niños en su tienda por lo cual aumentaran sus ventas y desea poder comprarlo con el crédito pues ve en el crédito la mejor manera de llevar acabo su proyecto pues considera que el interés es muy bajo ya que no tendría que desembolsar todo de golpe y no seria un gasto muy fuerte para su economía. .
texts.en:
Mauricio García would like to buy a video game for some games machines that he has in his store since he says that this will increase the flow of children to his store which means that his sales will increase.

Mauricio would like to make his purchase with this loan because he sees the loan as the best way of carrying out his project.  He considers the interest on the loan to be very low and because it means that he won't have to pay a large sum up front this, in turn, means that it won't be a very big out-of-pocket expense which would hurt his finances.

loans.use: To buy a video game for his game machine

loans.name: Sharifah

texts.en:
Sharifah N. is single and has no children. She lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood of the city of Kampala in a home that she rents. She doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent.

Sharifah upgraded her food stall to a restaurant operated from her home. She has been in the restaurant business for one month, and she works seven days out of every week. The main problems for Sharifah include the rainy season and defaulters.

Sharifah has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice and sweet and Irish potatoes. Her aspiration for her business is to have a fully stocked restaurant and also improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more food for her restaurant

loans.name: Fazeelat's Group

texts.en:
Fazeelat lives in Faisalabad, Pakistan’s third largest city known for its textile industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Ghulamabad. She moved here 6 years ago. 

Fazeelat is 48 years old, married to N. M., and has 6 children: 5 sons and 1 daughter. She could not educate her children due to poor financial conditions. 

Fazeelat is a very responsible person, and carried out her responsibilities of a housewife and caring for her family very well. Her husband operates a grocery store in a nearby market. Through his shop, he sells daily use items such as sugar, cooking oil, lentils, etc. He is known in his area for his good customer service and quality products.   Fazeelat’s two elder sons operate a cloth selling business.  

Fazeelat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will purchase more groceries in bulk, which will help him fulfill the demands of his customers and make more income.   Fazeelat hopes that this investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and improve the living standards for her family.   She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with the raised hand is Fazeelat.

loans.use: To buy stock for grocery store business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza C. is from the village of Villaluz, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 61 years old. Flordeliza is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Flordeliza owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruit in the local community. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Flordeliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Flordeliza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Nyawa

texts.en:
Nyawa is a married man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

He has operated a meat goat selling business for the past four years, selling wholesale to butchers. Nyawa faces a major challenge of delayed payments and seasonality in his business. He hopes to grow and expand his business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase goats to sell for meat. He decided to join Yehu to access funds and improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase goats to sell later for meat

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
Candida tiene 59 años y está casada, posee casa propia en la ciudad de Paraguari.
Candida se dedica a la producción y ventas de hortalizas desde hace más de 20 años con la ayuda de su marido, poseen su propia huerta, la actividad de la señora empieza a muy tempranas horas de la mañana para transladarse con sus productos al mercado municipal de la ciudad de Paraguarí, donde tiene su puesto de ventas.
Todos sus hijos son mayores de edad y trabajan por cuenta propia.
Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de electrodomésticos.
texts.en: Candida is 59 years old and married.  She owns her own home in the city of Paraguarí.  Candida has been producing and selling vegetables for more than 20 years, with her husband's help.  They own their own vegetable garden.  Candida gets up very early in the morning to transport her produce to the municipal market in Paraguarí where she has her sales stall.  All of her children are grown up and work.  Candida plans to use her loan to buy household electrical appliances.

loans.use: to buy household electrical appliances

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en: Syuzanna O. is 36 years old. She lives in Vanadzor city with her two daughters, who are students. For over five years Syuzanna has been running her own business: clothing sales in a rented shop. She sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothes, which she buys weekly from Yerevan. Thanks to her business income Syuzanna keeps her family and pays for her children's educations. Syuzanna has already received loans from Nor Horizon six times. Now she is seeking for a 250,000 AMD loan to buy spring season clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy spring season clothes to resell

loans.name: Librada

texts.es:
La Sra. Librada es comerciante hace mas de 6 años, tiene una librería y fotocopiadora a una cuadra de la Facultad UPAP de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
Ella es divorciada con dos hijos, que ya son mayores de edad, uno se llama Marcos y trabaja con ella en la librería realizando trabajos a computadora, comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que tiene muy buena ubicación y cuenta con local propio.
La sra. Librada agradece a la Fundacion Paraguaya por la confianza puesta en su persona y la oportunidad de solicitar un crédito en Kiva y asegura que invertirá bien su préstamo, para poder devolverlo en tiempo y forma, para poder seguir trabajando con la institución.
Ella solicita este crédito para poder comprar otra computadora con la cual trabajar.
texts.en:
Librada has been a saleswoman for more than six years.  She has a bookstore and photocopying business which is located one block from UPAP (Universidad Politécnica y Artística de Paraguay), in the city of Coronel Oviedo. 

Librada is divorced and has two children who are already grown up.  One is called Marcos and works with her in the bookstore, doing work for people on a computer.  Librada tells us that she has a very good customer base because her store is well located and she owns her own premises.

Librada is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the trust that they have placed in her and the opportunity that they have given her to request a loan through Kiva.  She assures us that she will invest her loan well so that she can pay it back on time and in full, as she would like to be able to continue working with the institution.

Librada is requesting this loan so that she can buy another computer with which to work.

loans.use: to buy another computer

loans.name: Gelaida

texts.en: Gelaida  lives  in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has four children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren).Gelaida has a business of cereals. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Gelaida sells her products on a wholesale basis in a shop. Gelaida has requested  for a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of rice. She also generates additional income through piped water.The main business challenges for Gelaida include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van.   Gelaida lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills and for food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro nació en la ciudad de Urubamba y tiene 48 años. Él asegura que se siente feliz al haber conformado una familia unida. Pues se casó hace varios años y fruto esta relación tiene cuatro hijos. Alejandro trabaja en el hotel Libertadores como supervisor del bio huerto desde las 4h00 hasta las 15h45 de lunes a sábado. Alejandro tiene varias chacras donde siembra hortalizas. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Saywa - Chichubamba”, y este es el onceavo ciclo de crédito con la Asociación Arariwa, donde está seguro que accederá a futuros créditos porque refiere que con sus ahorros, sus pagos puntuales, más el trabajo activo que desempeña en su banco comunal garantizan como una persona responsable. Con el crédito solicitado, invertirá para comprar productos como por ejemplo semillas de papa para sembrar.
texts.en: Alejandro was born in the city of Urubamba and he is 48 years old. He declares to be happy knowing that he has a close family. He married several years ago and his four children are the fruit of this relationship. Alejandro works at the Libertadores Hotel as the supervisor of the ponds from 4am to 3:45pm from Monday to Saturday. Alejandro has several fields where he plants vegetables. He is a member of the communal bank "Saywa - Chichubamba" and it is their eleventh loan cycle with Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner). He is sure to be able to access future loans given that he has savings, his payments are on time, and the fact that he actively works in his communal bank guarantee that he is a responsible person. With the loan which he requests he will invest in the purchase of potato seeds to plant.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata est née vers 1957 à Yorosso, mariée mère  de 4 enfants, elle vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Darsalam I de la préfecture de Koutiala (région de Sikasso). 
Pour des raisons sociales, Aminata n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études et elle s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus, depuis à bas âge, auprès de sa maman. Après avoir exercé plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par opter pour l’achat vente des bois de construction et des bois de chauffe  il y a 15 ans. Madame Aminata trouve que cette activité lui procure assez de revenus, car elle vend une importante quantité de bois dans le mois.  
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle en quantité et augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 6 ans. Après 8 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous remboursés correctement, elle est à son 3 eme  prêt  individuel  et les deux précédents ont été correctement payé.   
Avec ce nouveau, elle compte acheter, 1 chargement de remorque en bois dans un  village de Koutiala  et  elle effectue sa vente  dans le marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle mixte, au comptant.  
Avec ce prêt elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des intérêts, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans son activités. Elle compte sur les financements  de Soro  Yiriwaso pour l’agrandissement de son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata was born in about 1957 at Yorosso, she is married and mother of 4 children.She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children in the neighborhood Darsalam 1 of the Koutiala prefecture (Sikasso region).
For social reasons, Aminata was not lucky enough to study and she rapidly became interested in income generating activities at a young age at her mother’s side. Having practiced several activities without success, she finally chose the commerce of building timber and firewood 15 years ago. Mrs. Aminata finds that this activity brings in sufficient income for she sells a considerable amount of wood each month.
To satisfy her customers’ need for quantity and to enlarge the size of her business, she decided to consult the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organization 6 years ago. After 8 solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid, this is her 3 rd. individual loan, the two previous loans have been repaid correctly.
With this new loan, she intends to purchase, 1 trailer load of wood in the village of Koutiala, she sells her merchandise at the market in Koutiala to a mixed clientele for cash.
With this loan she hopes to make an average profit of 90.000FCFA per month which she plans to use for the repayment of the interest, for contributing to the family expenses and the remainder she will re-invest in her business. She is counting on the funding of Soro Yiriwaso for the expansion of her activity.

loans.use: purchase wood for construction.

loans.name: Mercedes Martina

texts.es: Mercedes Martina tiene 35 años de edad, la señora tiene 2 años de tener este negocio pero es importante resaltar que esta actividad nació por la falta de empleo con el objetivo de ayudar a su familia ya que ella se dedica a lo que es librería. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, ha logrado mejorar poco a poco y ofertar más productos a sus clientes. Este es su primer financiamiento que ella realiza es así poda comprar lápices, cuadernos, borradores, hojas, tarjadores y reglas es por eso que realiza este financiamiento.
texts.en: Mercedes Martina is 35 years old.  She has been in her business for two years.  It is important to highlight that she started her business because she couldn't find work and she started the business with the goal of helping her family.  Mercedes Martina's business is a stationery store.  She has owned her business for more than two years.  She has gradually managed to improve her business and offer more products to her customers.  This is her first loan and she will use it to buy pencils, composition books, erasers, paper, pencil sharpeners and rulers.

loans.use: to buy pencils, composition books, erasers, paper, pencil sharpeners and rulers

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
Naziran is married. She is very simple lady and keeps herself busy in household work and taking care of her family. She is fond of cooking and makes healthy food for her family. 

Her husband is involved in an animal sales business. He buys young animals like goats and cows and raised them for sale. He has been operating this business for many years. He loves his business and by seeing him practice it, Naziran also started helping him by taking care of his cattle. She can now give them timely food and water and clean their stall.  

Her husband’s business grows greatly at the Eid (Muslim holiday) when people come to him to buy animals for slaughter. At other times, he sells them to butchers and earns income for the family. 

Naziran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy goats for resale. She hopes that the loan investment will be a productive one for him.

loans.use: To buy goats for selling.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with six children: four attend school while two are too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Ali has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He also sells coconuts, which contributes to his other source of income. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in his business. Ali dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale business in the future.

With the KES 10,000 he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, beans and paraffin. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, beans and paraffin.

loans.name: Sari Maju Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang lives in Melaya, West Bali. She is married and has two children aged 14 and 9. Her younger son is in the fourth year of elementary school and her older son is in the second year of junior high school. Her husband works as a Farmer. Though Ni Komang often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family's income. She has been raising pigs for five years. 

Ni Komang is the head of the S. Maju group, which is made up of 14 neighbors from the same village. This is the group's first loan with MUK. With the 1,500,000 Indonesian Rupiah (IDR) that Ni Komang receives, she will purchase two piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as fattening pigs. With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the income from her piggery, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Judith; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de jugos, ella vende en el mercado de la ciudad de cusco, la socia también tiene un carro que alquila y hace servicio de taxi, la socia trabaja en el negocio de venta de jugos desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de jugos y negocio de transporte, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de jugos y negocio de servicio de taxi. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro para comprar repuestos y llantas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "SANTO DOMINGO".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco, and department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Judith.  She is 34 years old and is single with 2 children.  The member combines her daily activities with the business of selling juice, which she sells in the market of the town of Cusco.  The member also has a car which she rents and uses to run a taxi service.  The member works in the business selling juice from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm, and by means of these businesses the member is moving her children ahead in life.

The member wants to expand her business selling juice and her transportation business; the partner wants to expand her business selling juice and her taxi service business.  The member is requesting the loan for the maintenance of her car, to buy spare parts and tires.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with repayments.

loans.use: to maintain her car and buy spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old. She is a widow with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling beans and sugar in Jigomoni Branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the profit from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador is 58 years old and has a sari-sari (variety) store. He has been operating this for three years and earns 1,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every month. As an entrepreneur, he wants to earn more than his current profit, so he is being industrious and has the patience to sell in his store despite  the debts of some of his customers. 

He wants to stock more grocery items such as soft drinks, biscuits, breads, and butter in his store to sell, so he took out a loan of 7,000 PHP from Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc. as an additional source of profit and also to avoid bankruptcy.

loans.use: to stock more grocery items such as soft drinks, biscuits, breads, and butter in his store

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 39 years old.  She buys and sells rice and corn as her main source of income. She has been doing this for four years and earns P200 every day. This is not enough for her family but she budgets carefully in order to be self-sufficient. 


She is requesting a loan of P5,000 to buy more rice to sell. She hopes to earn a higher income through the help of this loan. She works hard to meet the needs of her family including her children's education. She hopes her children will earn degrees and improve their living condition.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman with seven children, two of whom still attend school while five have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has owned rental houses, and her potential customers are tenants. Fatuma dreams of expanding and constructing more real estate rental homes in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 loan, she wants to renovate her rental houses, purchase 10 bags of cement and pay for labor charges. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses, purchase 10 bags of cement and pay for labor

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Despite the hardships and difficulties in life, Juliet has a strong faith and determination to uplift her family's status of living. She is now 40 years old and a mother of four. With her husband, they aim to continue sending their children to school, for they want them to earn a degree and become professionals in the future. To generate income, Juliet is engaged in selling rice and feeds in the public market to supplement her husband's income.

She wants to sell more rice and feeds, but due to inadequate capital she is asking for an additional P30,000 to buy additional stocks of rice and feeds to sell in the public market. She believes that she can make the business grow and be profitable through her patience and sacrifices.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice and feeds to sell.

loans.name: 03.07.100 Thiệu Long Group

texts.en:
Mrs Chương Lê works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

Chương  is 60 years old and she is married with 4 children. She is the group leader of the 100 Thiệu Long solidarity group, which consists of 8 members. She lives and works in Thiệu Hoá district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She does not have any dependents.

This is Chương's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. With her business profit, she hopes to be able to buy a motorbike and land of her own. She also hopes for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a very hard-working woman who has practiced mixed farming for over five years and earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. She is 44 years old and married to Paul who is  also a farmer; they have five children.

She is applying for her first loan after being introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is a registered client. She plans to use the part of the loan amount to buy farm inputs and the rest for a business. 

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay  school fees for her children. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Hernán

texts.es:
Hernán es de Ciudad del Este,  está  casado con la Sra. Ramona, tienen 1 hija mayor de edad que ya se maneja de forma independiente.
El señor Hernán tiene una despensa bien surtida donde trabaja con su esposa. Comenta que se iniciaron con un dinero que recibió Hernán como parte de una indemnización que había recibido en un trabajo anterior. 
El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que vaya a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
Hernán manifiesta que la ayuda de la fundación siempre le fue muy útil, y es por ello que una vez más recurre a ella para solicitar un crédito, pues desea abastecer con más productos su despensa.
texts.en:
Hernán is from Ciudad del Este and is married to Ramona.  They have one adult daughter who is independent.

Hernán has a well stocked store where he works with his wife.  He said that they started the store with money Hernán received as compensation from a past job.  

He is a responsible person with a drive to get ahead.  He has a happy and enterprising spirit who no doubt will achieve all of the goals he has proposed.  

Hernán says that the help of the foundation has always been very useful, so he returned again to request a loan because he wants to stock more products in his store.

loans.use: to purchase food, drinks, milk, and other items to stock his store.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy an additional unit for her internet cafe business.

Anita has been in this business for 4 years. Anita earns additional income from her variety store and food vending.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit for her internet cafe business

loans.name: Tsogt-Erdene

texts.en:
Tsogt-Erdene is 55 years old and lives with his wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His wife runs a grocery shop business, and his two children are employed and live independently. 

Tsogt-Erdene started his auto repair business in 2000 in his own garage. His business is fairly profitable. However, now that he's older, he wishes to expand his wife's grocery shop and work there. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I am getting old, and I am beginning to lose my skills and powers as a repairman. I need to do something less physical." He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to build an extension to the shop and buy supplies.

loans.use: to build an extension to his wife's shop and buy supplies.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is 40 years old and married with four children, all of whom attend school.  She operates a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan and has been in business for three years.

Ludy is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use the extra income generated from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina has been engaged in hog-raising for three years. She is 43 years old and still single. She lives with her family in the village of Carabatan Grande. Gina is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase feed, vaccines, and additional hogs to raise. Gina is very grateful to everyone who can help her achieve her dreams with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines, and additional hogs to raise.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 28-years-old and a single mother of one child. She is also supporting five people in the family. She has been in the business of selling clothing materials to her clients for the last 11 years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 7,200.

She is applying for her first loan of Kes 15,000. She will use the funds to buy more second-hand clothes for sale. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With the anticipated profits she will pay for school fees for her child.

Her hopes are to pay for her child's school fees and provide for the family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard is from the village of Totosgyugh in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three children – a 24-year-old daughter and two sons (24 and 26 years old).  Alvard has a high school education and has been working as a farmer for the past 25 years.  She also helps support her relatives living in the city with agricultural products grown on the family farm.  She would like a loan to purchase livestock and animal feed.  She expects this investment to increase the family income by ten percent.  Alvard dreams of continuing to grow her business, which she can pass on to her children.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construccion de anexo

loans.name: Marquisse

texts.fr: Marquisse a 36 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a deux enfants à charge. Elle revend des articles ménagers divers afin de trouver de quoi faire vivre sa petite famille. Elle aimerait développer cette activité. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.

loans.use: augmenter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a dairy farming business.

loans.name: Tarkem

texts.en: T. is a 35-year-old mother with 2 children. She was selling household goods before being a member of MBK. Now she does not have to ask for her husband’s money to run the business since she has received working capital from MBK. Her husband, Tunggon, is a motorcycle taxi driver.  His income is only enough to pay for electricity and other daily needs. She usually earns $4/day, and she hopes to get a $50 loan to buy more goods such as rice, kerosene, and instant noodles. She is willing to repay this loan within in a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Small kiosk

loans.name: Victorine

texts.en:
Victorine is 42 and has five children. She has struggled - she has suffered from partial blindness, which has affected her entire life. Her children’s health and the death of her brother, who was very supportive, have caused more frustration in her life. These difficulties led her to seek assistance from GHAPE.

Victorine opened a restaurant with the help of GHAPE. Her family supports her business. This makes the work easier for her. She solves the problem of hunger in her community by supplying food to her neighbours every morning for breakfast. She employs youths to work on her vegetable farm. The profit from this business will allow her to pay school fees for her children and other family needs.

loans.use: Cooked food and Vegetable Business;  Farm

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Yorn is widowed with 3 children. She learned to weave silk in 1970 from her mother and she started making silk production since then. But stopped weaving during the Khmer Rouge regime and she began to weave again after 1979. She never goes to school.           

She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA for five cycles already. The current loan amount is $600. She will use this loan to buy silk material and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing thread on the loom and setting up one more loom for her daughter.

loans.use: Purchasing silk material and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing thread on the loom and setting up one more loom.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu is married with four children.  She sells utensils in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  Kadiatu’s business increased with her previous loan and she would like to expand it further.  At fifty years old, she is very much concerned about her children’s education especially those who are in college.  Although her husband does petty trading, his income is less than Kadiatu’s income.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $250.

loans.use: Diversify and expand her business.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en: Angel M. is single and lives in his parents' house, where he helps his parents in their farm. More specifically, he breeds sheep and goats. He is applying for this $750 loan in order to be able to buy fodder for the winter period.

loans.use: Purchasing fodder

loans.name: Ean

texts.en: Mrs. Ean H., 37, is a mother of three children and lives in Bathambong province, Cambodia.  She works selling Khmer cakes, earning on average about $3 each day, while her husband works as a construction foreman and typically makes about $3 per day.  Her three children are still too young to attend school yet.  Mrs. Ean H. hopes to use this loan to reinvest in her business, and use the remainder of the money to buy a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: To reinvest in her business and use the remainder of the money to buy a motorcycle for her family's transportation.

loans.name: Seyidsusen

texts.en:
Seyidsusen P. and her husband (her husband is pictured) own and operate a miscellaneous item store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi.

The store sells household items as well as some clothing items. Seyidsusen and her husband are currently looking for a loan of $950 so that they can expand and diversify their inventory.

loans.use: To expand and diversify their inventory.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.en:
Carmelo B. is 38 years old and is married to Alicia Rolon.  Together they have three children, a fourteen year old daughter and two younger sons.  During the week, Carmelo works as a mechanic, and on the weekends and some nights, he works as a taxi driver.  Carmelo works a lot, but does so in order to better the life of his wife and three children. 
He has been working with  Fundacion Paraguaya for only a short amount of time, less than a year.  Carmelo is asking for a loan to buy tools for his mechanic shop and to help develop his business.  His hope is that soon his shop will bring in enough money so that he does not have to work on the weekends.

loans.use: To buy a set  of keys and a hydraulic press.

loans.name: Endurance

texts.en: Endurance O. is married with 4 children. She is 43 years old and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells fish and has been in business since 2002. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more fish for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Marbelita

texts.es:
Señora Maribelita belongs to the communal bank called Las Azucenas located in the district of Yarina Cocha in Ucayali. She's 43 years old and a mother of 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter. With the first loan Maribelita obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invested by selling ice cream.

She continues in this business but she now makes a huge and wide variety of ice cream that she has obtained the help from her children who sell them in the city.

With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase Jell-O, sugar, sticks, small bags and milk.

Maribelita is very happy to be able to work and be independent. This way she's able to help her family financially.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maribelita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano. Ucayali Mz. D Lt. 17, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, su esposo es maderero. Maribelita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de chupetes y gelatinas. En la actualidad ella continúa con la venta de chupetes y gelatinas pero en mayores cantidades, con la ayuda de sus hijos preparan sus productos y salen a vender por la ciudad. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 10 Kg. de gelatina, 1 saco de azúcar, esencias, bolsitas, palitos, 1 caja de leche. Maribelita se siente muy bien por que puede trabajar y ser una mujer independiente y de esta manera apoya a su familia en los gastos económicos.

loans.use: To purchase basic ingredients to make ice-cream

loans.name: Jorge Felix

texts.es:
Jorge is 57 years old and he provides taxi services as well as deliveries for a courrier company. He has been separated from his wife for many years now and he took costudy of the kids. The youngest is still living with him but he started working about 8 months ago and he is starting to gain financial independence. His son is 21 years old.

He has been working as a taxi driver for many years now and he has gained a great deal of experience. He also provides courrier services for some companies. The competition in his line of work is high, but as the automotive sector grows so does the demand.

He would like to make general repairs to his car. The loan money will be enough to cover the labour costs as well as the parts he needs.

Jorge has been a member of his financial institution for many years, this being the seventh loan on credit that he is requesting from Agrocapital. He is not a member of any other financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge de 57 años de edad se dedica al transporte de pasajeros brindando servicios de taxi, ademas aprovecha en sus recorridos para hacer entregas de correspondencia para una empresa de courrier. Es separado de su esposa hace muchos años, el se hizo cargo de sus hijos, el ultimo esta todavia vivendo con él pero ya empezo a trabajar hace unos 8 meses atrás, por lo que ya esta independizandose economicamente, este su hijo tiene aproximadamente 21 años. Trabaja con taxi desde hace muchos años, por lo que tiene bastante experiencia. Tambien es conocido por algunas empresas de courrier las cuales contratan sus servicios. La competencia en el medio es media, asi como el parque automotor crece esta tambien creciendo la demanda. Realizara refacciones generales en su motor, el dinero le alcanzara para cubrir mano de obra y repuestos. Jorge trabaja bastante tiempo con la institución, este es el septimo crédito que solicita en Agrocapital. No trabaja con ninguna otra institución.

loans.use: Vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mr. Sim O., 61, and his wife, Mrs. Ven Sarat, 29, make cement roofing tiles. Their combined daily income is approximately $8. The couple has five children, two whom are married. They live in Chykreng District, Siem Reap Province.

He is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase more sand and cement as ingredients for the mixture they use to make roofing tiles. The loan will enable them to produce more tiles to sell at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase more sand and cement as ingredients for the mixture they use to make roofing tiles

loans.name: Sokky

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokky S., 34, and her husband, Mr. Sok-An Chheng, 44, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One of their children is a silk weaver and two others are in school; the youngest one stays at home.

Since she was fourteen years old, Sokky has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Sok-An has been a policeman for twenty years.

Sokky is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Ni Nengah Suciani

texts.id:
Nengah Suciani is a mother of two children and lives in the Batu Agung village in West Bali. Most of her daily activities are the same as those of any other housewife - namely, tending to her two children who are still in elementary school. At the moment her husband, Gede Darmawan, is a chauffeur. Nengah Suciani makes bamboo decorations for a living. In the Balinese language, these thin slices of bamboo resembling palm leaf ribs are called "semat" and are used in religious functions. She has undertaken this business for the past four years as there is uncertainty about her husband’s income. Making “semat” is something that can be done each daily. To create these decorations, Nengah Suciani must have enough supply of bamboo. A loan from DINARI foundation (channeled via her village’s central organization) will allow Nengah Suciani to add to her business’s working needs.

Nengah Suciani already has a regular roster of customers. The net earnings of Rp.20,000 per day (~ US $2) is just enough to cover daily necessities. Nengah Suciani lives in a house which is sufficiently comfortable with her husband and two kids.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Nengah Suciani itulah nama ibu yang sudah memiliki dua orang anak yang tinggal di desa Batu Agung, Bali barat. Kegiatan sehari-harinya layaknya seperti ibu rumah tangga lainnya, mengurus kedua anaknya yang masih duduk di bangku sekolah dasar. Sedangkan suaminya bernama Gede Darmawan, adalah seorang sopir. Nengah Suciani mempunyai usaha membuat kerajinan yang terbuat dari bambu. Dalam bahasa Bali dinamakan Semat ( bambu yang diiris tipis yang menyerupai batang lidi pohon kelapa, biasa dipergunakan sebagai bahan baku sarana persembahyangan ). Usaha ini digelutinya sudah 4 tahun lamanya karena ia tidak bisa berharap banyak dari penghasilan suaminya yg pas-pasan. Membuat semat adalah kegiatan rutin yang dilakukan setiap hari. Untuk membuat semat Nengah Suciani harus mempunyai persediaan bambu yang cukup. Dengan adanya bantuan modal dari yayasan DINARI yang disalurkan melalui organisasi yang ada didesanya Nengah Suciani berniat meminjam modal untuk menambah modal usahanya.
