Nengah Suciani sudah punya pelanggang tetap. Dengan pendapatan bersih Rp. 20.000.- per hari yang hanya cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-sehari. Nengah Suciani tinggal disebuah rumah yang terbuat dari gedeg yang cukup nyaman dan sejuk bersama suami dan kedua anaknya.

loans.use: Add to working capital to purchase material for her business

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena, de 32 años de edad, socia del banco comunal “Unión Pedregal”, quisiera que su negocio creciera más, ya que junto a su conviviente se dedican hace cuatro años a la venta de hamburguesas y sándwich en un pequeño local en el jirón la mar, una zona céntrica de la ciudad de Huaraz. 

Elena prepara los insumos y con la ayuda de su hija de 14 años, quien cuida a su hermanito menor, se dedican a este negocio.

El préstamo de S/. 500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, implementará el negocio comprando embutidos al por mayor y sillas para ambientar mejor el local.
texts.en:
Elena is 32 years old and is a member of the communal bank “Union Pedregal.” For four years, she and her partner have been selling hamburgers and sandwiches in a small stall in jiron la mar, a central neighborhood in the city of Huaraz. Her hope is to expand her business.

Elena prepares the ingredients with the help of her 14 year old daughter who also takes care of her younger brother. The loan of $175 - which she will pay in four months - will be used to purchase meats and to purchase chairs to improve the environment of business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meats and chairs for restaurant.

loans.name: Vivot

texts.en:
Vivot C., 33, and his wife, Sovanny Chea, 26, live in a small village off of National Road Number Two, which is about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have three children, two sons and one daughter.

Vivot has been working in a hotel in Phnom Penh for ten years. Sovanny stays at home to take care of their small children. She used to work in a Hotel as well. Vivort traves to work by  taxi and the cost is very high. Vivot wants to buy a motorcycle to drive to work. He is requesting a loan of US$300 to help purchase one motorcycle so he can drive to work.

loans.use: To add in his own money to purchase one motorcycle for driving to work.

loans.name: Paula Argentina

texts.es: La señora Paula Argentina A. tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el barrio los Martínez ubicado en la concepción, junto a su esposo y tres hijos, el esposo de la señora trabaja por si solo y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa. Esta señora es comerciante por lo cual nos solicita un monto de C$ 12,000.00 para comprar una cosecha de naranja y con lo que resta del dinero comprar materiales de construcción ya que su sueños es llegara tener un techo digno para darle mayor seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paula Argentina A. is 36 years old. She lives in the Martínez neighborhood in Concepción with her husband and three children. Her husband is self-employed and helps her with household expenses. Paula is a businesswoman and is requesting a loan of $625 to buy an orange harvest. With the remaining money, she plans to buy construction materials as she dreams of having a decent roof to make her home more secure for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stone, cement and sand to build a room

loans.name: Clara Domitila

texts.es:
La señora Clara Domitila es socia del BC “Las Violetas II”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Rioja, distrito de Nueva Cajamarca. Tiene 41 años de edad, es madre de 03 hijas, quienes están estudiando y son la razón de su lucha constante. Se dedica a la venta de verduras picadas y menestras sancochadas en su puesto del mercado de su distrito.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será  pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos verduras como repollo, zanahoria, ajíes, pepinos, coliflor, zapallo, apio, poro, y otras verduras que necesita para la preparación de los diferentes tipos de verduras picadas, ya sea para sopas, ensaladas, guisos, etc. así mismo comprará menestras como frijol canario, huasca, pinto entre otros para sancochar y venderlos al menudeo.  

Clara Domitila es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere crecer en su negocio Más adelante desea crecer en su negocio y llegar a ser una mayorista de verduras así como también anhela ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Clara is a member of The Violets II Communal Bank and lives in the San Martín region of Peru. She is a 41-year-old mother of three, and her children are all in school and her constant motivation. She makes a living selling vegetable dishes and stews at a post in her local market. With the loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within six months, she will purchase vegetables such as cabbage, carrots, chilis, peppers, cauliflower, pumpkins, celery, leeks and other vegetables that she needs to to make her different vegetable dishes (soups, salads, casseroles, etc.). She will also purchase different types of beans. Clara is a very hard-working woman who wants to grow her business. In the future, she would like to become a vegetable wholesaler and see her children become successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a wide variety of vegetables and beans.

loans.name: Zahar

texts.en:
Zahar is the son of M. S.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. His house is near the Kabul River and he is 24 years old. He is single and has three sisters and two brothers.

Zahar has a car part shop and has some good numbers of customers and he import different kinds of parts of car for his customers and he need for some money here and wants to expand his business.

 He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghans for the term of 12 months to make  his shop larger and complete his necessary materials to continue his business so he makes a good monthly income for his family. He is sure that after this loan he can do it.

Zahar is very happy with this procedure of small loans and thanks all lenders, specially Kiva.

loans.use: To expand his shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 56 años, tras el abandono del padre de su hijo se quedó con sus dos hijos y una niña que crió, sin ser su hija de sangre, pero que la considera como suya, actualmente están viviendo en su casa propia en el pueblo cerca a su chacra. Durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a cultivar y labrar la tierra, heredó los terrenos de sus padres donde siembra sus propios productos y también alquila, con la condición de que la persona da la semilla, abonos e insecticidas y Juana y sus hijos cultivan y cuidan de la producción, y en el momento de la cosecha la dividen en partes iguales, de este modo viene trabajando por muchos años.  En esta temporada de invierno en la sierra, siembra primero las arvejas para cosechar en el mes de abril, con estas ganancias cubre los gastos escolares de sus hijos, posteriormente siembra papa. 
Si siendo invierno, siembra la papa es atacada por plagas, por lo que tienen que comprar los medicamentos adecuados para que no se pierda la cosecha, en cambio si se siembra en los meses de abril o septiembre no invertirá en la cura y fumigado. Juana si es una socia muy activa en su banco comunal, siempre está dispuesta para cualquier comunicado o reunión que se tenga, y en los pagos siempre hace lo posible de pagar puntualmente. El dinero solicitado se invertirá en la compra de semilla de arvejas por kilos, abono y demás remedios e insecticidas para el fumigado.
texts.en:
After her son's father deserted them, she was left with two sons, and a daughter whom she has raised. She thinks of her daughter as her own, even though she is not hers by birth. Currently Juana lives with her family in her own home in the village near her farm. She inherited the land from her parents and has spent her life working and cultivating the fields, planting her own crops. She also rents some of the land out to people, who provide the seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, while Juana and her children cultivate and tend the crop. At harvest time they split the yield evenly. Juana has been working this way for many years. Now that it's wintertime in the Highlands, she will plant primarily peas, for harvest in April. Proceeds from that will cover school costs for the children. Later she will plant potatoes. Potatoes sown in the winter are prone to pests, so she has to buy pesticides to prevent losing the harvest. If she plants them during April or September, however, she doesn't have to invest in treatments and sprays. Juana is a very active member of her village bank. She is open to any kind of communication or meeting, and she always does everything in her power to make her payments on time. She will invest her loan in buying pea seeds by the kilo, and the rest in pest treatments and insecticides for fumigation.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
H. Rohat is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Rohat's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as an ecologist didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the family. This was the reason that Rohat decided to start her own business 9 years ago selling the fabrics of the national dresses.

Little by little, she has made her business grow and by allowing her clients to pay in installments, her orders are getting bigger. Now, her business is running smoothly; however, she would like to continue bettering herself and her business so her situation will be stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of $1000 USD that she will pay back in 3 months. With this money, Rohat will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for the national dresses. The power to help her business to grow is in your hands.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the seasonal fabrics for increasing the range of goods.

loans.name: Nakry

texts.en: Mrs. Nakry K. lives in Ta Tai village in Takeo province. She is a tailor in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Keom Han, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support his family. Mrs. Nakry K. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy timber to build a new house for her family to live in. She is a 26-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To build a new home.

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en:
Anitha is 30 years old, widowed, and has two children (twins) age 10. She also cares for four additional dependents.

Anitha has been a bites and cooking oil seller in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for 5 years. She belongs to the Namba Tatu loan group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $75. Every day she works at her business for three hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil to improve her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil to improve her business

loans.name: Atoae Mola Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa has been a charcoal and khanga seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Iringa for 6 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Mtumwa is 32 years old, married, and has two children, ages 9 and 1. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Asha, who also has her own small business in (Mikunguni) Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Tola

texts.en: Tola sells drinks. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 140,000 (USD 975) to purchase more drinks to sell. Tola, 38 years old, is married to A. and they have two children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Azamat

texts.ru: Шербеков  Азамат – мужчина  1958  года  рождения,  женат,  имеет   5  детей.  Занимается  откормом  и  продажей  скота.  Каждое  утро  он  отправляет  скот  на  пастбище  вместе  с  пастухом,  которому  платит  по  договорной  цене.  Его  жена  вместе  с  дочерьми  работает  в  колхозе.  Кроме  того  Шербеков  Азамат  покупает  у  пастухов  молодых  бычков  по  низкой  цене  и,  откормив,  через некоторое  время  перепродаёт  их  мясникам  по  хорошей  цене.  На  новый  кредит  он  рассчитывает  купить  партию  мелкорогатого  скота  и  отправить  их  на  пастбище  до  осени.
texts.en:
Azamat S., 51, is married and has 5 children. His main occupation is animal farming. Every morning, he sends the animals with a shepherd, whom he pays an arranged price. His wife and daughters work on a farm. In addition, Azamat purchases calves from shepherds at a fairly low price, fattens them, and after a period of time sells them to butchers for a profit. He plans to use this loan to purchase several calves and send them to pasture until fall.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vista Alegre”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 59 años D. edad es casada y madre D. 06 hijos,  no tiene estudios, y vive en el Barrio  Río D. la plata.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace ya 9 años aproximadamente.  Su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo uso para la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, D. los cuales ella invertirá S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles  para comprar D. ají y S/. 1800.00 nuevos soles para la compra D. ganado menor (ovejas).  Nos comenta que está enferma D. la vesícula y se trata con medicina natural.

Su mayor sueño es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana C. is a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” Microfinance Institute, located in the Queñuani community, district of Yunguyo, province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is a 59-year-old married mother of 6 children. She did not receive any formal schooling, and she lives in the Rio D. la Plata neighborhood.

She has been been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for approximately 9 years. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN, which she used to purchase small breed livestock.

At this time, she needs a 3,000.00 PEN loan, 1,200.00 of which will be used to purchase chili peppers, and 1,800.00 of which will be used to purchase livestock (sheep). She states that she has gallbladder problems that she is treating with natural medicine.

Her biggest dream is to continue working.

She likes the institute's meetings and the savings that she has been able to set asiD..

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock and chili peppers

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. is from Oroquieta City. She is 38 years old. Mercy is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Mercy owns & operates a sari-sari store business in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Mercy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Mercy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Olga De Jesus

texts.es: Olga es una mujer emprendedora solicito un primer préstamo para la compra de materia prima, ella se dedica a la confección de uniforme de enfermería y también uniformes de escuelas, ella desea y sueña en ver a sus hijos profesionales  y una casa bonita de dos niveles, es por ello que ha logrado comprar otra maquina de coser esto le ayudara a producir mas y tener ganancias en su negocio, el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de materia prima porque trabaja a base de pedidos siempre en su negocio la apoya su esposo y sus hijos se sienten muy felices porque le ha ido muy bien porque tiene bastante pedidos, y sus clientes saben de la calidad de trabajo que realiza asegura que con la ayuda de Dios todo le saldrá bien y lograra realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Olga is an entrepreunerial women requesting her first loan to purchase raw material. She is dedicated to creating nurse uniforms and also school uniforms. She wants and dreams of seeing her children become professionals and having a pretty two story house. It is for this that she has purchased another sewing machine to help her produce more and have greater earnings in her business, the loan is needed to buy raw materials because she works based on orders. In her business she always has the support of her husband and children and it makes them happy because she has done well because she has enough orders and her clients know the quality of her work that she does. With the help of God everything will go well and she will realize her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
CAROL M. is 34 years old, married with 3 school-age children and is a resident of Irrigation Taloc, Bago City, Negros Occidental.

She showed her business acumen at an early age, and her parents discovered that she could independently handle a business venture even then. When she got married, she decided to set up a traveling sales business. With the help of her husband, she and her crew would move from town to town, set up a tent and display a wide variety of products for sale to the locals during their town's market day. A customer can buy anything from barrettes or hair accessories to brooms and floor mats, flashlights, baseball caps to clothes hangers, and other stuff from Carol's traveling store.

Although this is very hard work, involves long hours and requires a lot of traveling, Carol finds that the financial returns is worth the effort. She has used her previous loans to stock up on the fast moving items in her inventory. And for this 20th loan cycle from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carol wants to borrow PHP 50,000.00 to again add more items to her very wide variety of product offerings.

Carol is very determined to work hard to provide a good and comfortable living for her family. She is also setting aside some of her profits for the education of her 3 children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL WORKING CAPITAL & INVENTORY

loans.name: Morenike

texts.en: Morenike is 45 years old. She is married and has four children. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years. Morenike sells noodles in cartons. She has been in this business for nine years. Morenike is requesting a loan of N140,000 to purchase more noodles to sell. She promises to pay back promptly and says "thank you."

loans.use: To purchase noodles to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 20 inner tubes, 20 tires, 15 pedals, 25 spark plugs, and various other spare parts

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en: Kuch N., aged sixty, is married and lives in Takeo province with her three children. She and her husband sell dried and fermented fish at the market, making around US$7 each day, and are also supported by one of their children who works as a mechanic. Inflation has caused prices to soar in Cambodia, and recent hikes in oil and rice prices have caused economic struggles for many Cambodians. Looking for ways to increase her income and combat rising costs, Kuch N. has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$1200 to purchase more fish to sell. She sees this loan as an opportunity to increase her income and to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Vilma Teresa

texts.es: La Señora Vilma Teresa D. C. tiene la edad de 40 años, es una madre muy responsable junto a su hijo que está a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, ya que fue por medio de su Mama que aprendió esta actividad, por lo que no tenia casa propia pero poco a poco lucho, con todos los desafíos que a diario enfrentaba para salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de materia prima. El sueño de Vilma es seguirle proporcionando mejoras a su vivienda para un futuro.
texts.en:
Vilma Teresa D. C. is 40. She is raising her son, and she is a very responsible mother. She makes and sells tortillas. She has had this business for over five years. She learned this activity from her mother. She did not have her own house. But she fought, little by little, against all of the daily challenges she faced in order to get ahead. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy raw material. Vilma’s dream is to continue making improvements on her house for a future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
“Through patience and sacrifices, we will survive.” These are words of encouragement from Erlinda, a resident of Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to a man named Benjamin, and they have one son and two daughters. Two of the children finished a vocational course and the youngest is still in college.

Her husband works as a construction worker in Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya, while Erlinda manages a small sari-sari store (a community-based general store) in their village as her way of helping her husband earn a living.  Since her income is not sufficient to meet the needs of her family, she wants to increase her business capital by borrowing a loan of PHP 14,000 from Kiva lenders.  This amount will be used to purchase different merchandise for her store.  With patience and sacrifices, and the continued support of Kiva lenders, Erlinda believes that she can improve her small sari-sari store.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es: El banco comunal " Virgen D. Fátima " esta representada por la señora Silvia Liliana y conformado por 14 miembros trabajadores y se encuentran ya en su tercer ciclo  con expectativas D. lograr mejores ingresos y demostrando ganas D. salir adelante con honestidad, responsabilidad y trabajo. Las socias desempeñan diferentes tipos D. actividades comerciales como la venta D. pan, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. comida y venta D. cosméticos,  sus actividades son desarrolladas en sus propios domicilios y otros trabajan D. forma ambulante. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores son negociantes grandes pero las socias tienen sus clientes que constantemente generan el movimiento económico necesario para un ingreso diario. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. mercadería  para surtir sus tiendas,  y compra D. insumos en mayor como azúcar, harina y las promotoras D. cosméticos aprovecharon las ofertas para una mejor ganancia que ayudara al sustento D. sus familias y al mejoramiento D. su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The Virgen D. Fatima Communal Bank, represented by Ms. Silvia Liliana, is comprised of 14 hard-working group members who are currently in their third loan cycle. They expect to earn better profits, demonstrating the desire to get ahead through honesty, responsibility and work. The group members run different businesses, such as selling bread, provisions, fast food, or cosmetics. They either work from home or as street vendors. Regarding competition, we can mention that their competitors are skilled businesspeople, but the group members have a solid client-base that generates the flow of money that is necessary for daily profits. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise to restock their shops, and purchase goods in bulk, such as sugar and flour. The cosmetic vendors will take advantage of the ongoing sales to make more profits and help support their families and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap P. is a villager in Prey Mei Lang Thboung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Nhanh Touch, is a construction worker.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family. In order to improve the family, Mrs. Sopheap P. decided to ask for a loan to buy coffee, glasses, plates, and ingredients to make snacks to sell; she will use the rest of money to buy a battery for bright light. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy coffee, glasses, plates, and ingredients to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn G. is 48 years of age and is a resident of Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is a fisherman and they are blessed with four children, three of whom already have their own families.

This is Marilyn’s 2nd loan. The purpose of her loan is to have additional capital for her fishing business because she has a vision that it will expand or grow and turn into a big business. Aside from that, if it will become successful and will also help the family’s future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Nelicel

texts.en: Nelicel B. is from the village of Danao. She is 26 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Nelicel owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2005, Nelicel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen M. is from the village of Unidos. She is 52 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Helen owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month. In 2004, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Helen is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 10th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Jordiana

texts.en:
Jordiana A. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 47 years old. Jordiana is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jordiana owns and operates a business venture providing recycling services. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Jordiana has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jordiana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jordiana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. Jordiana is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jordiana from HSPFI. She plans to reinvest the additional revenue generated from the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional scrap metal to sell

location.town: Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil H. has always distinguished himself as being a very hardworking person and devoted to his wife and four children who are the apple of his eye.

Adil manages his own business, a grocery store, which he started more that fifteen years ago. Thanks to his business, Adil has been able to help his family.

Today Adil requests a loan of 1,600 AZN. He needs you and, through your generosity, you can help him expand his business so that he may continue to support his children's education.

Please help Adil and his family by becoming part of the development of his small business. Adil will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita B., 29 years old, is engaged in a fish-selling business. Her husband is a fisherman and they work together to be able to earn income and accommodate their needs.

Rosita wishes to buy new fishing nets and bait and also desires additional capitalization for her fish-selling business. She hopes to receive a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will really help to buy the fishing materials.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and bait and to add capital to her fish-selling business

loans.name: Angel Segundo

texts.es:
Ángel Segundo A. M. tiene 44 años, es casado, y  tiene siete hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Ángel trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, habas  y papas  además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como chanchos los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Ángel hacer deporte en la comunidad y ver televisión. 

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Ángel Segundo A. M. is 44 years old, married, and has 7 children. He lives in the district of Guaranda in Bolívar province. Ángel is a member of the rural group Grupo Enmanuel, which is in a place located 45 minutes from the Guaranda capital in Bolívar province. There are 17 members in total, and it is an agricultural and livestock community. The people are indigenous and speak Quechua. Ángel works in agriculture to increase his family's economies. The crops that are most successul are maize, broad beans and potatoes. He also works breeding pigs, whose products he sells in his home. What he sows he sells in Guaranda's principle market every 6 months. An important part of the local culture is the carnival, which is celebrated every year in February. Ángel also does sports in the community and likes to watch television. Ángel is seeking a loan to purchase products for his work, principally fertilisers. His goal is to generate good economy activity for his family. The difficulties that he encounters are weather conditions and the diseases that affect the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
Rosendo, tiene 42 años y tiene cinco hijos, él es un padre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario apoyar a sus hijos.

Rosendo se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, él sale a trabajar a las 4 de la madrugada y se queda hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días.  Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. (Mototaxi es una motocicleta de tres ruedas y con techo que se usa como medio de transporte popular para trechos cortos a cambio de dinero de la misma forma que un taxi.).
  
Rosendo pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son tres años que participa en el banco comunal. Su primer crédito del socio fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, el socio requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del mototaxi. El anhelo del socio es comprarse un carro. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosendo is 42 years old and has 5 children. He is a responsible father who searches with daily effort and every moment for opportunities to get ahead for his children. Rosendo is dedicated to offering transportation services in his mototaxi (a motorcyle with 3 wheels and a roof that is a popular form of transportation for short trips, in exchange for money, just like a taxi.). He goes to work at 4:00 am and stays until 8:00 at night every day. Its now 10 years that he has been in this business and things have gone well, thanks to the effort he puts into his work. Rosendo belongs to the “Tercer Milenio” (Third Millennium) Communal Bank of the Asociación Arariwa. He has participated for 3 years now. His first loan was for $100 dollars and was invested in his business. At present he needs a loan to perform maintenance on his mototaxi. His goal is to buy a car. Rosendo is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and, also, he is committed to complying with the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FOR NECESSARY MAINTENANCE ON HIS MOTOTAXI (MOTORCYCLE TAXI)

loans.name: Kindo

texts.en:
Kindo S. is a good member of LAPOSL.  She is 35 years old, married to a businessman, and has three children, two girls and a boy.Two of the children are in primary school and the last one is still a baby.

Kindo sells bags of sachet water and bottles of  pure water on Lumley Street in the centre of Freetown. She has been in this busness for the past nine years and has taken four previous loans With her previous loan, she opened a shop and bought a deep freezer.

Kindo wanted a loan of 3,000,000 Leones to enable her to travel out of Sierra Leone to a neighbouring country to buy more goods so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy sachet water and bottled water

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 48 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus tres hijos adultos. Reside en la localidad de San Francisco, ubicada en la selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su casa propia.

Ella se caracteriza por ser una persona emprendedora y tenaz, desde hace 22 años se dedica al servicio de peluquería. Los meses de julio, octubre, noviembre y diciembre son las épocas donde obtiene mayores ingresos debido a las fechas festivas que se realizan en su localidad.
Generalmente trabaja por sí sola, pero en tiempo de campaña necesita de ayudantes, siendo su rutina diaria de 8:00 AM a 9:00 PM. Pero no contenta con ello, para el futuro piensa ampliar su peluquería, introduciendo nuevas máquinas de lavado y planchado de cabello, con el propósito de captar más clientes y a la vez ofrecer cortes de cabello, teñidos y ondulaciones a menores precios, con respecto a su competencia.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago y a la vez agradece a la institución por la facilidades de préstamo que le brindan. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la compra de tintes para todo tipo de cabello, con el resto adquirirá revistas de belleza.
texts.en:
Lidia, age 48, lives with her life partner and father of their three adult children. They live in the San Franscisco area, which is in the Ayachucan jungle. They have their own house there. She is characterized as being a hard-working and tenacious person. She has been working as a hairdresser for 22 years. The months of July, October, November, and December are times when she gets the greatest earnings due to the dates of the holidays they celebrate in her area. She generally works by herself. But, during the holiday season she needs helpers as her daily routine is from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. But, she is not content with it. In the future she plans to expand her hair salon. She will introduce new washing machines and hair irons. She will do this to gain more customers. At the same time she offers haircuts, weavings, and perms at lower prices than her competition. This is her first loan with MFP. She promises to fulfill her payment obligations. She is grateful to the institution for the ease of the loan that they offer. She will use the requested money to buy tints for all types of hair. With the rest of the money she will get beauty magazines.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hair tints

loans.name: Edilberta Nicida

texts.es:
Edilberta es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik, palabra en quechua que significa Nuestra Fuerza. Edilberta es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos.
Edilberta tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes en general y verduras, esta actividad la realiza todos los días de lunes a domingo.
Edilberta necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Edilberta son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y su negocio vaya bien.
texts.en:
Edilberta is a member of the Kallpanchik comunal bank. (Kallpanchik means “Our Strength” in the Quechua language.) Edilberta is 31 years old and has two children. She has a store in a rented location, where she sells general groceries and vegetables. She works seven days a week. Edilberta needs a loan of 1,050 PEN ($375) which she will use to invest in various types of cereal. She hopes that her children will be able to complete their studies and that her business does well.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Dios Proveera (G 1,2,3) Group

texts.en:
GracieL. is the coordinator of her group Dios Proveera (God Will ProviD.). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in L. Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the sugar cane harvest, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and her two children.

GracieL. is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her fuel sales business, buying charcoal, gasoline, as well as other general products for resale (beans, etc.) She will use the profits to save money towards setting up a larger place. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy fuel (charcoal, gasoline) and other products (beans, etc.) for resale

loans.name: Port

texts.en:
Mrs. Port S. has spent her life cultivating crops on her own farmland. This is a skill she learnt from her grandparent when she was young. Port S. is now married and is blessed with six children: two are married and the other four are single. Most of her children are employed, while her husband frequently works alongside her on the farm. 

Growing crops is an annual activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for growing, however, Port S. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So, she is looking for a loan to hire a laborer to plow the farmland, and to buy fertilizers, insecticides, a pump and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides, a pump and seeds

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has three children. She is an entrepreneur from Kamenka who runs a small business selling food items in the local market. 

Svetlana sells groceries, tea, coffee, and fruit. She owns a nice big vending kiosk with good quality refrigerated coolers and a wide selection of groceries for sale. She has been in this business for ten years. Currently, Svetlana has about 60,000 UAH in turnover capital. Her profit amounts to 7,000-8,000 UAH a month. 

Svetlana is requesting a loan of 16,000 UAH to purchase inventory in bulk. Svetlana’s long-term goal is to open her own little grocery store. She has already purchased land for construction work on it.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Thirty-five-year-old Bimala N., who is married and has three children aged 16, 12, and 9, supports her family by working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day in her grocery shop business which she established in 2007. Bimala has already received and repaid one loan from Patan BPW which she used to increase store inventory, the same intended purpose behind her request for a new loan. In the future, she plans to expand the business. Bimala thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While typical pasals might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business-training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To buy more goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger, de 30 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y amoroso, vive en la casa de sus suegros junto a su esposa Nataly de 29 años y su querida hija Juliana de 2 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El taller de mecánica donde trabaja Roger es uno de los más solicitados en la ciudad de Lima, ya que los autos salen muy bien reparados después de los rigurosos arreglos que les brinda. Desde muy joven aprendió esta labor, puesto que ha trabajado en muchos talleres anteriormente, lo cual ha hecho que sea muy hábil en esta actividad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dejar los carros como nuevos, ya que se esmera mucho en repararlos, lleva 4 años trabajando como mecánico y considera que lo más difícil es cargar los pesados repuestos que tiene que colocar a algunos carros. Para el futuro, espera abrir su propio taller con el cual pueda mejorar los ingresos que actualmente tiene. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, tiene muchas ganas de pagar a tiempo y sin demora, ya que desea acceder a más créditos. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará nuevos repuestos para arreglar mejor los autos.
texts.en:
30-year old Roger is a hardworking, loving father. He and his 29-year old wife Nataly live with her parents and their beloved daughter 2-year old Juliana. He wants to provide a better quality of life for them. Roger works as a mechanic in one of the most sought-after garages in the city of Lima. Cars that leave there have always been carefully repaired. He learned this trade as a young man, and since then he has worked in many garages and become very skilled. What he most enjoys about his work is making cars like new again, and he does his best to repair them well. Roger has been doing this work for four years and considers that the most difficult part of his job is being responsible for the big repairs he has to do on some cars. In the future Roger hopes to have his own workshop and increase the money he currently earns. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he is very keen to pay back the money on time without any delays so that he can get more loans in the future. With the 1000 soles that he is asking for, he will buy new spare parts so he make better repairs to the cars.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy car spare parts

loans.name: Litia

texts.en:
Litia T. is 30 and married with five children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Litia has many years of experience in this business.  Litia needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Litia joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Litia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Ham

texts.en:
Mrs. Ham Y. has been spending almost her entire life raising crops and a few animals to make a profit. She is married and has four children, one of whom is already married and lives away from home and the other three are single. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. 

Ham Y. has a single son who needs a partner in his wife, but he requires money to make a wedding party. Because he doesn’t have money yet, Mrs. Ham Y. has decided to pursue a loan to be used to spend on a wedding party for her son.

loans.use: To spend on wedding party for her son.

loans.name: Nery Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Nery y nos cuenta algo de su vida, está casada hace 20 años y tiene 4 hijos tres mayores y una de 17 años que estudia el último año de colegio. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de atún en la ciudad de Manta. Es su cuarto ciclo en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque comparte buenos momentos con sus amigas en las reuniones.

Se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00. Además fabrica y vende bolos (helado de hielo en funda) de distintos sabores los mismos que son muy apetecidos por sus clientes, la mercadería la compra en  Portoviejo y en ciertos casos los recibe en su local,  le encanta su trabajo porque siempre está en contacto con todas sus amigas que son sus clientes.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar mercadería para surtir aun más su tienda, en especial va a comprar tanques de gas para vender ya que por allí cerca no hay depósitos.

Su deseo es construir otro piso en su casa.
texts.en:
The community bank named Maria the Helper meets in the La Sequita district belonging to Montecristi in the Manabita region. The population is hard working, dedicated, and proud of their heritage. La Sequita is a district whose inhabitants are honest and only want to work and support their families. Here we meet Nery and she tells us about her life. She has been married for 20 years and she has 4 grown children and a daughter that is 17 years old and in her last year of college. Her husband works in a tuna factory in the city of Manta. This is the Community Bank's fourth loan cycle and she enjoys being a member because she shares good times with her friends at their meetings. She is a salesperson and she has a grocery store. She works every day from 6a.m. until 10p.m. She also makes ice creams (water based treats sold in tubs) of various flavors, an excellent treat to offer her clients. She makes her purchases in Portoviejo. She loves her work because she is always in contact with her friends, who are also her clients. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise to restock her store. She will purchase tanks of gas to sell because there are no depots close by. Her dream it to build another story on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, eggs, tanks of gas,etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine A., 49, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo A., a salesman. She is the mother of three children, all of whom are living at home and helping her manage the household and the business. By the grace of God, Josephine has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them all the way through college, a dream for most Filipino parents like Josephine. She herself has been a college undergraduate, and she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Josephine maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. Josephine buys her customers' orders in cash and then gives them to the customers. The customers have one month to pay her. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits. Josephine's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 16000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Josephine dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for her customers' orders

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
El Señor Filomena A. A. tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene dos hijo al cual ayuda y apoya en su educación, La clienta se dedica a la producción de banano y otros cultivos, en banano produce 240 chipas con un ingreso anual. La cliente cuenta con una experiencia como agricultor con más de 3 años experiencia la cual le ayuda a conocer bien el mercado donde se desenvuelve. La cliente entrega su producto a los comerciantes de los distintos mercados locales de la zona y comerciantes mayoristas que  venden sus productos a los diferentes mercados de las ciudades capitales. Dicha actividad económica no les alcanza para vivir cómodamente es por eso que la señora cuenta con otra actividad, comerciante de ropa al por menor, por lo cual necesita capital de operación para incursionar en esta actividad.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de mercadería, para contar con una variedad de productos y ponerlos a la venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Filomena A. A. is 36 years old.  She is married and has two children whom she helps with their education.   She produces bananas and other crops.  One banana can produce 240 chips which augments her annual income.  Mrs. Filomena has over 3 years experience in agriculture which helps her understand the market where she works.  She delivers her produce to the tradesmen for each of the local markets in the zone.  The wholesale traders then sell the products to the different markets in the capital cities.  This economic activity doesn’t bring in enough to allow them to live comfortably, so she also works in clothing retail and for this, she needs working capital.

This is the first loan Mrs. Filomena has obtained from our institution.  The loan will be used to buy merchandise in order to have a variety of products to sell.

loans.use: Capital de operación, compra de mercadería

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is a 47-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is into poultry. He has been operating this business for the last 10 years. He also started from a meek background, having 100 chicks and graduated to trading at least 500 chicks. He says that although he is faced with the challenge of plague in the poultry business, he has hopes of becoming a big commercial poultry farmer and role model. Johnson intends to use the credit facility to buy layers and broilers for his poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy layers and broilers for his poultry farm.

loans.name: Mauline

texts.en:
Mauline is 32 yrs old. She is married and the mother of four children aged between four and 12, all attending school. She has been practising mixed farming  for the last 12 years, producing tea, maize, milk and bananas which she sells locally. She has requested this loan of KES45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow which she hopes will bring in enough income to assist in school fees, thus improving the family's living standard. In five years she hopes to establish a retail shop.

The challenge she faces is a poor road network in the area and delays in transportation.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of frozen meat, fish, rice, cooking oil, seasonings, etc

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel N., aged 40 years, hawks household items like basins, buckets, cups, sufurias (pots), and CDs around the Mwiki area. He is married to Eunice Wambaire, who runs a green grocery shop to financially support their family. Together they have three sons: Antony, aged 15 years, Newton, aged 13 years, and Brian, aged 11 years. He was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Thika Road office.

Samuel has been running this business for a period of 12 years, and makes a monthly profit of Kshs 8,000. This loan of Kshs 18,000 is his second loan with KADET. He plans to use the loan to add stock of sufurias (pots), plates, basins and buckets. If the loan boosts the business, he will rent a shop and stock his goods there instead of hawking.

Samuel hopes to become a supplier of household goods and to employ young people as salespeople.

loans.use: To stock CDs, sufurias (pots), and cups for sale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 43 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Luis Alberto de 48 años y sus 2 hijos, de los cuales se hace cargo del menor, pues el mayor trabaja y es independiente. Desde hace 5 años, esta empeñosa mujer se dedica a la confección en pedrería en diversas prendas de vestir, y le gusta mucho su labor pues la desempeña por horas en un taller donde una amiga le proporciona a ella junto con otras cuatro señoras para que borden a través de un intermediario. Esta muy satisfecha porque obtiene regulares ganancias que le han permitido sacar a sus hijos adelante, y le gusta bastante pues lo desempeña por tiempos y no descuida los quehaceres de su hogar. Generalmente trabaja durante cuatro días a la semana durante las mañanas y le entretiene bastante; además como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado trabajar en el mismo rubro, pero sin intermediarios, de esta manera espera salir adelante. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Nancy tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios rollos de tela que necesita, pues tiene un pedido pendiente para cumplir y también quiere empezar a independizarse, de esta manera espera seguir adelante.
texts.en: Nancy, age 43, lives in her own home with her husband Luis Alberto, age 48, and their 2 children. She cares for her younger child, and the older child works and is independent. For 5 years this enterprising woman has made beaded clothing. She likes her job a lot, and works for hours with four other women in a workshop owned by a friend. They work for an intermediary. She is very satisfied because she makes a regular income that has allowed her to get her children ahead. She likes her work a lot and she works but does not have to forget about her housework. She generally works four days a week in the mornings, and she has a lot of fun. Since she is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to work in the same field but without intermediaries; this way, she hopes to get ahead. This is her third loan with MFP and she promises to pay her quotas punctually, as she does not want to disappoint those who have made this loan possible. This loan will allow her to continue working in the search of progress. Nancy plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of various rolls of fabric that she needs. She has a pending order to fill and also wants to start becoming independent. This way, she hopes to continue getting ahead.

loans.use: to purchase various rolls of fabric

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a married woman with two children. Her husband is a taxi driver.  Because he does not  earn much income, she started her own business breeding cattle to help support their family. As she had previous experience working on the farm, her business went well. Today Habiba has two cows. She also has enough hay and forage.  She calculated that her fodder is enough for even more cattle, so she decided to take a loan to purchase more cattle. 

Habiba has gained a reputation of being responsible with her financial obligations and for keeping her word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with the operation of her business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Wael

texts.en: Wael is 31 years old, married, and comes from Jericho. He lives with his wife and 4 children, none of whom have entered school. In 2006, Wael opened his own tire store and is now hoping that through this loan he will be able to buy new equipment and new supplies for his store. He hopes that this will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy new equipment and supplies for his business

loans.name: Mary Ann's Group

texts.en:
Mary Ann is from the village of Dioyo, Sapang Dalaga. She is 31 years old. Mary Ann is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mary Ann is a single mother with one infant child. To make a living, Mary Ann owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a grocery store. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mary Ann joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to start her business. Mary Ann is requesting her seventh loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Nyamawi

texts.en:
Nyamawi T. is a married man with four children, three of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

He has operated a goat meat selling business for the past two years, selling at wholesale to butcher shop operators. 

Nyamawi faces a major challenge of delayed payments and seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand and improve his living standards in the future.

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his mode of living. With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase goats to sell as goat meat.

loans.use: To purchase goats to sell for meat

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Rehema has operated a beauty salon for the past ten years; her potential customers are the neighboring community. Rehema faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of adding more stock to her beauty salon in the future. Rehema plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase chemicals and cosmetics for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and cosmetics

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir A. is 30 years old and he works as a farmer. He is married and has two sons. His main business is farming and cattle breeding, which provide him with the means to meet the needs of his family. He is very experienced and has the special skills in livestock care that help him to develop his business. He raises and sells livestock and also sells meat and milk. 

Samir is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to enable him to purchase more cattle. The loan will greatly improve Samir’s income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: purchase five calves and fodder

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie works hard to support her family. Tessie is married. She has a business buying and selling peanuts in the Philippines.

Tessie requested a loan of PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of peanuts to sell.

Tessie has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Tessie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter A. O. is 38 years old and married. His wife is a business lady and they have two children, ages 16 and 11 years old, whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. 

Peter's business is located in the busy Juakali market in Nairobi. He makes and sells items such as steel doors, metal boxes and cookers. He serves the local people. He has been in this business for 14 years now. He says that his business is profitable, but a major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He will use his loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy scrap metal to expand his business. He hopes to grow his business and open another one up-country. He describes himself as aggressive and committed to his work.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es socia del Banco Comunal Diamante, tiene 38 años y es soltera. Se dedica la venta de cosméticos.
Patricia es de profesión Profesora en Educación Inicial trabaja en la mañanas en una Institución Educativa particular. Está en FINCA Perú, desde hace tres años, ingresó por la invitación de una amiga. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos.
Le gusta la reunion de su Banco Comunal por los ahorros, gracias a sus ahorros pudo incrementar su capital de trabajo. Ahora está ahorrando para comprarse un departamento.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the communal bank "Diamante". She is 38 years old and she is single. She sells cosmetics. Patricia is a primary school teacher by profession and she works in the mornings at a private educational institution. She has been with Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 3 years. She joined following an invitation from a friend. The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics.

She appreciates her communal bank group for the savings. It is thanks to her savings that she has been able to increase her working capital. She is saving to buy herself a condo. 

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 33 years old, married, and blessed with an eight-year-old child.  She hires cars to earn a living.  She has been in the business for ten years.  She also supplies cheese to supplement her income.  Previously, she was selling clothes to earn a living.  She appreciates Faulu Kenya because she has learned to save her money.  Her desire is to own a tour firm in the future.  She has requested 20,000 KES to service her cars.

loans.use: To service her cars

loans.name: Marcia Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora. Marcia es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza de sus paisajes, su centro colonial, su cultura, tradiciones, gastronomía y su gente.
 
Doña Marcia tiene 38 años, es divorciada, no tiene hijos pero se encuentra a la tutela de una sobrina que es huérfana, ella tiene 9 años de edad y estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Marcia es comerciante de todo tipo de ropa, esta actividad la desempeña hace 20 años, su mercadería  vende en sus tiempos libres y fines de semana. Hace 2 meses  trabaja cuidando adultos mayores pero solo medio día. También tiene un puesto en la esquina de su casa donde vende chuzos (carne en palito).

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 12 años y todos los cerditos le han beneficiado en sus negocios. El dinero de este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Marcia is a member of the communal bank, Nuevos Horizontes ("New Horizons").  She lives in the city center of Cuenca, a place known for its beautiful landscape, colonial city center, culture, tradition, gastronomy, and people.  

Señora Marcia is 38 years old, divorced, and doesn't have any children but is the guardian of her niece, whom is an orphan.  Her niece is 9 years old and goes to a local school in the city.  They don't own their home but rent it.

Señora Marcia is a vendor of different types of clothing.  She began this form of business over 20 years ago.  She sells her merchandise during her free time and on the weekends.  For the past two months, she has been taking care of senior citizens part time.  She also has a stall on the corner near her house where she sells meat on a stick.

She has been a member of her communal bank for over 12 years and all of the credits have benefited her businesses.  The money from this credit will be invested in the purchase of clothing, such as pants, blouses, shirts and kids' clothes.  

Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Marcia Gioconda

texts.es:
Marcia Gioconda tiene 24 años, es soltera vive con la mama y no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Marcia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz en terrenos de madre trabajn juntas. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. Su sueño es ayudar economicaente a la madre ya que ellas viven solas.

Le gusta conversar con la madre y salir a pasear.
texts.en:
Marcia Gioconda is 24 years old and single, she lives with her mother and doesn't have any children.  She lives in the Ventanas Canton in the Province of Los Rios.

This group is called SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, and is located in the Sibimbe district which is part of the Ventanas Canton.  This group has 20 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Marcia works in agriculture growing corn and rice on her mother's fields which they farm together.  Purchases are made in Ventanas every month and products sold at the market in the same locality.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of the loan would help her financially to meet her needs. She faces challenges such as pests that attack the crops.  Her dream is to help her mother financially, and that they can live on their own.

She likes to chat with her mother and go for walks.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Traders Assoc. Group

texts.en:
Margrette was born in Makeni about 37 years ago. She is married with three children, two in primary school and one in secondary school. Margrette is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs.

Margrette sells jeans, sneakers, t-shirts, portmanteaux (large suitcases), etc. She has been in business for five years now.

Margrette will use her share of the loan (1,500,000 SLL) to buy the above-mentioned items in large quantities for her business. With the help of this loan, she and her group member will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes in large quantities for her business.

loans.name: Altantuul

texts.en:
Altantuul is a 40-year-old divorced woman who lives with her three daughters in a rented apartment in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar city.  Her youngest daughter, who is 11 years old, attends secondary school. 

Altantuul manages a Mongolian traditional shoe-making business with the help of her daughters. She started her business in 2000 and is planning to expand it in the future. All of her children make a variety of shoes for all ages and Altantuul herself is responsible for selling the goods. They produce and manufacture the shoes in their home. 

Altantuul sells her goods at a rented stall at Narantuul market, one of the busiest markets in Mongolia. She is a diligent and honest woman who is planning to purchase large amount of materials for her business in order to make a collection of shoes before Naadam, Mongolia's biggest national holiday. She says, "I am one of the trusted loan recipients of XacBank, and I am happy to have a long-term relationship with XacBank." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her shoe-making business.

loans.name: Fe Y Alegria Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Eulidia es la presidenta D. la Alcancía Comunal “Fe y Alegría”, conformada por 7 integrantes, el nombre lo eligieron porque la mayoría D. mamás que fundaron el grupo tenían a sus hijos estudiando en el colegio Fe y Alegría, además se sintieron identificadas con el significado D. estas palabras.
Eulidia es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza y productos naturales por catálogo desD. hace más D. 8 años.
